--yWaDaWUMUd3vUqSmvmCg.text: Amazing!  Great food, great concept!  We kept going back!

UdwEJLrNPwDvaD9yaSUxNQ.text: All bfast burritos are great.  Wish the salsa was more flavorful/spicy.  Love that they have sundried tomato wraps.  Hummus plate for $5 is an absolute steal.  So big & good (homemade hummus, broccoli, tomatoes, carrots, etc.).  SUPER friendly & fast service, both inside and drive thru.  Love the decor/colors, vibe.  Espresso could be better, it was a little bitter.  I want to try everything on the menu.  It all sounds so great.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

B-vPr-D24YdT5idAQNcwtw.text: At first, I was really skeptical about the reviews regarding the California club sandwich:  it's just a club sandwich and what do you expect to be different from others? But immediately after my first bite of the California club, I know that it is the best club sandwich that I've ever had! It's a perfect combination of avocado, bacon, tomato, and most importantly, the sour cream: it made my day great! With respect to the decor and space, I would say that it is pretty cozy and relaxed, but the space is limited. I would definitely go and try other stuff.

IA6FqjbmETHKprxpVqHQnA.text: I've been to both the Apache location and this one several times. Both locations are top notch.   I love coming here for a quick and healthy breakfast. The atmosphere is really laid back and the service is always great. I am a creature of habit but may I recommend the veggie breakfast burrito? Oh. My. God. It's divine. It's balanced and filling-and I feel like I'm starting my day off right. The iced coffees are so yummy, but beware of knowing what size to order... I went for the large Americano once and got a thirstbuster of espresso!   The only drawback of both locations is the parking lot, especially this one. It's quite small and hard to navigate.   Overall, I highly recommend checking this place out if you're looking for a place with healthy breakfast and lunch options & great coffee. There's something to satisfy both vegetarians and meat eaters alike!

CqU3aS4gpHquojON4DJBnA.text: By far my go to place for lunch and breakfast! When living in Arizona I would come here twice a day sometimes almost everyday! I love everything on the menu and the staff is always friendly. Haven't been here in over a year but I gotta say D'lish is by far my go to place in scottsdale and tempe!

dxgPCIWGdyAsAhOEAstfWQ.text: Such a cute coffee/breakfast/lunch spot. All the food on the menu is super delish! (Hence the name) I love their turkey sausage breakfast burrito and breakfast sandwiches are good also. It is always busy so keep in mind it will take awhile waiting at the drive-thru, but, that shows how good the food is! They are fast and efficient at getting your order in as timely as they can by having car hoppers take your order in advance at the drive thru.

44HVYUNSdyivJ0_VoAY9CA.text: My first thought when I came here was, I hope the food is worth the wait. And It was.  My fellow yelpers never do me wrong, so I had to go with the California Club and Breakfast Buzz.  Both lived up to the numerous good reviews.  I just loved the Breakfast Buzz's hint of peanut butter flavor. I am pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food considering they have a drive through.  This place is most definitely not your typical fast food restaurant.  If you have not come here yet, give it a try you won't be disappointed.

bBE4Sl5CqWq5Oc3ssQJa8w.text: I'm not usually a fan of "breakfast for lunch," but I had one of their egg sandwiches for lunch the other day, and daaaaaaamn it was good!  Also, since they don't serve soda, I had one of their black teas.  It was excellent, too.  If you haven't been here yet, don't be fooled by the small size, check it out ASAP!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

0QZLNymLVFF3VVRD_2d7kg.text: I love D'lish- my favorite things are the breakfast buzz and the breakfast quinoa. My only complaint is the drive thru at this location. It's enough to make me need to call in an emergency bottle of Xanax. It's super narrow and people are always trying to squeeze through. Maybe I'm a hyper freak but it was terrifying. This is also the reason that I've never dined in at this location- wasn't sure if I could risk my life even though the breakfast buzz is so unbelievably good.

R_RURSTPUqc5blLO4UI4Xg.text: Purchased a soup and two sandwiches and it cost me over $30! Kind of ridiculous considering how bland and boring the food tasted... Also it was definitely not worth the 20 minute wait in a drive thru that is falling apart! If you charge people so much for the food I'm sure you would have enough money to spruce up your location and make it easier to drive through.

mM0Ft_EaX4eYiJYOQOAN8g.text: This place has a drive thru which makes for some fast service on the go. There is a great shake called the "breakfast buzz" which has some coffee in it too. They food is above average at best but does the trick.

PJfzxQN3YCXnQIhA5KgNhQ.text: My fiance and I needed a quick place to stop for lunch on our way between Sedona and Los Angeles.  We were driving through Phoenix, and we settled on D'lish because it was a well-reviewed drive-thru with plenty of options.  It was a good choice, quick, affordable, and tasty.  There was a short line for the drive-thru, but we were helped relatively quickly.  I was expecting a McDonald's-style drive-thru speaker system, but an employee came out and took our order while we waited in our cars.  The same employee then took our money at the pay window and maybe even gave us our food at the food window?  Is that too Looney Tunes?  Maybe there was another employee or just the one window.  Either way, he was a nice guy.  I ordered the combo lunch with a sandwich, a side, and a small drink.  I chose the turkey club, which was a pretty decent sandwich with smoked turkey, bacon, cheese, avocado, tomato, and lite honey mustard spread, served on toasted whole wheat.  It was a decently sized sandwich, not heavy but filling.  It was maybe a little dry despite having good turkey - less bread, maybe, or more mayonnaise would have done the trick.  I picked a soup for my side, a red pepper bisque that came with bagel chips.  This was excellent.  The soup was soothing and thick with tomato and red pepper, and the crispy bagel chips were perfect for dipping.  I'd definitely recommend a soup if you're coming through D'lish.  For my drink, I subbed in the Breakfast Buzz for a little bit extra.  I wasn't quite sold when I read the description on the menu, but as I often do, I let the voice of Yelp dictate my order.  This drink was a shake made with vitamins, protein, espresso, nonfat milk, peanut butter, banana, and chocolate, blended with ice.  Pro tip, guys - don't lead with vitamins and proteins.  It makes your drink sound less delicious.  I'm glad I got the Breakfast Buzz against my fat-craving inner skeptic - it was fantastic, creamy and refreshing with plenty of banana, peanut butter, and chocolate to silence the healthier components.  We ate our lunch in the car and drove off in less than fifteen minutes.  It was a nice, efficient stop, and the food was well worth stopping for.  I'd recommend to D'lish to Phoenicians and weary travelers alike.

CV4pDlkCaiSk8S9JC1MfkA.text: My first breakfast at D'lish was so good I had to come back a couple days later.  This is one of the best drive-through restaurants ever.  They use flavorful, quality, natural ingredients yet still manage to crank out tasty food very quickly.  Hopefully you don't need to eat in your car, but if you do D'lish is the ticket.  -- Traditional breakfast burrito, $4.75/$6.25 w/ meat: Score!  I have had a lot of breakfast burritos and this ranks up there as one of the best, if not the best, ever.  The chicken sausage was a total winner and the cheese was out of this world.  You might think $6.25 is a little pricey for a breakfast burrito but the ingredients are sooo good that it is totally worth it.  -- House blend smoothie, $4-5: This smoothie ranks up there with anyone else's.  A must get if you want to kick start your day with some blended fruit rather than caffeine.

pTlom58apb3oJmeMYlo2kg.text: California Club is THE BOMB DOT COM!!! No substitutions needed!!

Q_Wk_orTb80y-ffed_ixbw.text: Went here to check out what all the "buzz" was about, and ordered the breakfast buzz.  Wow what a great shake.  The service was super friendly and there croissant sandwich was phenomenal.  Will definitely be visiting again.

cy6UL1ahWDOheJJQafVAeQ.text: Love that theres the option for in-house dining or drive-thru, and everything is made-to-order right in front of you. Have had a few smoothies here-- my fav is the coffee/mocha one, and their bfast sandwich and bfast burrito are delect.

H7rT5SoRdRZ3_rnkoSS93A.text: This place mixes fast drive thru service with quality food. If you want to chill they have a small outdoor patio. Their menu is awesome offering vegetarian and vegan options.

PK6ZGzoj_gFmP9p0XIFw3g.text: My wife and I drove through this place today. I was skeptical on many levels. Healthy, quick, made from scratc with a drive thru don't normally go together but this place pulls it off. The parking lot is tiny so be prepared. The food is really good. I got the breakfast buzz drink and the California breakfast sandwich. Both were really good but it was too much to take on at one sitting. The drink was next level good. It is coffee, peanut butter, banana, milk, vitamins and ice. I could've gotten this one on its own and been perfectly content. The sandwich was really good as well. I'd get it minus cream cheese next time. The bread on the sandwich was phenomenal. Overall, I'll definitely go back. I'm pretty sure the Scottsdale location has been a few different places over the years but I'm pretty sure this place will stick. It was super crowded around 11:15 and for a healthy, quick, made from scratch drive thru it ticked all the boxes..

spH8XM0t-IiTzfQedUIwng.text: I was one of the many people who hopped on the delish bandwagon when they hit the south scottsdale scene. What a great concept. Healthy fast food. Not only has the quality of their food gone down but also their ability to hire individuals to provide any form of customer service. Today I called in an order and like many other times I get a girl who answers the phone like she would chatting with a friend, zero phone etiquette and the vocabulary of a child. In addition to the drop in service and the quality of food, the owners still have invested no money into the dump of a building this place is in. I'm surprised it passes the health code inspections. There is no bathroom for guests to use and it seems as if they are in no hurry at all to have these issues addressed.

wF9hFsCZK-XXuNUurMFIaQ.text: I love this concept:  healthy breakfast/brunch/lunch on-the-go.  I tried D'lish this morning for breakfast and was pleasantly surprised.  I wasn't expecting much from a drive-through establishment but they delivered a hot, yummy breakfast, coupled with a chai latte that was probably the best I've had to date!  Don't go expecting the speed of fast food drive-through.  You will wait a bit but it's worth it because the food is that much better.  I tried the breakfast burrito with chicken sausage, wrapped in a warm whole wheat tortilla.  I enjoyed it.  What makes me happy is that there are several other breakfast and lunch items that look appealing to me so I know a repeat visit is in my future.

51HkMQYkHLIq0iANw9ZauQ.text: Great food, drive through, iced coffee was delicious and the staff was super friendly. Loved this place and would come back if ever in the area.

14vBZG_qfZeqMb-5gbOzPQ.text: The food at D'lish is super fresh and real tasty!  Recommend the breakfast club and a coffee (drink menu is on point).  For lunch, the tuna sandwich or turkey club are awesome!  If you don't want to wait in line (drive-thru line can grow fast, parking lot has about 10 spots), then call your order in, highly recommended.

XYmGarkLTW4R0E1_PKjTrw.text: Hidden a bit, but worth the search.  Breakfast was very good, fast, and fresh.  We had the California Club and Breakfast Burrito (w/ chicken sausage) - 2 thumbs up for both.  We'll be back.

nQoItOe2p-1eixCOpZKzUA.text: Food and drinks here are a lil overrated. Staff is friendly enough, but the low rating is strictly for the guy who I think is the owner or manager. I kept trying to give this place a chance, but each time I would witness this guy be so rude to guests and then myself. First example, 2 girls sitting at the coffee bar talking about the night before, not being loud or obnoxious just being girls... This guy yells at them bc he hears them say a bad word and says "where do you guys think you are?! This isn't a bar! You need to leave if you're gonna keep talking like that." Next example... A group of us went in there for breakfast one Saturday morning and my friend Kevin was kicked out bc this guy heard him swear... My third and last visit there... My friend and I were waiting for our drinks (this place is tiny and not much standing room) I'm telling her about my other 2 visits here and point out the guy to her... Sure enough he yells at us and says "you girls need to get out of my way!" I'm like "there is no where else to stand" he rolled his eyes and just walked off in a hurry. I get that cursing is inappropriate, but both of these times people were talking amongst their friends, not being loud or obnoxious. And to be honest, in both cases I never even heard the cuss word used, all I heard was this dude scolding people. The only person that's loud and obnoxious there is him. Like, I just wanna get a cup of coffee, not be scolded for saying "dammit" or for trying to find standing room in this shoebox

WSMelkS4VHrNXrL7N5xYMA.text: I blinked & I missed it - it's tiny but has a lot of food options to offer. I got a vegan chocolate protein shake & it was a wonderful way to start my day. Love that such yummy fresh food can come through a drive thru!

6by-a57SD71pWebiyNkbAg.text: What a great find! Coffee is strong and tasty. Oatmeal is very good as are the breakfast sandwiches with very fresh and high quality ingredients. Efficient, prompt and very friendly service. We'll be back!

b040qEUIOpeFZSlB-O9yzg.text: The oatmeal was unique and very good. I also thought the Breakfast Buzz was great.  It is a cool experience that is well worth the trip.  I get so tired of the same old food choices and this is just different.  I like different and am glad I stumbled across D'lish.

9gjQY0x6uXsj--oHISPakg.text: My dad and I searched up and down for a good breakfast place and stumbled upon this gem. It was EXACTLY what we were looking for. Cool vibe, friendly staff, vegan options, free wifi, good food... Just excellent!

uljGdJvVgwU6Yw2O5G8Tkg.text: Healthy and consistent.  On the expensive side for a breakfast spot but it should be expensive based on the quality of the ingredients and emphasis on keeping it clean and good for that body.

GV6ZIUGsSHKOFFDR3HzTUg.text: I had the burrito and a sugar free vanilla latte, coffee is bold, bitter bold at first but you get use to it. The burrito had a sauce that was more of a marinara, still good! We will be back!

CtUGntN7WCI9d-nMSRPXXA.text: Love this place! Dirty Chai and Kitchen Sink salad are both a must!

mPNsGvRNU7cOzz72rZCy_w.text: Came here and did drive-though to pick up a turkey sandwich and the "man" salad.   The salad was really good!!!!  On a hot summer day, the salad is a perfect choice for lunch!!!

qLNmfAEpMKD8-2P-q_PYdA.text: I was visiting from San Diego and really enjoyed this place! I ordered the turkey club and it was superb

0eHHWRrzEChLu5minurmpA.text: Just ate here for the first time today. Breakfast burrito is so, so good! Great place!

3NN84EfgavbQOJMfBi_s_g.text: The breakfast club sandwich here was great and then to top it off their house shake with chocolate, peanut butter, and espresso was addictive!

LR1_Cn2uq9wi6JTJbYXPJQ.text: Mayonaise makes me gag. I don't care how you prepare it, mix it, twist it, shout it...it grosses me out so bad. people who like/love/don't mind mayo always say things to me like 'try this potato salad, you can't even taste the mayo' and you know what? they are always lying.   anyway, i ordered the turkey club and asked them to hold the honey mustard spread. thankfully there wasn't any mayo so i didn't have to ask them to hold that either. this sandwich has a ton of my faves: tomato, turkey, bacon, cheese, avocado. scrumptious ingredients.   as soon as it's in my car, i can smell mayonaise. i think to myself 'oh, you're crazy, it's your immagination- the description said nothing about mayo'   well i am crazy, but my nose was right. mayo. on. my. sandwich.   usually i wouldn't flip out but my large sexy dirty chai and sandwich cost me $15. the drink alone was worth the $4 something dollars for several reasons, but the sandwich was gross and totally over priced. the bacon was pretty bad, and i ended up taking off most of the ingredients bc it wasn't very good. i was able to wipe off most of the mayo from the turkey and avocado so i ate that.  i was just so, so sad.   the customer service is great, the sexy dirty chai is great but the food i will not eat again.

w5R7qhWPa9VRQGl7UxQrxQ.text: Delicious coffee and awesome breakfast sandwiches, well worth the trip. The California Club is an excellent pair with a fresh cup of coffee, staff is very friendly

phuHwwoTvKix2HGl9MviBg.text: All I have to say is, it's been a nightmare being vegan and ordering from this place. Never have I been through the drive-thru and have received a correct order. Yes, I understand ordering vegan is a bit more complicated but at a place like this, one would think that the *entire* staff should be competent enough to be able to handle such a feat.  After speaking with a manager regarding my last order and telling them I did not want a free meal, that I just wanted my money back and it was the principle and the concept of when a food establishment gets an order wrong, it creates waste. I was surprised to hear their reply: that they don't care what I do with the food. Be that as it may, they should care because that means they're losing money. So, after I stated I just wanted my money back, the manager seemed to have become short and frustrated. This last visit just further solidified my validation in that this place is NOT for vegans.

-AKAHcpMfi1xhRDt-QHFWQ.text: The best breakfast sandwiches. I had my first dirty chai here, awesome! Can sit outside with my little dog and enjoy the nice weather.

hqiWRNizFNKl-VqWwa1CBg.text: On a business trip to Scottsdale, I discovered this place and ordered the California Club based on other Yelp reviews. To this day, I still crave the sandwich and have even tried to re-create this deliciousness at home (... just not the same)!

RMO1fgbGZZsfE3xXzqLdWA.text: This is my third review ! I gave one more star because They have really done a good job on improving their customer service !! The staff is way more friendly . Keep up the good work !! The best Protein shake ever is here !!!

DO-M636y-OGSlyWXQf8lIA.text: Vegan Buzz. That is all. Wait. Also, try not to get killed when it's busy and fools in the drive through are backed up into the busy Scottsdale rd.

OD-TbMc2PgBmNlVOdpKnwQ.text: Awesome food and fast service! I had the California club, which was a jam-packed sandwich with lots of flavor - bacon, pesto, avocado, tomato, eggs - all with the freshest ingredients. My mom enjoyed the nuts and berries salad which she says was delightful and crisp. I can't say enough about 'The Buzz' either... a creative morning drink with peanut butter, espresso, banana and chocolate. I could have that every day and I wouldn't get sick of it. I wish I lived closer, this would easily become a favorite weekend restaurant, especially with the drive thru option! These people know what they're doing.

9BkUDIaHqW1OSRPM1tgmBg.text: Love the Breakfast Buzz, just wish the taste was consistent from server to server. My only rub against this place is the parking. I prefer to walk in and go to the counter. More often then I'm in and out before most cars have even placed an order.  Update on my initial complaint   Can't fathom how they can't get their signature drink consistent each time. It's like the employees just guess. Really disappointed that the Buzz I was looking forward to this morning was over powered by the amount of espresso poured into my drink. It can't be that hard to post the recipe by size right in front of the blender fir the employees to follow.

TWvg4t3Psi5gm-nvlItHag.text: I was looking for some breakfast while traveling in Phoenix. I was looking for a place that would be on the healthier side and I want disappointed! This was a smaller place so I don't recommend staying with a large group but they make the food pretty quickly and the food was amazing. I had their signature California breakfast Wrap and every bite was delicious. Pretty affordable of a healthy breakfast wrap and a cup of coffee.

a3kPpmKXaeyoWT-HTImiDA.text: Great spot! Was leaving town in the a.m. by car, passing through from Los Angeles. Googled a healthy spot in Scottsdale. D'Lite popped up and was perfect. Under $10 for a burrito. Healthy. Fast. Fresh.   Love the drive-thru! Thank you for caring about human's health in this fast paced life.

WcydQD1XZHwQZ3q8SkS9dQ.text: They have the best Dirty Chai I've ever tasted!  What's better is if you order a large without ice it can last you well into the afternoon.  Score!

k2BNcR4AijWkXGhbp7MQ1g.text: Get the breakfast buzz shake! It's the reason I put up with the line 95% of the time. The food is good too, personal favs being the low carb breakfast and the chicken panini. I wish they had a better way of dealing with the wait time in the drive through but I feel like it's worth it when everything is fresh and made to order. Love this gem!

3Sv60at032DcelOajTpgmA.text: Great menu and great service! The parking lot is small and there us usually a line at the drive thru but if you park and walk in they are super fast and friendly.

V77N5y9S8_nBMXswXsC25Q.text: My favorite healthy breakfast spot, I usually get a almond milk latte and it's perfect every time. The food is very delicious and they are consistent. Ive had the low carb breakfast, the humanitarian, veggie burrito, the traditional burrito, california club, and the burger. The breakfast buzz and vegan buzz are also bomb shakes! Highly recommend this location.

AuD5G1miVPg8Ed4F9O-RTg.text: I have been here a few times now and I have tried the breakfast buzz, dirty chai latte, and the AB&J. All are delicious and the staff is very nice, I will definitely be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Dirty chia latte!!! Delicious!!!

AVFhN4gtkimQVHO7gZqzhg.text: I love coming to D'lite, I know the food is always freshly made. I highly recommend trying the 'man' salad if you have never ordered their food it's one of my favorites as well as the turkey club **but as a wrap instead of sandwich! It's a little disappointing they close at 4 pm. Oh, and just a heads up, the parking lot and drive through can be a little overwhelming because it is a very tiny location but the food is delicious.

IRDGAf7JxTdqP7RpTv08UA.text: Amazing food/ drinks but the service is SO SLOW. They have got to do something to speed things up at this place. No matter the time of day or what day it is you will be sitting in the drive thru for a good 15 mins.

PxNZpNGqdR04fZd2uQkldg.text: This place is fantastic! It is small and the line is always long but it moves pretty fast. Everyone is super friendly and the food is fantastic! Highly recommended for healthy eating.

tKdyFCY3W2sVMDUC71AeLw.text: Delicious croissant sandwich and coffee! Tiny place but with a drive through, seems like a local favorite. Speedy and friendly service.

USmwiSlRuX584bpp4yp_6g.text: Everybody working here needs to look alive.... smh. Worst customer service. Literally just hand out your drink with not a simple "hello, here's your drink for you " gets our order wrong 2/3 times we go .

qcImm8XTI-lz-zNcrYIMyA.text: This place was incredible!  Scrumptious humanitarian (think vegan) wrap had the option to add chicken, feta and pesto to its quinoa, hummus and veggies base... absolutely delightful when wrapped up in a tomato tortilla.  Coupled that with the orange glorious smoothie - which basically tastes like a melted creamsicle, without the calories!  Awesome place and a lucky little find... thanks fellow Yelpers!

FcyadXV_MGl5ZwuX1lXZTw.text: Just walked out of there. Ordered coffee and was treated very rudely.  The workers were more interested in talking to each other then helping their one and only customer.    I had ordered my coffee. Asked for whipped cream. A guy who was behind the cashier said,  this isn't Starbucks.  I personally hate Starbucks. I didn't say anything.  But then the girl cashier says,  sheesh he is only joking.  I walked out of there immediately.  Off to Dutch brothers. Always get great coffee and great attitudes

lGWn_Gu-vu9aoz5qsC8Ruw.text: Let me start with the fact that this place really does have excellent food. Two two meals that my friend and I ordered were delicious. It was served quickly and the food was prepared just then and still super hot. The customer service was great too. Unfortunately, the place is very, very small and there is no way to escape the door or the noisy blender. I was looking to sit down and have a nice conversation with my girlfriend but we were constantly interrupted by the loud blender and we were freezing so we had to leave. I'd recommend this place if you're looking at picking up food and leave.

mlgE6-8lNImyAvaj7G7xcw.text: California Club is AMAZING plus an iced mocha. Highly recommend!

-3d2DL4O6-yc0y2RgJNWqw.text: Yummy! 1st time visiting. Ordered the chicken panini and the man salad.  Both were fresh and totally delicious.  Freash, fast and wholesome. Prices were reasonable.  Service was fast and courteous.  Would recommend,  and will visit again.

uNPEnM4UP3WfYp3P6NVhyw.text: Ordered the chicken panini. Supposed to be served on sourdough they gave me plain white bread instead. Wasn't impressed definitely not worth 9 dollars.

k6IDdmBGCp7cyLXdFeY2gQ.text: I generally crave the breakfast buzz shake at least once a week! As far as the breakfast sandwiches, you can't go wrong. I alternate between the California Club and croissant sandwich. Great little breakfast/brunch spot!

NZpLvMb4Hm2bIkaIW6pADQ.text: This place is the best... I have been saying for years I don't understand why there is not more healthy food readily available. I came here for the first time a few weeks ago and got the "breakfast buzz" protein shake. It is sooooo delicious. Everyone that I have bright to try the "breakfast buzz" is instantly hooked. Today I tried the turkey club which was also fantastic. I highly recommend this place. The staff is always so friends and helpful... The drive thru makes it very convenient.

Or9tKNkrDeJB-7hDSTwLsw.text: I love this place! The breakfast buzz is to die for. I would love to start my day with this breakfast shake everyday. I usually get the croissant breakfast sandwich. And I have tried the California club too which is awesome. The atmosphere reminds me of SoCal - reggae music playing and just a laid back atmosphere. This place is always a good idea for hangover cures and for breakfast to go. It's so good I might even get it today for breakfast or lunch!

gTxGuscCwgiyNHdpA_P5Vg.text: This is SUCH an amazing idea!! Why there aren't more healthy drive-thrus is beyond me!! The worst is when you are in a rush but want to eat healthy but there aren't any options available. I only wish there were more menu options available.

Uhmswye7BCgdPQnNRw31Zg.text: First let me start by saying the parking here is a nightmare. HOWEVER you can just go through the drive thru and continue on with your day without missing a beat.  I love having healthy food options available in a drive thru!!! Seriously- I can get a protein shake, rice bowl, hummus, or great salads all within minutes! Lately I've just been getting the breakfast buzz smoothie which is very filling. The prices are very comparable with other fast food options as well.

VKIMmow0Qk8QexH7O93B6Q.text: Best Coffee  Love the chill vibes. Healthy menu options for Breakfast or Lunch.

rIAMV1F_ESCyiO2hPDyMog.text: super fast, super friendly, super healthy.   My favorite drink is the "buzzkill." It's not on the menu but it's a breakfast buzz without the espresso. I love that they have a drive thru!

h6A_TcBryMB_AC26PZmesw.text: I LOVE this place! I am obsessed. The best items on the menu are by far the Breakfast Buzz (protein shake with coffee, peanut butter, and banana) and the California Club.   I usually dread going to work on Mondays, but a quick drive through at D'lish gets me ready for the week! It's so convenient for my schedule that they are open at 6am.   Lots of locals are catching on to how awesome this place is, so the line hangs out into the road often times during lunch hours. Also very busy on the weekends!

B-wZBuyf1w1ZW5aT9Zq4FA.text: Incredible long waiting time for a drive-through! Strong discrimination! I ordered a frittatas, a California club and a salad, which made me wait on the driver through way for half an hour! Several cars behind me had their orders delivered before me and finally they asked me again what I ordered! If I could offer negative star, I will definitely do so!

bRDp4e7HQNxaaYyZcbsB7Q.text: The veggie wrap with added turkey was really good. Lite enough not to weigh me down, but a perfect size to not leave me hungry. The only gripe is that their parking situation seemed a bit sketch. There were spaces but it looked like a tight fit. Also their water tasted bad, like tap water from some old pipes.

XEGrqMzQNCKLNolyP3vqXw.text: Hands down one of the best local spots around.  The California club is one of my favorite sandwiches from anywhere, period.  Smiling faces and healthy eats.  Love this place.

2D3Jex6DL8B1EOfGFzRWvQ.text: The California club and breakfast buzz are amazing! I wish they would have another location more north, although the drive and wait are worth it for this place!!  Has a drive-thru if you're grabbing something on the way to work!

j7Jem7kM9bYyP49MhaxjAA.text: They now have a baby buzz (16 oz) and a thug buzz (24 oz) It's great they have more options!     The oatmeal our way with almond milk is a perfect nourishing breakfast.  You can get their breakfast burrito enchilada style. It's a large burrito so you could definitely split between two.  The California Club is always fresh and a must try if you like avocado.

rqJxpqz-qN-ABWGVOr5L_w.text: Everything I have eaten there is awesome! The humanitarian wrap is my favorite! We call in take out at least once a week at work and the food always consistent and prepared quick! The drive thru is very convenient also.  Highly recommended!

f61QlTk0fQAqXYk9TyxT0g.text: This breakfast/brunch and coffee house is a diamond in the rough. I had the low carb breakfast. A hash brown pattie on a bed of fresh greens w a well seasoned vinaigrette  on top of that were slices of avocado and two overhard eggs and topped with pesto.  My friend had the quinoa oatmeal with fresh fruit and loved it. The only drawback is parking if the drive through is full you wait. At least someone will occasionally come out to get your order so it hopefully moves faster. If you do want to park it may be better to go in the out side.

6CF4eGzQ4h765WxESzzq1g.text: I've been looking for a healthy, fast restaurant and definitely found one. I ordered the chicken breast panini; it was delicious and the perfect size!  The drive thru was pretty quick (about 5-7 min) but I was unsure if I needed to tip since the restaurant is not really "fast food" - I still left $1 tip for a $7 sandwich just in case.  I'm looking forward to trying other menu items asap!

t_u2oQdPjEneZfSIOwJBsg.text: If I lived here I would definitely be coming here often. $6.25 for a veggie burrito. If you're from California this is a spot to stop at.

7MXXAoa2zFfQRlJfa180aA.text: D'lish.. it is absolutely Delish!  The food is fresh and tasty!  The location is in a good spot, right before you hit the main part of Scottsdale.  It has a DRIVE THRU!!  Brilliant idea!  The seating inside is tiny, which makes it difficult to sit down and have lunch with a friend.  There are no heaters outside, so if it's a cold Arizona day and there are no spots inside, you're out of luck.    The morning buzz with almond milk was absolutely delicious!  My friend had the California club and it was warm, fresh and absolutely delicious!  I will definitely come here again for breakfast or lunch and use the drive thru!

emwD-hYOs7kmdN_Z0ByoNA.text: This place is seriously delicious! I am addicted to their Pomegranate Green Tea and Kombucha. I went three days in a row last week, but have one complaint... They were out of large drinking cups all three days. They also have great sandwiches. Popular tiny little place. It's better to go through the Drive-Thru because of parking issues.

y5lMOVM2EeWdyi3wIDlnjw.text: Introduced to D'lish today by a friend. I'd already had breakfast (although the menu looks great, lots of delicious sounding, healthy options) but he suggested a Chai coffee. I don't usually like Chai Tea, but I thought I'd give the Chai coffee a chance based on his recommendation.  When I ordered, the server suggested a "Sexy Dirty Chai", which as lurid as it sounds means adding vanilla. The Sexy Dirty Chai Coffee over ice is hands down now my favorite coffee drink. The place is tiny, has a really cool, funky interior and also has a drive thru- a True local gem. The service is friendly and energetic and I plan to start my day here again soon :)

R_88ABaEC5W_-gehieCyxg.text: So I discovered D'lish today during my Friday lunch excursion and i have to say I'm quite delighted to have stumbled upon the place. I work close by and have always struggled with my local occupational coffee situation. Ya see... I love to put my money in locally owned and operated businesses, but the cafe at my work location serves horrible coffee so I have been wearing a disguise and hitting the Starbucks drive through to make it through some work days. until today.... D'lish has marvelous fair trade locally roasted espresso that is prepared to the coffee connoisseurs delight.   For lunch I had the hummus plate with chicken and the creamy tomato basil soup. The hummus plate was just OK (reason why the 5th star wasn't added to this review). The hummus was a little bland and the chicken was soggy as if it had been precooked and thawed. However, I really like how they serve veggies with their hummus plate and not just pita. The creamy tomato basil soup, on the other hand, was superb or shall i say D'lish.   The atmosphere is relaxing, cozy and unique with a bit of urban flair. I'll have to bring my laptop next time and relish the ambiance while I get some work done.  I'm so excited that I found good quality locally roasted coffee... I will definitely be back and I'm looking forward to giving a try to the rest of the menu.

PfPuLk0RUhlUtxKy1CFi9g.text: I was on my way to a meeting yesterday and I thought I would give this place a try (I just cannot abide Starbucks burnt coffee). I didn't do the drive through ( I wanted to take a look at the muffins, doctor up my coffee the way I wanted it, etc.). You know, I though it was a nice little coffee place. The muffin was pretty good (although certainly not fresh from the oven...but then what is these days?). The coffee was also pretty good (they didn't have a dark roast option, so "house" was it for me...I would prefer a little better selection from a place where the primary business is "coffee"). They had to scramble around to get me some milk for my coffee, but scramble they did, and they came up with a carton after a couple minutes of digging in the refrigerator. The prices are reasonable, and that's always a plus. I will try them again.

hy2H-y5IZun7JhvwfYKCag.text: We LOVE D'lish! The food is fantastic and the staff is awesome. We are trying to make our way through the entire menu but everything is so good we get stuck on one item for quite a while. We go several times a week and tell all our friends and clients to visit D'lish. A great gem that everyone should try. The burritos are insanely good!

RyH6fnPwWRtCPEo3Skxrfw.text: I have been going here for as long as I can remember... ok, maybe not that long.  Early 2006?  I am guess what you would call a 'drive through regular'.  The Mocha Breve. It's not too sweet (a la starbucks) It's not too expensive (a la coffee bean and tea leaf) It is my perfect drink.   I stop by on my way to work (granted there is enough time and the line is not atrocious). It is manditory I go Saturday and Sunday mornings. I like to bring my dog - and he is always given a treat.    Because of D'Lish, my dog always expects to get a treat no matter where I take him in the car.  I go to the atm and he expects the machine to cough up a dog biscuit, I swear.    The coffee shop used to be called Daily Rush.  Many of the same faces are still around.  Rarely do I have to tell them what I want.  It's always the same: Mocha Breve 16 oz.  A couple times - they've seen me waiting a car or two back in the drive-thru line - my coffee is ready before I even pull up to the first window.   Yup, they get me.  For lunch - I love their soups in the fall, winter, and breezy spring.   Their tomato soup is perfect coupled with the grilled cheese.  I do recommend drinks only -  if you are doing drive through. If you require food - their is usually ample parking.  It takes some time.  A True testament to this place: It is one of the drawbacks of going on vacation.  I can never find coffee I like in other cities.  Daily Rush.. I mean, D'Lish is as good as it gets, in my opinion.  Cringing at the thought of ever-present starbucks.. vacation mornings make me long for home.  If you are in south scottsdale - I recommend stopping by.

UCThN2_mEmDNTFSqQPAJxg.text: I had the veggie frittata, it was great! Everything about it was perfect. Flavor of the pesto sauce was delicious, all toppings spot on. Prices are very reasonable here. I'll definitely be back!

ocsNGipV6YiJUubxesqvlQ.text: I started going through the drive through back when it was Daily Rush and got to know the owners at that time.  I loved giving the local guy business.  When the new guys took over I was bummed to have to build a relationship all over again.  But I have to tell you they are kicking butt!!    The remodel is fabulous, the extension of the menu is great and they know what I want when I pull up.  Always nice to have someone know your drink :-)  I can't wait to try the dirty Chai!  Thanks so much for giving us this great drive thru in South Scottsdale!!

XC_CSEXXVUHronIaX8KAhg.text: Just enjoyed my first cup at D'lish.  After reading the other reviews from the Yelpers, I decided to go with a Dirty Chai with Almond Milk.  Great choice.  I am not a huge chai fan and I will definitely be getting another in the near future.  Very good.  Very pleasant atomosphere and the customer service was very welcoming.  I decided to sit and work a little and enjoyed my chai so much that I ordered a latte to go.  Excited to try this one, but wanted to update my Yelp before I hit the road.

BiAUOmdQJEHESrQrqkwTUA.text: I like this place for there drinks and sandwiches, but there burritos just have way too much egg in them. I guess if you are a huge egg fan you'll love their breakfast burritos, but I like to keep it at a minimum. I usually order the turkey BLT or tuna sandwich which are both great. They are quick and keep it casual and friendly. They even have a drive thru which I've never used, but if you are too lazy too get out of your car and don't mind wasting money on gas it's perfect for you!

3YiPZco7p5LBBSX5hrX8Kw.text: Had the California Club(breakfast sandwich) and an Ice Americano for breakfast here. Both were amazing! The California club was delicious! In addition to great food and a cool little restaurant the staff was super cool! The two employees that were there were very nice and I chatted with them while I ate. great food, great people = win.

NUQzUWpCYl75wFEGtXFyDg.text: Great coffee, fresh food, friendly service.  Great little stop. Could use a good cleaning, but if you can overlook that, you'll love the place.

PliObNrb8_bFHDpkRBvhxg.text: Literally d'lish. I think I've had and loved everything on the menu. Nuts&berries salad, california club, turkey club, southwest burrito bowl, protein burger, ...everything. healthy and amazing.

6mDIO6oIy7zCYeiCl165tw.text: $10.50 got me a 16oz hot, dirty chai and chef salad.   I loved me the hot, dirty chai. Plus, it's just fun to say.   The salad was tasty. Great portion size. Often we think we can stuff our faces with lettuce, turkey slices and eggs...but we can't. Let's face it. D'lish does a great job of making a well-balanced salad.   The guys who run this place are also very easy on the eyes.   The menu is expansive, offering up breakfast choices with lighter fare, including smoothies. Ingredients are said to be mostly organic. Yep, I like this place alot, actually.   And it's very cool they have a drive-thru.   I also dug the music while I was there. It was from one guy's laptop; so you know he's got a great library of tunes. Thumbs up for me.   If you haven't gone here, go. Even if it's for a coffee. You may find, though, that when you arrive, you can't resist their menu options.

tOovIApM7YD84nbmDFPCbg.text: Last Sunday, the man and I headed out to get breakfast, enjoy some coffee and have a lazy read of the day's paper.  He wanted to take to me to the place he stops at many mornings on his way to work, but alas, it wasn't open until 11am.  (Side note: A coffee shop that doesn't open til 11am?  On a Sunday?  Really?)  We looked at each with blank faces.  Where to go now?  We needed breakfast, coffee, wireless internet and a place where we could relax without feeling like we were preventing a server from turning the table.    So I said, "What about that little shack place further south on Scottsdale Rd.? You know the one that says coffee, breakfast, lunch on the sign outside."  He said something along the lines of, "You're a f*$@ing genius."  His colleague had apparently been recommending this place for weeks and he hadn't tried it yet.  D'lish as it turned out to be called, was exactly what we were looking for.   As we walked up to the front door, we passed a lovely but small patio.  I was instantly charmed.  All along the patio are planters with homegrown tomatoes, herbs and other yummy garden delights.    When we walked in we checked out the menu and waited our turn.  Not sure who helped us but I'm assuming the two guys who we spoke with during our visit are Chad and Kyle.  The bf and I ordered the same thing: two breakfast croissants and two lattes.  The latte was great and satisfied the Sunday morning coffee craving.   The breakfast croissant?  Just delicious.  A fried egg, bacon and tomato with a light layer of pesto on the croissant.  Seriously delicious.  I don't know if I ever would have thought of pesto on an egg sandwich but I'm so glad that D'lish has broadened my culinary horizons.    The bf was equally satisfied with his meal, but did remark that he thought $6 was a bit expensive for a breakfast sandwich.  I think we paid a reasonable price for a quality product.  It is apparent to me that with a limited menu stocked with fresh ingredients, a garden on the patio and their status as a CSA drop off point, D'lish is trying to churn out food that is as fresh, natural, local and organic as possible.  Yay for them.    Chad and Kyle were nothing but friendly and welcoming.   A number of regulars came through while we were there and it was obvious they have quite a loyal following.  D'lish is small, no more than 20 or 30 could fit in the place.  However, they also have a drive thru to serve customers on the run.  We'll be back and hope to be regulars soon!

HEElhOPfrhnM0WdT98ZaPQ.text: Dlish is adorable! I have driven by many times and wanted to stop, but they are always closed because I am driving by at like 330 or 4 pm. This morning I woke up and needed some strong coffee, so I went to Dlish. I got the Veggie Burrito... AWESOME! Completely cured my hang over, soaked up all the alcohol! And The red eye completely woke me up! I am going to go back there for breakfast as much as possible. I am little disappointed in their lunch menu. It is lacking in vegetarian options( I am not a fan of egg salad sandwhichs and I am sick of the hummus craze!). I just noticed on there website they will be doing dinner soon- SO excited.   I wish there were more little precious places like this in Scottsdale!

W9sDsjpw4_sP88_egyg6TQ.text: Rolled in before my class at SCC, and had the place to myself. Snacked on the hummus and veggie platter (cilantro and jalapeno hummus was tasty and tangy!).  Sipped a lemonade, then got an iced coffee to go.  Wish this place was closer to my home, especially with the drive thru, but will definitely be back when I'm in the Scottsdale area.

C7fEuJY0MFumF51eDrtf-A.text: I am not sure about this place. I like it but my god was it dirty as hell! I am mean so freakin dirty I am not sure what the hell was going on. Trash cans over flowing with trash, trash all over the floor and under stuff, all the way into the Kitchen. It was terrible. I had the veggie wrap. It was OK. nothing special. My kids had turkey and chicken sandwiches which were ok. My wife had quinoa thingy which is just veggies and quinoa in a soup. It was good but clearly a pre made soup most. I am not sure I would go to this location again due to it being FILTHY! I don't care if they were slammed for lunch and in the weeds they should have cleaned up. They were all standing around not cleaning a damn thing. Not sure if I would give them a second chance...Coffee was mediocre at best

SrTEcvXHWmWX8YmvVvD6eQ.text: Good food. Quick service. Went there for breakfast and was very pleased with our oatmeal and breakfast burrito. Yum.

MuBv59XgAJ28PErwU0HEbA.text: We had the turkey club without tomato, very good. We also had a large house smoothy. Which is strawberry banana. I was very impressed with both. The smoothy was five dollars and the club was tiny bit over 7 after tax. That's the reason it didn't land a five . I feel like the food should have been 5 and the drink 3.50. Very small place and little bit dirty .

-vpTmQ0HochCAsF67C6itw.text: D'Liteful (*ducks tomato*)!  The small but mighty breakfast and lunch drive thru (formally known as D'Lish) has been a faint curiosity for me since I first drove past what looked like a line of about 10 cars eager to get their fix at this place.  I can't say with any credibility whether that is a normal crowd.  But having seen similar lines for drive thru's like In & Out Burger and Dutch Bros Coffee, I figured there'd had to be something behind the long lines.  So around 7:30am on a Sunday it was off to D'Lite's flagship location in South Scottsdale for breakfast.  Surprisingly upon my arrival there were only a pair of cars in front of me.  Additionally I saw that there was the option to park and dine in rather than go the drive thru route.  So dine in I did.  The space is fairly small with seating for maybe 20 inside and another 10 outside.  Parking is also limited with space for maybe 6-8 cars so depending on your arrival time dining in may simply not be practical, but the drive thru line was moving at a pretty decent clip regardless.  For dining in just order at the register, pick a seat inside or out and the good stuff is brought right out to you.  As this was my first go around here, I had done a little bit of research in advance and saw two particular items that were helpfully highlighted as "signature" items on the menu.  Seems like a good place to start.  So for my drink, I went with their Breakfast Buzz shake.  A 24 oz mix of nonfat milk, peanut butter, banana, chocolate syrup, espresso, whey protein, and other vitamins all blended together with ice.  To be clear, I'm not a coffee drinker so the espresso aspect gave me a little trepidation, but honestly I didn't pick up any real coffee texture with this drink.  The two most dominant flavors were the chocolate and peanut butter.  The shake basically tasted like a Reese's Peanut Butter cup in liquid form (which is just fine by me).  For my breakfast dish, I also went "signature" and chose their California Club sandwich.  Egg, bacon, turkey, tomato, avocado, pepper jack cheese, cream cheese & pesto on toasted artisan bread.  Pretty decent sandwich and a just right portion, though I'll admit the tomato flavor might've been a little too dominant here.  Would've preferred a little more emphasis on the turkey and bacon and I didn't pick up hardly any of the pesto or cream cheese flavoring.  That said I liked the portion of avocado and the egg was also emphasized just the right amount.  Total cost for the shake and the sandwich including tax came to $15.  Both items came out within 2 minutes and it seemed like the D'Lite staff paid just as much attention to their dine in customers as their drive thru ones so both dining options are equally viable.  In addition to their flagship spot in South Scottsdale, they also have a location in North Scottsdale and in Tempe.  Overall I was pretty satisfied with my first breakfast outing here.  It wasn't perfect, but it was enjoyable, affordable, and efficient.  I would certainly come back for breakfast and will likely try their lunch menu at some point (rumor has it their house style protein burgers are popular).  D'Lite yourself in d'licious d'lectable goodness.  Sorry, I'll see myself out now.

x0_8zSt042VGrHEhr5Z1-w.text: Omg! This place is amazing. I ordered a veggie burrito and a smoothie and it was amazing. A great option for vegetarians like myself. I definitely recommend it. They even have a drive thru!

rLm26xAN1ML-W4PGku18Fw.text: I love this place! I come here often on my lunch break when at work. The food is fresh  and the ingredients are top notch! The only thing I wish they would do away with is having to sign your receipt when using their drive thru. It's sort of a pain.

It's so reasonably priced, and quite the hit because I have yet to not see a line of cars waiting to order. But even with all the traffic service is prompt.  Amazing overall.

II36qv28De3cOgFurjZxqQ.text: Amazing food. I dont how they can make it so quickly. Line moves quick. They see me almost everyday.

jAO-D64AaurXUZWHFCdXxA.text: Got the California club and breakfast buzz. Both were amazing! Cute place and super friendly staff. This will be my new spot, right down the street from my job! Live that I can get bfast items at all times.

MaWlI-EriykNlbZTXhiVxQ.text: Breakfast burritos are bomb here but all I have to say is,  if you are going to charge for an extra salsa please make sure to actually give it to the customer.  My burrito is getting pretty dry over here now

3Kf0m0LrXDregwJWh5-O7A.text: I've had the veggie breakfast burrito twice, and it is delicious. Much better choice than other fast food breakfast options. I look forward to trying some other breakfast items, including their egg sandwiches.

nvUy--kUKnVkUkViOrDIMQ.text: Healthy fast food drive -thru. What could be better? My go to order is a vegan buzz and soup!

XtCBAEmTJJa8YMT9Y0IVFw.text: Let me start with the positives!   I love that this place is small and is very intimate with the customer. I also love the food selection when it comes to lunch. I got the California club and it was pretty dank, I can't even lie.   The negatives:  I think I came when it was under construction and the place was getting moved around. Also, I don't know if it is an espresso machine or what but it is EXTREMELY loud. To the point where my girlfriend and I stopped talking and ate our food so that we could leave and talk later.   If the noise problem was fixed, this place would be 5 stars easy.

Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. California club

qZU0CSNAwmmrH2bVHRkcHg.text: omg am i addicted?!? am i obsessed!?   i can not get over this place and my california club!!!  i have my entire office hooked on d'lish now. we now have a lot of"meetings" at d'lish. we can not get enough.

i3zxiUKF5XUtIJlCWp9R6g.text: The only thing that isn't awesome about this place is the parking lot...when there are folks in the drive-thru, there usually no way to get around that line of cars to park, so you just wait.  Oh, and the interior seat cushions are a bit worn (being nitpicky now).  The food is delish (or d'lish, I suppose?), healthy, and somewhat creative.  Definitely NOT your typical drive-thru fair.  I've tried a few different things (wraps, cold sandwiches, hot sandwiches) and I always keep coming back to the California Club (no bacon please!) for breakfast and lunch.  It's impressive they are able to offer many organic and.or local ingredients for similar pricing to say, Subway.  Depending on who is at the checkout, the service isn't always with a smile, but at least it's pretty quick.  And for a sandwich this good, I'm totally fine with that!

lNJNDBOPARhyj-v06qX49w.text: What can I say? Wow!! Obsessed with the buzz and the California Club sandwich!! No wonder the lines are always out the door.

kVmZjvKeLgHzKSKLBlJ-4w.text: I moved from Scottsdale one year ago, and I can tell you that this is the place I miss the most.  Their food is fresh, healthy and served drive-thru - nothing better.  Literally the perfect start to a Saturday / Sunday morning.  My favorites are the breakfast buzz and California Club. Never disappoints.

t9CGwI-V1eEv2oof7P3MHA.text: Their menu had a variety of healthy vegan and vegetarian options as well options for your non-veggie friend. I ended up with the veggie d'lite. It had tomatoes, avocado, cucumber, cucumber sauce, and lettuce in a sort-of-pita-sort-of-focaccia wrap. The lettuce was not dressed and was the bulk of the sandwich. It would have been a lot tastier had the ingredients been mixed together prior to entering the wrap. I didn't expect it to be cheap, but $7 for this seemed a little on the pricey side considering it was just a wrap with no drink or side. Overall, it was a refreshing alternative to your typical drive-thru meal. I can't wait to go back and try something else!

wB0SiEMg0IfSoq9wKHY0fg.text: Truly enjoy this little spot...my daughter and I go after our morning workout...my only complaint is that they don't have any nutritional information...:-((...otherwise I would give it 5 stars...

UZti5lvU51AJonsalAsOpA.text: Have only been there once. I ate inside, versus on the patio. There is no bathroom for patrons.   When I asked if this was against the law, I was told, "No , that's only if we serve alcohol."   Really?   So, after I ate my veggie burger and left, i just pee'd outside on the grate -- the one right in front of where the drive-up customers drive up.  I waved to a few who had braked for me after I stood up , shook off and zipped up.

xLEoIRJsyfUuEu-AVDVwuw.text: Hello friends... I have been searching this earth for the perfect blend of black tea my entire life.  It has taken decades to come up with what I truly  believe is unparalleled....until now! Decades of life have been wasted, as you can now easily find a better Iced Tea at this amazing little gem of a restaurant.  Tea is one thing, but we were absolutely floored by the great customer service especially from our fabulous host named Patty.  She welcomed us to lunch, we had a great time, and we can't wait to come back.  Cars line up around the block for food at this place, but I'll have a hard time not coming in to see Patty now.. oh yeah.. the Tuna sandwich was dank!

EDpoawtPq1asDYHI7oxxOQ.text: This place is everything and more. The staff is always extremely friendly and wear smiles constantly. The food is to die for. I've been here a plethora of times and have had a pleasant experience each one. So yummy. And the atmosphere is cozy and warm. I love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

8HG9OZ__Q1tz-kBZwXrYwA.text: Breakfast buzz is a must!! California club is my fav bfast sandy. It's absurd how busy this place is.... I recommend going mid-day.

g5mnbcgEg-JPJ1Wg9dRAdA.text: D'lish is my go to breakfast spot.  All the choices are healthy and you don't feel like a tub of lard after eating it.  I wish the drive through was a bit more accessible, but I'll take what I can get.  This place is always worth the wait.

wV1nyVXOpSQdPNLTJYxhwA.text: We'll certainly return when we're back in town! The only thing 'fast' about this fast food is that the service is quick & efficient! Great local concept!  Like: AZ burrito! Chicken breast panini Toddy - cold brewed coffee! Ambiance - informal & one can tell it's a local favorite!  Wish: We had one in Riverside CA!

h3wrbrpibR4hU0oHemqmng.text: Disaster! I guess I don't get the allure of this place, and my biggest complaint...one that tops very average food will probably be scoffed at.  That being said, here we go.  Never, I repeat never, order the breakfast sandwich with no cheese. Apparently, that was the secret ingredient meant to hold the entire average sandwich together.   Imagine my shock opening this puppy to have it explode all over my car when pulling out of their drive thru. Thousands of pieces of sandwich over the car...not my belly, where an $8 breakfast sandwich belongs.  Cheese. It's what the Knights Templar smuggled to America to mend average sandwiches together.

ohmkinxTCAbP-dhxGi1uBw.text: Wow.. I love love D'lish. Food is so good and so well priced. I ended up getting the quinoa oatmeal for breakfast and with no regrets either. My friend got the breakfast bagel with eggs and bacon.. it was so filling that she ended up only eating half. I loved my oatmeal as well, the portions were perfect and it was D'lish! Would definitely love to come here for breakfast again

cSYxNxyPwhKtqEZoptr49g.text: I visit Arizona every two months for work, and make it a point to always come here for breakfast.    I doubt anywhere else compares, and I wouldn't even risk finding out, because that means I'll miss out on either an AZ Burro or a Breakfast Buzz.  Healthy Drive-Thru?  Impossible!  D'Lish made it happen, and they are quick.  Even if there's a line, there will be someone taking orders so that the visit is as quick as possible.  I've never had to wait longer than 15 minutes.  There's a large menu, and I'm sure it's all wonderful, but the AZ Burro and Breakfast Buzz are FANTASTIC.  It starts the day off right.  Do not order both in one sitting...    Parking is tough if you want to go inside.  That may be the one caveat if I were to think of one.

qbmDCtVnzP8P3X1f-CXTAQ.text: So far, nothing but good experiences from this place. I haven't been able to delve into their whole menu quite yet but I will tell you that their shake like drink called the Breakfast Buzz is probably one of the best shake combo drinks I've ever had.   The Breakfast Buzz has vitamins, protein, espresso, nonfat milk, peanut butter, banana, chocolate, and it's blended with ice.  My roommate goes there about five times a week, so if that doesn't say something, I'm not sure what does. I've heard nothing but great things about the staff and food from this place.   Just a warning, the drive-thru line can become incredibly long which shows how yummy and popular it is, however, it can be a bummer when you only want a Buzz. SOOOOO my roommate and I usually call and order it ahead of time so by the time we get there all we have to do is run in and pay, no waiting.   It's about a five minute drive from my house which is wonderful, but the Breakfast Buzz is so good, I usually finished a large by the time I get home. It's a problem, I wish I could make it last longer but it's just so freakin' good.   This place is a great option if you're looking for something healthy and delicious whilst out and about.

-4K0J0c6tWnARffE2m3mbA.text: Had az burro and California club both really good!! We also got a cold frozen drink called the breakfast buzz that had mocha, peanut butter and banana (I did no bananas) that was really good!! Will definitely go back next time I'm in town.

-ucAxLSxaj6RS3WOlChlPQ.text: It is D'lish.  The AZ Burro is real tasty as is the salsa on the side it comes with (at just under $8). Healthy menu options for Breakfast/Lunch.  Small location with seating for about 15+ inside, Parking is very limited.  You must have patience during busy time with parking and leaving - it has a pretty solid drive through line.  There is a small patio that seats 6 i think.  In the 20 or so minutes I spent inside - I have NEVER seen a more physically fit clientele come and go.  Enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. AZ Burro

ClQqPT-9GN87rEj_O7uwhw.text: I got off my flight and came straight to D lite  on a recommendation from a friend. I got the black bean burger and pomegranate tea. It definitely hit the spot . So good I didn't have time to take a photo lOl.... It's healthy, clean and the service is efficient .I would def come back again and recommend it to anyone who is hungry and on the go.

rclf4paggI4nrNUe8b3fnQ.text: I hate that I'm writing this because the food and service are always stellar, but the staff was not kind to me on my last run. Rating 5 stars because 1 bad experience shouldn't ruin the chain of positive feedback. My last experience was disappointing in many ways, I wont be back.

iajZkcW_Zn-1LAcDfavJVg.text: Have eaten from the drive thru a few times, great healthy-ish, fresh tasting sandwiches. I had the club and the chicken sandwich and both are good. The menu is really simple, wish they had one or two more choices on it, but overall, I will keep going back.

Y-Q2-xwINBnOR_Qx3KQPaQ.text: Great little spot to grab a quick breakfast. Ingredients are fresh, menu is unique, prices are reasonable, the guy behind the counter was friendly, and the Breakfast Buzz is AMAZING. I can't wait to go back for lunch to try the 'Man' Salad.

plhVHv7-_xx6GMG_zUNOPA.text: Everything here is amazing.  The menu is healthy and extremely creative at the same time.  Faves right now are green lemonade smoothie and traditional breakfast burrito with chicken sausage and chipotle aioli.

vchNVe6KucnFF5W4DFEWbA.text: Food's fresh and delicious, I always feel good after eating here lol. Will come back again and again. I only wish that they were open later.

J58MfLJoaMWTZ61T1AOMWQ.text: Quality, strong coffees. Hot day?, try an iced toddy!

QrnW6WdTkp81P8gxN40gWQ.text: Well finished, delicious food! However, if you're going through the drive, call in your order! I recommend: everything

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast Buzz... Delicious!

RQVeInZSXNza6ZXRHLDYXw.text: D'lish is just that D'lish, I can see why they named it that!!!  I have become a regular not only for the best Green Tea in the area but also the Men that always great you with a smile and a sparkling attitude whether they are swamped or you are the only person in the place!!!  Everything I have eaten there is D'lish but my personal favorite is the Turkey Club...  If you haven't been here it is a must try!!!

VTHTc_RUCpqGHwjNMsG4ng.text: This is one of my favorite places in AZ.  First of all, the "buzz" is one of the best inventions of the 21st century.  It's delicious.  Both breakfast burritos are phenomenal, but my two favorite items are the oatmeal and the turkey club.  They are superb.  I ashamed to have written this much without mentioning the guys that run the place.  They are hilarious and always in a good mood.

MYDj6ZKKnqA7kc3VDAcruQ.text: Food is good and comes fairly quick, but a little on the pricey side.   Popular place for take out and drive-thru. Eat-in dining area is too small and a little noisy.  Parking can be a nightmare.  Please stay in our neighborhood, but please expand.  Maybe buyout the place next door : )

EOFj8hq427IOKGniLJSfLw.text: I am absolutely obsessed with this place.  Every single thing about it is perfect.  The food.  The drinks.  The service.  The quaintness of the building.  I couldn't possibly explain in words how great I think this place is, but I will surely try.    The first time I ever went here was on New Year's Day and my friends and I still had on our Happy New Years dresses, heels, makeup, the whole 9-yards AND to top it off...we were sporting the hats that boasted HAPPY NEW YEAR all sparkly and obnoxious on it that we had somehow acquired the night before.  We were, needless to say, a bit hungover and ready for some delicious food after an incredible night.  The owners happened to be working that day and immediately jumped on board with us and joined us in shouting happy new year and then proceeded to explain the menu and take their time with us since we were clearly in no state to comprehend much of anything.  Needless to say, I fell in love with not only the owners but also the California Club (which we order on a croissant and add a hashbrown patty to).  This sandwich is like heaven, but better because it exists and is edible.  Seriously, if you're reading this, just stop and head over there for a California Club right now.  It'll be the best thing you have ever done with your life.  Ever since that day, I make special trips to this place (considering I live nearly an hour from it) and have never once been disappointed with the service or anything else.  This place can do no wrong and I just hope more people get the chance to try it because this is one place that should never go out of business.

p2TXvCTbOact38yULXdumA.text: Nice setting, interesting menu with good food for a semi hungover saturday or sunday morning. I suggest the breakfast burrito with chicken sausage potatoes and cheese... it's "D'Lish" lol!!!

xxRmfsMiRzbh4Uj0vsE5dw.text: Love this place! Love the california club and breakfast wrap!! The staff is very friendly and helpful. Best ice tea & iced coffee! If you've never been to D'lish you have got to try it or your really missing out!

tJyewK66jLe-1v9cAf6iug.text: Crazy busy on Saturday morning, avoid the drive thru and parking lot and opt for dining in.    Great, cheappp $5 hummus plate with pesto, aggghhhh so good!   Soup was decent and drinks are popular and well made.   I will be back if Im in the Scottsdale area again soon!

XnL3TPRpweQImo7-us9IIA.text: A buddy and I stopped by for pick-up on our lunch break a few days ago. I had their southwest rice bowl. It was alright...a little on the soupy side, with too much of the enchilada sauce and not enough chicken. It came with blue corn tortilla chips, which sounded good...the bag contained maybe 10 chips? Really? Again, it was alright...I could probably make this at home. It was also a little on the spendy side for what I got. I'll give something else on their menu a try next time.

fJpjq0yMtrWUWkey8EldMg.text: Favorite place to stop after hiking Camelback!  I love this tiny little place on Scottsdale.  Its the best spot to grab a quick bit to eat or some coffee.  The breakfast sandwich is the best!  I love that several of the items on the menu are vegetarian or gluten free.  The staff are always the friendliest people around.  I'm hooked on this place!

-QmgXGLL_76_iUESGsp7ZA.text: All I can say is "OMG"!!!  The first thing I had here after a friend brought me for a quick breakfast was the California club.  It really was like a party in my mouth!  I'm not kidding.  Everything on the menu looks so good I can't wait to try it all.  I'm a little embarrassed to admit it but I have circled all the items that I really want to try on the menu and I'm going through them one by one (I'm a total list crosser-offer).  The last thing I tried there was "oatmeal our way". Which is actually not oatmeal at all, but SO incredible!

0hwSmY1q2xq6_c3iTDACpg.text: Last few times have been consistent! Love the salad. Cant help but keep going back. So D'lish!

SQ5IR7ZI_xoeoAjX_9c8Vw.text: Love the place and food, plus the drinks are outstanding just wish the price were a bit more affordable.

-K1vu6H0ovqw-Jsyhs2Hsg.text: Not McDonald's fast but still faster then In-N-Out yet amazingly good. Don't have a very good side selection at all. The woman who took our order was... eccentric and would be oblivious of who Emily Post is but was still charming and efficient.

B4sg4abdfTrcUfxxtjxLng.text: I love this place... I have been here for breakfast and lunch and have not been disappointed. I just moved here from San Diego and it's nice to finally find a place in Scottsdale with Healthy options, good prices and fast, friendly service!!

s9kO33L9RNS3txmaJ7cz-A.text: Amazing, tasty, healthy, filling food. My husband and I came here routinely for weekend brunch. His favorite was the California club, mine was the early bird protein burger (black bean and quinoa). Parking can be a pain, seating can be limited, and their tiny restroom is accessible outside on the backside of their kitchen... Kinda like a gas station. All that being said, totally worth it.

XAS91xoNLi8AcIbdwreQHQ.text: My wife and I read all the great reviews and decided to give this place a try. The workers were very nice, however the place is a dive. Lots of flies, dingy, very loud rock music playing inside(probably to drown out all the heavy traffic noise outside) We got a breakfast club and a lunch club sandwich. The egg sandwich had lots of mayo on it, which we thought odd. We had to leave before we were finished due to the bugs. About an hour after we got home, we both had upset stomachs. If you're a fan of loud dingy places with lots of flies served up on the side, this is for you.

pTMF_ZbXO0HtkF1kSFSjJQ.text: I have dreamed of a place like this since I can remember.. "Why isnt there a convenient drive-thru place with delicious food? The kind of place that caters to scenarios such as being hungover in your outfit from night before and desiring something so much more than your regular egg mcmuffin and hash brown.  I highly recommend the breakfast burrito/turkey sausage accompanied with green tea. . refreshing and sinfully D'lishous :)

1UNFZxuWUgRcaP1OjHCCiw.text: How do I drive past this place every day and never stop?  Now that I've tried it... I won't make that mistake again!  D'lic has a great menu of fresh breakfast items including several vegetarian and gluten free selections.  Good bye starbucks, I found my new favorite coffee,  I'm so hooked!  Just beware the drive-thru is not super fast because all the food and drinks are made to order, but if you plan for a 10-15 minute wait you'll be fine.  The food is not cheap, but reasonable for fresh ingredients cooked to order.  Definitely give this place a try, great hang over cure after a nice out in OT!

63QhGTfWNDEKBEj4aS_YbQ.text: I hate to be a downer.... My dear friend and I came in after our mid morning trip to the gym hoping to get some coffee and a light bite. I settled on the Organic yogurt and granola and a protein shake after asking a few questions about the granola (I don't like oily granola) and inquiring about the brand of protein powder used. I didn't feel like my questions were answered very well but I was hungry and it was crunch time. My friend got a vanilla latte and a tuna sandwich....we sat down.... I watch the guy begin to make my protein shake....The container for the Protein read Smart Gainer nextag.com/ids-smart-gai... 600 calories and counting. read it for yourself...make since for a weight lifter or a very skinny person trying to gain weight....but I just came from the gym and worked really hard to run off those damn calories. I do not want my protein shake to be a weight gainer....I want in to be what it say it is...simple protein shake.....anyway I watched them make my granola as well...not Organic like they said. I think its important to use what you say you are using...they were using yoplait. Not organic. Humph. On the other hand the tuna sand was pretty good....props on the sandwich but I'm not coming back anytime soon.

5e-TVLa7fDt88Pl5b-oXrA.text: 1 word: Delicious! Seriously...healthy and cute. I'll be honest...I've only tried the breakfast buzz (most delicious protein shake ever). I promise you that if i'm ever in south Scottsdale for lunch or dinner d'lish will be my first preference. I've looked over the menu and everything looks wonderful. I live in east Mesa and work in north Scottsdale...I go out of my way to get a buzz and will continue to do so. Highly recommended!

UbaJKCfELMuBrC8CjQtkmg.text: We just moved into the neighborhood and checked out D'lish after one of my co-worker's recommended it.  We can't get enough!  Great coffee, creative and tasty healthy food and coffee that is expertly made.  I recommend the carmel, the mocha and my husband likes the Buzz smoothie.  The quinoa oatmeal with rice milk and fresh fruit is d'lish as is the california breakfast sandwich which is the perfect balance of flavors on a ciabatta bun.  The employees are so much fun and are friendly and fast to get you your order. If you're in South Scottsdale stop in, you won't be disappointed!

bpvKQUI6U-FRJ6AeStdVSQ.text: Just had a meeting here and it was great. Nice big cup of tea and a great environment. Too early for food but I'll definitely be back to try it out!

t4AYbd4jwddzNy2O-zBpeQ.text: We've been for breakfast - breakfast sandwich was super yummy and just recently tried lunch.  Recommend the tuna and turkey club sandwiches.

DBETZTS4GKoVyNbm-G-QVg.text: 3 Stars for the food, zero stars for the ambiance/noise/parking.  Maybe that's why they have the words 'drive'thru' in their name.  I got the Kitchen Sink salad, added Chicken.  It was fine, and a decent price.  But the noise level in the restaurant was so incredibly loud that my friend and I actually would just burst out laughing because we coudn't hear a word that either was saying.  Throw in a blender and then random music being turned up even louder just for good measure and it just became comical.  I would go back for the food and bring it back to my desk, but would never actually eat there again.

JQmV60vnXAuht7uzqJ3-SQ.text: I have eaten here four times. That proved to be four times too many. I tried, oh I tried, to find something appealing about this place. Beyond the very friendly staff, nothing else is making me want to come back. On my first venture, I ordered a breakfast burrito. Folks, you have to cook the egg. A runny egg, so runny I think the whites were still runny, in a breakfast burrito, is a breeding ground for disease. I mean, cook the friggin' egg. The next time I went I ordered a breakfast sandwich. It was served on a bialy. They forgot to include flavor - any flavor. I started to chew on the wax paper to add some spice. I kept blaming myself, I mean I read these reviews and I wonder what is wrong with me. I only wonder that for a brief moment. Janice B says she is in NY and can't stop thinking about D'Lish. WHAT??? Are you iactually living in the city or are you trapped on the top floor of Bellevue? There is nothing, absolutely nothing in Phoenix or anywhere else that compares to anything in NYC. One moment in NYC makes you forget the rest of the world exists. I digress, anyway, my third visit was the veggie burrito. Nothing I like better than raw mushrooms stuffed in a burrito. Why did I go back for a fourth visit? I did, I ordered a mushroom soup. I thought they would have to cook the mushrooms in the soup? Who knows, it tasted like water. Dear D'Lish, the way you make mushroom soup is very simple. Start with some shallots, saute them in a stock pot, you can add onions and garlic if you wish. Next add a whole mess of mushrooms, you can just use white ones, or mix them up, cremini, portabella, oyster, just saute them until all the water is removed, then add stock and cook for about 20 minutes - blend soup to a creamy texture, finish with some milk or cream and you have soup. Salt and pepper to taste. So simple, and yet you just couldn't do it. I can't come back, sorry, four times is way too many attempts, but good luck, it appears many people do enjoy your flavorless, poorly cooked options.

2HPlLV7q_5W95UFreACJMQ.text: I love this place not because the food is great, fresh, and healthy. Not because its got a great neighborhood feel to it, but because its full of deadly handsome bearded men that work there.

PeNwt5vinEw1WHdd7zK0DQ.text: Food was great. The place is very small and anytime, they were turning the blender on, it was a lot of noise inside the restaurant making the atmosphere uncomfortable to sit and have a chat with friends. I figured next, I will only go through drive through.

HYKQ1vwR79OxJbdOXS9PAw.text: so i've been here a couple times now and i'm only writing this because i am definitely a fan of this place. i've only gotten the chicken pesto panini but it's just so damn good, i can't bring myself to try anything else. this, however, ain't exactly healthy for you as it's loaded down with pesto and feta AND it's served up on some texas toast! damn! my friend has gotten a few different things including some kinda turkey wrap and a club sandwich. they were both very good too!  parking and seating can be tough during lunch-i've warned you!  bonus points for being locally owned.

0ch_EUsYFzToeExhe4bWZg.text: This place is awesome! I live right by and I love that they have a really healthy menu. I have two friends that are picky eaters, one gluten free and the other vegeterian and this place is perfect for both. They have a menu that specifies which items are vegetarian and which items are gluten free (so we don't have to annoyingly ask a hundred questions like we do at other restaurants). I like D'lish because I'm on a 'mostly protein' diet and they have plenty of options for me- my favorite is their Man Salad and their Breakfast Buzz (which is an awesome espresso drink mix with protein powder). Great prices and nice staff..I will keep coming back:)

kkSzKui71J49qQfscTopqg.text: Loved the breakfast croissants here. Friendly and fast service, and a small business feel. The iced drinks are also a plus!

coHIBB_qcI4GJl6n0vlMIg.text: Love, love, love this spot! Great food options but my favorite item is the Breakfast Buzz! It's a blended iced drink with espresso, protein powder, peanut butter, banana and several other ingredients. It's basically like a meal replacement shake and tastes amazing. I'm addicted now! Great coffee shop/lunch atmosphere and very very friendly service. There's a drink thru window available as well.

IIjQGLfsd1phlG9oLAIEuw.text: Stopped there for breakfast. A cozy little place, with very friendly and smiling persons. Their house coffee is fine, but will have to go back for a dirty chai. I had also a bagel (just like any other). A nice drive through, and a good alternative to start the day!

syRj-RYyZJKG8-1yv0FC_g.text: Great place to go before heading to the zoo. Not a lot of seating if you're with a big party

czDCSWd6h2BbDVZQ7_WYOg.text: The ultimate java drive through joint! Coffee is aromatic and sturdy. Much like my Aunt Miriam in Berkley. Staff is SO friendly and accommodating. I've never been inside, so as far as I know they are only torsos serving me. I've had the breakfast burrito and it was perfect for eating in the car. Yes, I was driving and eating. Bad driver! Bad!
