At least I wasn't texting! A couple of times I've had our dog with me and they always throw in a Scooby snack for Emilie. This is the obvious alternative to Starsucks. And if the line gets too long, they come out in person to take orders and get your morning liquid bean fix started!

XtagB4wJI1VEOEBaBm1kGw.text: I've only ordered one thing on the menu...and that's the House Style frittata. It's amazing. That's why I kept ordering it. I've also had the Breakfast Buzz shake minus the peanut butter and that was also great.   One thing that's weird about the drive thru is that they walk up to you and ask what you want. Like, before you've seen a menu. Idk what i want yet dude ! If you ask, they give you a menu, but I just think that that's weird. There's probably a small percentage of people who know what they want before looking at a menu. So give me one first, then ask later...anyway not a big deal.

KFC0pcnjwKwjxAujNpf5Ng.text: Hit this place up while on vacation for spring training was looking for something fast and healthy man this place was sooo goooood!! Love the breakfast burritos and that fresh squeezed orange juice!! Definitely will be hitting this place up again next year when we come back for baseball!

gK6kINphHa2nRr8TcpDfHw.text: Ok not gonna lie!! I don't cook!! I know they are sick of seeing my face but I go here 6 days a week.  No joke!!! I can even get my dog doggie bags which they love!!! I get the tuna melt and mushroom soup! I haven't had one bad thing here!!! Seriously try it!!!

hcK7IQLBI-CNLiIlxvS9-w.text: Great, fast, high quality, and consistent. Always a great option. My favorite is the club and pomegranate green tea.

ytTK-rTwpaauUt14yeQViw.text: The California Club was bomb. We went through the drive through, and although there was a line several cars long we only waited 10 minutes. The four berry smoothie was also "d'lish."

794nuVIguCp35MoiVkKzow.text: I love this place so much!  I love places that are exactly what you expect with great food.  It's not huge, not an amazing dining experience on the inside, etc.  It's great food, nice people, good prices, and EXACTLY what you want when you go there.  Healthy fresh selections. I have a hard time driving past it and not stopping in!!

Lvu0XaWLryDmLmUusFLw-w.text: I'm in love with this place. I've passed it so many times and didn't realize it was actually a heathy place to eat especially since it's next to a Mexican fast food stand. My friend got the "man salad" and I got the "California club". It was nice to be able to get breakfast and lunch at 9:45am. I got the their chocolate, espresso, protein iced drink and it was great! I loved the reggae music. FYI It's a small place and doesn't have public bathrooms and neither does the Mexican place next store so don't go to crazy I the fluids.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The California avocado sandwich on sourdough. Monterey Jack and cream cheese OTS.
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The &#34;man salad&#34;, ice tea, and protein iced espresso.

WrlO36dpJUgAw9be84UK-w.text: Ok WOW! Need a fast but NOT "fast" food meal. This is the place to be. Amazing healthy food that comes out quick. For all you men who think you're too manly for a salad come sink your teeth into The 'Man' Salad and wash it down with a "Breakfast Buzz" (protein, espresso, milk, bananas, chocolate, & peanut butter). Guaranteed to fill you up and still complement that gym workout. Bowls, Burgers. Whiches/Wraps, Salads, Shakes, & even some pretty dang good Breakfast. With locations in Scottsdale, Tempe, & just around the corner in Hawaii, make sure to pop in or hit the drive through for some D'Lish fast food that is anything but "fast food".

T9xv_hWzJ4zhb7KE9JqaZQ.text: This place has wonderful, interesting food and a cute, small indie shop vibe with an outdoor patio - love it!!  Their protein burger, house style, is probably my favorite veggie burger in the valley. They call it hearty and healthy, and it is, but the taste is the best part: house style has portobello, feta, pesto, cucumber sauce and tomatoes - wow!!   Delicious breakfast, too, and they have a bustling drive-through window. Come early: they close at 4pm. And watch out: they have no public restrooms.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Frittata with veggies on toast with pesto sauce - so delicious!!
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. D&#39;lish oatmeal : tasty, with quinoa in place of oats, light maple syrup, fresh fruit, w/choice of milk. Side of granola, too.
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Super cute little place!

ekN9lL2Y4AtTILb7A-m5dA.text: Came back here 4 years later when I was in town a couple weeks ago.  The day after partying all night,, we were looking for food that was quick and not too pricey in Scottsdale.  I thought of D'lish because I remember the fresh and healthy menu that I loved when I first discovered it.  Fried, greasy, or heavy food was just not acceptable to me that day.  Sad that I was not able to share that same fresh experience with my friends this time with the food here.  My boyfriend ordered a breakfast burrito and it looked horrible inside once he bit into it. The eggs were green, way overcooked, and didn't really look like eggs.  Just looked like a light green meat patty.  Not sure what happened.  I won't say that I won't come back here ever again, but I hope they'll get back to serving more fresh and high quality food.

uiiQWNKunBuvWJYtS6hmnQ.text: It's an ok sandwich. Rather bland. Could not taste any of the supposed pesto. Small. Most certainly not worth $7.25. Won't go back. I think the locals must be starved for half-decent food to attract the reviews it has. Very emu deserving. Should be a 3-star rating at best.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tiny sandwich for $7.25. Unimpressive. Undeserving of the stellar reviews.
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

wSSHRrfZGTnIGcGHTp8r7g.text: I was led here by yelp reviews. When I came here, there was no one and I thought I had made a mistake. I walked in and there was a tall guy at the register which was extremely friendly. My friend and I ordered and when our food came out, I understood why this place is so popular. The sandwich was so warm, perfect, soft, and just amazing overall. I ordered the cali club and my friend ordered the turkey sandwich. Both were great!   And then as we were leaving, there was about 9 cars lined up at the drive-thru. We'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Just how I like my sandwiches: obnoxiously stuffed.

Qw14flW_3NT7Z1obt7Aq6Q.text: They have HANDS DOWN the best tuna salad sandwich I've had in The Valley. And also, because they understand that tuna sandwiches are delicious both cold and hot, I am now giving a hard pass on any tuna sandwich unless it's from D'lite. I eat fish, but can't stomach much else in the meat department and their southwestern bowl (without chicken) is a solid choice as well. I'm truly "living my best life" when I'm eating their tuna salad (good for those who are also a big dill like myself ) Thank you D'lite, what a great start to my culinary adventures this year

jvnDQET2RDWoWpZUywRl9A.text: Get this delicious food to go u less you enjoy eating a deliciously delicate breakfast sandwich amidst a cacophony of whirls, beats and operational mechanics.

Ze6_tI0IyfjFICTcwF_1tg.text: I love eating at d'lite! They are getting so popular it is sometimes hard to get in the drive through line! I'd recommend calling in your order and picking it up inside. But the food is so delicous and makes you feel really good! I like getting the humanitarian wrap and also the veggie burgers! The price is always fair for the delicous portion you'll receive :)

s57RY2YWumoyXqRYcZhFpA.text: I absolutely love this place! Yes the lines can be long at times, but the staff goes above and beyond to take your order. The staff have always been friendly and every one seems to really enjoy working there. My drink of choice is the "breakfast buzz" hits the spot every time. I am looking forward to going there tomorrow to get my buzz on!

w_EPwkPxmCV96Zq35V61gA.text: Looking for food? Try somewhere else! D'lish is the go to place for a breakfast buzz!! Best thing on the menu :)

GfSolKv-2GgdzapFKyE_vA.text: Awesome food and everyone is great! Duh it's going to be busy and lines are going to be long because it's SO good. Duh it's going to be loud sometimes because it's a small place and blenders are loud. Duh it's not going to be sunshine and rainbows every time but this place has great food, easy selections, and the guys and gals get you in and out of there as fast as they can, NOT to be rude but so you can be on your way. :)

d7szzhM7u-ezhdmXiPjGOA.text: Stopped by before a baseball game--- very busy parking lot and drive thru. Decided to park and try our luck inside...and we got our sandwiches pretty fast. Tried the tomato turkey wrap and the chicken panini. Both were very delicious... Full of fresh ingredients and tastiness. Perfect for a healthy lunch. Also, the service was friendly even though it was crazy busy.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. All matching! Tomato turkey wrap.

64bdpzTIP4HutKtFYAvf2g.text: My girlfriend and I had spent the previous four days hiking around Arizona and we were looking for something fast, healthy, and relatively inexpensive.  We found all three in D'Lite!  She loved her California Club and I devoured my black bean and quinoa burger.  My girlfriend wishes we had a place like this back in Cleveland as she would certainly be a regular.  We also thoroughly enjoyed the decor inside the restaurant!

R6KuwM2Norn0Sno8oFC_pQ.text: Humanitarian wrap with extra veggies filled my tummy hole today and both my tummy and I were happy for that! Quinoa, hummas, veggies, pesto, feta on a sundried tomato wrap. Super good! I have been here a few times now and the only reason for the loss of star is that their parking spot has potential to be a nightmare during busy times.   I have had their hummus plate and kombucha on previous trips and both were wonderful! The hummus is much more flavorful than I have had at other places and the veggies on the wrap and the plate have always tasted fresh and crisp. My dude loves their chicken salad and swears by it AND was totally jealous I went for lunch without him.   I am definitely enticed to frequent here more regularly knowing their effort toward sustainable practices seem legit, my lunch was given in a paper wrap without a plastic bag and I dig that! They say their produce is organic or locally sourced when available which is super stellar as far as I'm concerned.  I haven't yet tried their breakfast burritos or any of the bowls but it certainly gives me something to look forward to.

lyXrJwSJx37SiphLL-3xlQ.text: This place is awesome. I was in town visiting from Las Vegas and found it based on all the Yelp Reviews. I got here just in time before the drive thru line went out into the street. I ordered the turkey sandwich with no bacon and it was delicious. Probably one of the best sandwiches I've had in a long time. The ice coffee was good too. I highly recommend this place! A+++

gEhGa5MaxTRx0eZbchGovg.text: Was recently in town and just discovered them. I absolutely love this place. Kind of reminds me of the greens and proteins chain in Las Vegas...only better.  They have an excellent menu to cover a wide variety of tastes and nutritional needs which is well priced and a good value to boot. Service was super polite and friendly which I always appreciate. But they went above and beyond on my first visit...they noticed I was traveling with my flat nosed beast (boxer dog) and hooked her up with a doggie bag of meat snacks after they asked me what she likes. The only knock on this place would be that the drive thru fills up and spills out onto Scottsdale road.  As a result, navigating the tight parking juxtaposed with the drive thru line takes some patience and a little skill, but the food quality and value combined with the awesome & friendly service easily outweigh any minor negatives. Just wish they had a location closer to where I live.

sE1i9tnFhG53px9mftY5HQ.text: Stopped over after an early morning job. My first time there so had to try the signature California Club. Rock solid morning sandwich! The medium egg was perfect with the avocado and pepper jack cheese it was amazing. Would have given a higher rating but the nitro coffee missed the mark, could not even see or taste a hint of nitro. When asked about it they checked the system and gave a new one but it tasted the same, pretty much an ice coffee. Overall great place but pick up the quality on the coffee.

D_5ivHz58_ZrFGROenXvxQ.text: Delicious, healthy food.  Great choice for vegans.  The breakfast shakes were a huge hit.  Bialy's were really good.  The place is really small and parking is a bit difficult.  The drive through was busy.  Staff was really nice and helpful.  Wish there was one in Chandler.  Can't wait to go back.

OBtkiCcvrcMKnj33ifgQYw.text: Ordered the low carb meal which consisted of potatoes, eggs, bacon and avocado. Ordered an orange drink to go along with it. We ended up eating outside which follows alongside the building. The whole shop had a mom and pop feel along with quick services. Will return-

ZaOIKmXQafQiw5K7HPd2vQ.text: Favorite drive through breakfast. Super healthy and fast. We also walk there with the dogs and they have great outdoor seating and even dog treats. The Almond Buzz is a must!!

Lp6t3NWpQOCPzLVAbwFILA.text: I've been here a few times for breakfast. The food and beverages are definitely great and the drive thru moves quickly for sure. The prices are steep though! 15 for a Cali club and smallest smoothie. Would come more often if it were more reasonably priced

_JCWcmvABWorZCEz7pU9eg.text: Food is amazing and always taste fresh... When you can make it here.... Id be here 2 or 3 times a week if their hours didnt suck. You come most times of the day and its busy . but still they close early . just doesn't make sense. Stay open til 6 or 7 and get the crowd who is just getting off work.

owSNrPyCLQp759UYI0-PsA.text: I absolutely love their food, the one thing I will say is that they claim to be "healthy" yet they don't state the nutritional facts on any of their meals.. This may be False advertisement which is a bit disappointing. Can I please suggest for you guys to provide this for your customers? Thank you!

D85qgfoL5tyk_wh1XOI8UQ.text: What a find. Amazing food and healthy.  Will be returning as I love healthy choices.  Everything was so fresh and had amazing flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

1JIOsiEXxzT7A2IPKAaEOQ.text: I enjoyed two tasty meals here while I was in town. Even the coconut milk Latte was amazing. Breakfast burritos had me hooked.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

TbP42hK6r47TdOLGYq8Wgg.text: Love this place! They have a drive thru that moves pretty quick if you don't want to go in. Kinda smaller place but you can dine in. Don't blink or you'll miss this place driving by! I primarily stop by for the Vegan Buzz shake. So d'licious!

XA-ukiCmMMcd7n70Uytq4g.text: The vegan and gluten free options are mediocre at best... i've tried this place probably 5 times now and the sauce on the vegan wrap was flavorless, the GF wrap itself sticks to your teeth and has a weird taste and that wrap is the only GF alternative on the menu... It would be more worth waiting in line and going if I could get a GOOD vegan shake AND a good vegan wrap or GF bagel...

1HLq6qamTHWT_riZ2S-kCw.text: Loved what I ordered here!   The low-carb breakfast is a great idea, and I think it will inspire me to create a similar meal at home.  A hash brown, two over-easy egg, atop a bed of greens all drizzled in pesto.  A pairing I wouldn't have thought to make on my own, but works wonderfully together!  Their pesto is not too thick, and tasted really fresh (maybe house-made?)  It was the perfect lunch for me, and I probably could've been satisfied with just one egg.  The california club sandwich was also noteworthy and full of flavor.  I could eat this for lunch, and maybe even dinner!  Man salad was huge - served in a gigantic bowl and included toasted bread.  There were a few parking spots, and a drive-thru.  Coming at an odd hour had plenty of seating, but not sure if this is True to the rush hours.  If you don't know where you're going - be sure to look out for it as you're driving by... It's easy to miss.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Low carb breakfast - yum!

7DZ0WYaghV1znv2kklcCCQ.text: Wow. I've long believed that the only way for me to stay in shape was to eat food I didn't like. I obviously hadn't met the guys at this restaurant. Not only is the staff friendly and helpful, but the menu and the food is amazing.  At the owner's recommendation I tried the hot tuna sandwich and was blown away. Fresh Dill really made the sandwich pop And made it a totally different take on good old tuna. I can't wait for my next one. Good job guys!  I wish I would've taken a picture but the sandwich got destroyed way too fast for that. :-)

2aj97lboc_PdFNyeqagRxg.text: Crowded space but you can def get something healthy to go.  Tried their signature hummus wrap and California breakfast sandwich.  Very tasty.  The portions aren't huge but healthy.    Glad to have healthier joints in the East Valley.

xTURibWlAblqxENVxrx7QQ.text: Disappointing- I see a lot of cars here regularly so I dropped by to get lunch today. I ordered the southwest bowl, which consisted of a piece of broccoli and 4 pieces of chicken over rice. The sauce or soup in the bowl seemed to be thickened with something, I'm not sure how healthy it might have actually been. For about $10 I would have expected higher quality.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ajmz5CQA4zjZtrUMmZ59Ww.text: This place always kills it. Very consistent, and always delicious. My usual is the Vegan Buzz (solely because I like the taste better than the regular buzz) and the California Club. Today I got the Turkey Club which was great, but still doesn't beat the Cali Club IMO. A little pricy, but I would highly recommend everything here.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Turkey Club

vtP1K-6x_XoNannj2A_oDA.text: Great service through drive thru, Employees greet with a smile and are professional. Food was awesome, delicious, had me a Turkey club but worth it.  Recommend this spot for all my friends !

0B5f3CTdsbVeqgmC54XoBg.text: Really enjoyed this place. I'm always trying to find new things to love and this place satisfied me even with my particular tastes. My husband loved his panini and I loved my turkey sandwhich. It's very small, but very nice to sit on the patio and enjoy good, healthly food with a lemonade! Would love to come here again.

WeOFdE2v5oerQZ_TbQgnyA.text: Quick and helpful service! Large portions and everything was honestly delicious :) only visiting town for a couple days but plan to come back for sure

on84oKGe6rU4vQYnR1CwEg.text: Believe the hype.  Just moved to this part of town recently and am now frequenting this place whenever I can (since they close at 4pm).  The fact that I can get amazing, fresh, natural, often organic and local food, in a drive thru is awesome.  This place is very small but it doesn't matter because it's all good and usually pretty quick (considering what you get).  I even ordered soup when it was 105 degrees just because i wanted to try everything!  And I don't mind paying extra cuz it's always fresh, delicious and they're friendly (and cute) so why not.  You probably drive by it all the time and don't even notice it, but you're missing out.  Can't wait to try their dinner entrees (even though they close at 4pm) they also have a lot of breakfast stuff and smoothies and coffees too.

6ybmRu_Fa603pLghff3QTw.text: Aptly named! We shared the veggie burrito and the az burro. Both were fresh and delicious.   And the other yelpers were correct: great coffee!

MfzgSZwNVSar59TJyaXDIA.text: This place has the BEST breakfast sandwiches in town.  I come here all he time when i want a filling/healthy/delicious breakfast.  If you don;t want anything that heavy i am also a fan of their low carb breakfast...Their dinner pasta bowl is also really good-i'm not the biggest fan of their lunch though, not that it isn't good, it's just that i expected it to match how much i love their breakfast-but you might have a different taste.  The other reason this isn't a 5star rating is also because they can take a long time.  Most of the time it's fine because they are making it from scratch but sometimes it goes over average and when that happens you would think it would be better than the last time but they aren't the most consistent.  Please-go here for breakfast and try it, it's a great neighborhood coffee place.

EQzWLbvR_3ldRyqaZNs7Fg.text: Loved everything about this place...food, vibe, price, service.

uVSTOp4_j6xdyUPwtoO0Sg.text: I ate here for the first time this morning as an Arizona tourist.  I got the vegetarian burrito with avocado and put a little sriracha sauce on it.  It was fantastic!  I went in really wanting just some scrambled eggs or an omelet, which wasn't exactly what they offered, so i got this instead.  I am quite picky and not an easy mind changer, but I'd like to go back tomorrow to get the exact same thing.  I wish this existed closer to where I live (Colorado).  It was a little loud in the store itself, but its because it was a weekend morning during breakfast hours.  I'd recommend this place highly!  The also had free additions to coffee such as soy milk and flavors, which is a greatly appreciated touch.

xmccabd2_wicwtIgnDfT7Q.text: This speakeasy was kickass. The staff is super down to earth and the menu is great. The drive thru is an awesome touch. I got the Turkey Club and it was reallllllly good. We received 2 randomly free samples of a shake and smoothie and had some good conversation with the guys behind the counter. It gets a little noisy if they're makin shakes in there, and the seating is pretty limited. I wish they were open later but so far I'm loving it!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Orange Glorious &amp; the California Club :) it doesn&#39;t get any better than this

f3FsJ0DJI-vS2wAtTLNdtg.text: I really liked our stop at D'lish. It was first place we visited when we stepped off the plane for Spring Training, and just the breakfast I had been wanting since 3:30 AM. Thanks to all the great Yelpers in Scottsdale, we decided quickly on D'lish, and found it to be up to all the hype. The food is delicious, healthy, and fast, and we were not at all disappointed. The inside is small, but we had a great spot on the outside. As someone who loves to eat on the healthy side, this was the perfect stop to get us geared up for a weekend of baseball.

AsfdcW1yRNghfGamut9x1w.text: D'Lish was a random find for me and a friend, as we were looking for a more palatable option than our standard Dunkin Donuts hangover breakfast. I was surprised to have not heard of it sooner, as it was nearly within walking distance.  I perused their menu on their website, had a game plan then headed in. The seating area is small but not cramped, and is tastefully modern and cozy. The two other girls seated inside with me were both wearing Tori Burch flats, so I knew it was a little more highbrow than your standard hipster hangout. I ordered a vegetarian breakfast burrito, and brought back a classic breakfast burrito for my friend. They were quite tasty- very fresh and not greasy. I also had the "sexy dirty chai" I read so much about (a chai tea with coffee and vanilla) and it lived up to all expectations. I'm craving one right now, as a matter of fact.  Since then, I've also tried their yogurt parfait with fresh seasonal fruit and it was amazing as well. Their bagels are soft and delicious, and I'm looking forward to trying a Bialy sandwich next. Everything I've tried has been of good quality and freshness. I have yet to be disappointed with the food or the friendly service.  My only issue is that I don't think they quite have their "flow" down yet. Both visits took considerably longer than they should have for a small to-go order. It was much faster to phone in my order and pick up at the drive through window, rather than order and wait inside. Plus, when I used the drive through, I didn't even have to put on pants to go get breakfast. Does it get much better than that?

53kdO5eM-sg8NDwAxXZ_AA.text: This place is reasonably priced and has great fresh food.  Everyone is really nice.  Great for breakfast for lunch.  Veggie friendly which is a plus!  I wish there was a place like this where I live.

7lwFJmWj7-tLlPw7hKMOpA.text: I had no idea this place was here until I read about it on Yelp. I think it's usually dark when I'm down there and I'm focused on getting into Los.  I knew I was getting a Dirty Chai Latte. Pulled up to one window...should I stay? Go? pull forward? The pressure!  Pulled forward and was greeted by a rather homely looking young guy..ha! Right? Homely!  His shirt said "wanted" and he wasn't kidding.  How could he know what was in my head?  Seriously beautiful. I even called my husband to tell him how beautiful this boy was. He's young. I don't know that he's a boy..I'm just sayin'.   I almost didn't want to order my Dirty Chai Latte because I had to say "dirty" and I was afraid it would purrrrrr out of me like a cougar.  I managed to order without purring. It was delicious and I was on my way. Life is good.

lSg-9QLivWWyYpONev9FwQ.text: Friendly staff and food is stellar.  Second time in and had the nuts and berries salad with chicken.  To die for!

z3hKlaDK7PP-y14fy79vGQ.text: Kitchen sink salad like I would make myself-mixed greens, carrots, celery, feta, cukes, cous cous, raisins. Love it!

5a5KWkxGDpAUm43ZFa91HA.text: Sometimes I like it Hot and Dirty, and no one gives it to me better than Kyle and Chad.   I'm talking Chai's people, get your mind outta the gutter! ;-)   Seriously you need to try a Dirty Chai Latte!  And if your not the type to want to hang around for meaningless small talk after you get it dirty, they have a drive thru for your convenience!

iVAepvCRYS5ErI-a-ilXpA.text: Ok, I pretty much love this place! The dudes that work here and/or own it are very cool and friendly.  They aren't bad to look at either, I'm just saying. I just like to hang out here.  They are doing some remodeling and in general making this place even better. They are adding some sort of juice bar component soon, which is great.   One dude knew who I was by my Yelp review, which was cool & a little scary.  He had a great take on Yelp though, and has the right attitude that a lot of the feedback can be constructive.  One guy working there wasn't a Yelp fan, which was fine with me, he gave perfect service and made me feel totally welcome.  I respect his point of view. We all don't have to like the same things...right.  They know my stance on pillows there, and I would love it if they would stay open longer on weekends. I will bring my own Baileys....Please!!!!!  Seriously great place.

cxG0act6_PG6Kxy7r0kv2g.text: My favorite drive-thru! I wish they would expand and open one in North Scottsdale. Only downside is they aren't open past 4.

fMe0vH3MeU7QNTYWxGPWqA.text: WOW!! This place is awesome. I love local coffee establishments. The place had a really homey feel to it. The art design on the wall gave the place a unique feel. They're hand drawn and painted, which separates itself from the Starbucks mass-produced art work.   I loved the fact they used Pandora as their music source. Lots of great collection from indie musicians.   I ordered the 12oz Mocha which was very delightful to the palette. It was smooth and refreshing, it didn't have that burn taste. It was just great! Their menu is VERY healthy.  The owners are very welcoming and great to talk to. I like how they interact with the customers which give it that personal connection. I'm definitely going back to this place it's just a GREAT place to hang!!  This place has potential. They are expanding their menu so watch for goodies within the next couple of months. They buy a lot of their produce from local farms which help sustain the community - I'm a big fan of that!!

rHTjvrN4aSUBpNrjtJkRVA.text: Checked out D'Lish with Gabi and crew. Really cool space with super-efficient drive-thru and friendly staff.  I sampled the "Breakfast Buzz," which is a delicious smoothie made with espresso, Nestle good morning mix, banana, chocolate, and peanut butter. The owner claims the Breakfast Buzz has restorative properties for those suffering from hangovers.  The coffee was also excellent. I'm 99% sure D'lish sources its beans from Echo Espresso on the west side.   Bonus: you can buy 160 ounces of coffee (in a disposable insulated box) for 20 bucks. That might be enough to get your group through a PowerPoint presentation or two.

4y6r5ajssGgMam4FN6J20g.text: I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS PLACE!!  The food is great and the people are really friendly!  There are a few issues I must call to your attention.  1.  The place is very small.  2.  The drive through is so busy, at times the line goes out to the street.  (Scottsdale Rd)  3.  Because the inside is small, it can be very noisey when they are making smoothies.  4.  They do not have a location in Gilbert.  :o)   None of these are deal breakers, that is why I still give this place a 5 star review.  If you are looking for a place off the beaten path, with healthy choices, this is a must!

pll8_OB0zBifL10wv1-M-g.text: Can they fix the pothole in the drive-thru already?   Also, waiting 20 minutes before my order is even taken has me considering other places to go to for my "breakfast buzz."  The breakfast buzz is usually spot on and d'lish, but the last 2 times I've gone, it tastes like I swallowed vitamins-without any water. Gross. I know vitamins are an ingredient, but it shouldn't be the only ingredient I taste.

NQbJZuWqcVJH6VkWeyjvgg.text: This restaurant reminds me of being in Portland for some odd reason. The restaurant is pretty small, but the good thing is they have a drive-thru.  Breakfast selections were straight to the point. I had their Low-Carb breakfast that I ordered with a side of chicken sausage. I have no idea why this place calls this breakfast "low-carb" because it comes with a hash brown. I think a piece of wheat toast would have lower carbs than a baked hash brown. I would probably rename this  "Low-Carb" breakfast to "breakfast salad" because all it was just a salad with a hash brown and egg on top. It was served on a bed of greens with tomatoes on the side. The dish had balsamic vinaigrette on the bottom of the greens, and pesto sauce drizzled on the top.  I didn't like how my eggs were over hard.  In fairness, this dish had a nice presentation.   If I were to remake this dish, I would probably have the eggs poached, skip the hash brown, and add turkey bacon crumbles. The chicken sausage was nothing special. It was one sausage sliced up covered in cheese that became hard. They should probably grate the cheese over the sausage so it melts delicately on the sausage.   My brother-in-law had the breakfast "traditional burrito".  He was not to happy with it and thought it could use more cheese and flavor.  This is definitely a quasi healthy spot.

RDc-lDPN9XiLaIbiPUoF6Q.text: This place is awesome! The food is amazing, I love the California Club breakfast sandwich and the orange smoothie. I highly recommend D lite!

f58jDEBFHs-jWDIZ6kBkiQ.text: I enjoyed it and the flavors. I had the chicken panini and the bf had the breakfast bagel. It doesn't include any sides but we weren't too hungry anyway.   Service was fine... run by some older teens. Not that friendly but not bad service either. I think one kid was in training as I think I knew the menu better than he did, and it was my first time there! :-P I'm sure he'll do fine.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken panini and breakfast bagel

Yubp3GpYpFmFraLq29Ltfw.text: Omgosh. Thank goodness we didn't try this place while we were still living in Arizona or else we'd be broke from coming here all the time! We tried their drive thru, dined in, and had gotten take out. Everything is so good, fresh, and made so quickly! It's nice that they made drive-thru an option - a much healthier alternative to your typical fast food joints.  Food: 1) Turkey club 2) Veggie d'lite 3) Dirty chai (chai with a shot of espresso) - tried it hot & cold. Both were good but the iced was a little better 4) Protein shake 5) AZ Burro 7) Veggie Burrito 7) Breakfast buzz  All the drinks and food were so delicious and cheap considering how healthy it is! All the workers are polite and they work fast. My mouth is watering as I write the review! Oh how I miss D'lish...!

3tXC48-5qtJ2nt40eK3Q1w.text: This is my first time here. This place is really popular and busy. It's a tiny place. Most of its business seems to happen through its drive through. But inside its nonstop as well. Not a huge menu, but big enough and with enough variety to make my selection take a little time. The girl was very patient with me. A guy at the breakfast bar suggested the California Club. It's their signature breakfast sandwich. I went with that and a iced coffee. This is a really good sandwich. Artisan bread and all the ingredients are really fresh. Oh and the iced coffee was really good and strong. I really like this place and will come back. If you are looking for a new place that isn't a chain and has a lot of healthy choices and healthy also means yummmy, here is your place.

zUXq5ASzaUaK2c13M_41Aw.text: I would really, really, really like to give this place a glowing review HOWEVER I have never in my life, in all the cities I've been to, eaten at a domestic restaurant that did not have a restroom for customers.     WTF!!!??!!!   Even in third world countries, you can slip someone $5 to use the restroom!   They'll even throw in some sheets of toilet paper...  I wish I had some of the juvenile attributes, I despise, in some of my more interesting friends.   I'd love to pull my pants down and pee on their patio.

mY82KymDcDhxR6SPxEpRzg.text: so glad we visited this little shop - it was amazing to the extent we went there for breakfast and lunch and if they served dinner would have been there for dinner too!

1DPZQdF566nf3DDbxXK18A.text: AZ burro, California Club, and of course, the Breakfast Buzz are my go to's. Everything bagel toasted with cream cheese is also a good simple option. The prices increased recently which is understandable since they said they haven't in a number of years. I would definitely recommend.

sJWdYWDzwnJFfMZuCK6x7A.text: Was expecting much better of the nuts and berries salad.  Turned out to be very mediocre.    The place is very popular though.  Every time I pass at lunch hour the drive through is jammed back to Scottsdale Rd.  It's very likely you will have to drive a few blocks up the street to park.  I can't imagine how much business they lose on a daily basis due to the inconvenience of the parking lot/drive-through.    Anyway, friendly enough staff but it took a while to get my food, they nickle and dimed me in charging for adding a few raisins to my salad, and the salad was very average.

s3FRnqL23vcAnCIMrUKQdA.text: New to Scottsdale and wanted a quick breakfast on the weekend. So I stopped by d'lish .  I got the California club which was amazing. It has turkey, bacon, cheese, egg and avocado. It's an awesome breakfast sandwich .  Everyone was nice and my sandwich wasn't to long of a wait . They also have a drive thru which is awesome for a nicer breakfast place than mcdonalds .  I will definitely be returning .

xinmsYgEGvJ6Nq9AHnDf7w.text: The food is very fresh and tasty. I love it so much that I always order the same thing! The California Club is amazing and you can actually taste all the ingredients... It's not just a mishmash of things that seem like it's not worth paying for.   The hummus plate is very good. I wish they gave more pita bread because we always have way more hummus in the end.   For two people it's about 20 dollars (excluding tip) if you get drinks too.

LN7fGvRlUnGCNVxmkFDj3Q.text: Well they got the name right with this place because it is DEEEELISH!  I've been here twice (it would probably be closer to 50 times, but I live in Tucson)... the first time I got the az burro,  the second time a croissant sandwich.  Both these things I feel like I've had a hundred times before... but somehow D'lish makes them taste 100x better!  Don't know what their secret is, but I'm lovin it!

9Irgcx_Gz-SUuzOnzrOP7Q.text: Just flew into Phoenix.  This was the perfect treasure for breakfast.  Be sure to park down at the bar.  Worth the walk! Would have take photo but we scarfed our food down so fast. This is a must if in this area!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

AWAUQqf0pdGhfpIntfuCGg.text: OMG YOU GUYS. The California club is incredible. The flavors work perfectly together and every bite is pure bliss. I just had it for the first time about ten minutes ago and will likely be back tomorrow for another. This sandwich is a mix of egg, avocado, tomato, cream cheese, some sort of sauce, all on a warm and tasty bun. On another note, prior to this afternoon I would always get the top notch burger, which is a black bean and quinoa patty, no meat (bacon) and add avocado. It is positively delectable as well- A great BBQ sauce accompanies the ingredients. The staff is great, even offering dog treats when my furbaby is in the car with me. Additionally, the staff is friendly, knowledgeable, and quick with service. This place is excellent in every way!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. This delightful concoction is the California club (sans meat), and my favorite meal. Get it! You won&#39;t be disappointed.

9Oftlw1H7HNnrC1TkZLixw.text: This is the BOMBEST spot to get your morning fuel up. Breakfast Buzz.. Absolutely the best way to get started in the AM. I'll always get the oatmeal and a breakfast club. Filling, delicious, and doesn't make me food stoned! A unicorn breakfast, I know, but it exists here.   No wonder everyone here is so chipper! Smiling faces in the early hours makes anyone's day so much better. My boy Leonard always hooks it up with a smile and a laugh.   No better place in Scottsdale to get morning grub!

s6amL4XulqvvK7ch2gId3g.text: Order taker: cup or bowl? Bowl. And I get a cup.   California club on a croissant. Get regular bread.   Seriously dude? Why even take the orders if you're not going to listen?

kyCCfYw9G361SrtSwRoZfA.text: Shockingly good. Extreeeeeeemely loud inside when they make the shakes, which is often. Bring earplugs while eating their excellent food.

SMfI_yTxfrqPwLCPddd3sQ.text: Nice menu but drive through and parking are pain. Good price though. Patio seating and WiFi are plus!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Low carb breakfast
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast menu

67o3DVC2rNsfOcg-tVUEHw.text: This is my favorite, on the go, breakfast/lunch place. Can't beat the fresh and creative food! The drive through is convenient and the staff is super friendly. I am a loyal follower of the D'Lite cult!

BocmgzKNQ3mZLMENVGzTOQ.text: One of the best place in the world to eat your breakfast, the employees are great and always nice !  The best things to eat there is the California one don't miss that ! Highly recommended!!!

EAd0IzKiK5Pcd8JyWJ3MBQ.text: Tried their "Burger" for the first time.....OMG horrible.  Tastes nothing close to a burger. It even looked scary.  Sorry but not for me.  Some of my co-workers wanted to give it a try and they spit out the first bite too.

pJx-p5-onNMRNFOL0iCgRA.text: Awesome smoothies, will definitely come back again for the California Club! A great place for a quick bite to sit down in the winter weather or grab and go in the drive thru

wry7UZUBYanYvOkswjp3aQ.text: To the very nice lady who was working this morning taking orders on April 26, 2017, after sitting in line and forgetting my wallet last minute, she asked what I wanted (Breakfast Buzz), she said to not worry about it and she put it on the house. So thank you very much for that kind gesture early in the morning, I didn't catch her name!

vZxBJ_WfvHgS5z_OZ0NpQQ.text: Went for the first time today and ordered the hummus plate and early bird burger.   The hummus: Soooo yummy!!! The pita bread is sooo warm and soft!!! Together they are perfect :) I could just eat a whole plate of just hummus and pita. I wish I could of just ordered a plate of hummus and pita without the vegetables. (Maybe I can...will need to ask next time)  Early Bird Burger: Was surprised it wasn't made out of meat, and instead some other super good stuff. It was really good, and the bun was very soft. I thought it was a little too spicy for me, and the burger fell apart easily, so I ended up eating it with a fork.   For two people, this filled us up. I would go back again, and maybe this time I'll try the southwest bowl!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hummus plate and Early Bird Burger :)

d343uNskq5_OG7aLVIj4RA.text: I love this place! I always get the breakfast club but I wish it had avocado, it would be so bomb! I tried the breakfast buzz this time and it was delicious. I highly recommend eating here if you want a healthier alternative.

wRDZ2UgEGZzYcWJe6YD_ag.text: Swung by though drive thru for a California club sandwich. The drive thru moved quickly because they had workers walking to our cars to take our order and payment.  The sandwich (around $8) was well made... the eggs were cooked differently, really thin somehow?  The pesto and mayo.. everything was great.  They cut it in half and wrap it up nicely for on the go eating.  Great service.  Great sandwiches.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. California club

Cx8XclqZdQaINPfCyfNUzg.text: I really wanted to love it after reading all the wonderful reviews, but unfortunately, it didn't hit my wow factor!  I ordered the California club for my hubby and I got the oatmeal with all the yummy fruit. All in all, after having to wait twenty minutes in that long line of cars I wouldn't go back. Sorry D'lish. You didn't make my breakfast roster.

v0L7ymNxJMGS-beeWqvtgA.text: OH I so wanted to love this place.  Coffee: TERRIBLE!!!!!!!!!! Oatmeal: OMG- watery quinoa, cold with mushed banana and berries Kitchen Sink Salad: Looked AMAZING....zero taste, no dressing and small.  All were to go...    Staff were very nice, super cute place....but a huge disappointment. Heard the juices are good but certainly won't be eating there again. :(

oa8ERQ4pkorZ6h5m4EikVQ.text: Two words: AZ BURRO. That is what you must get at D'lish! It is absolutely amazing and I honestly crave it on the regular. It is packed with smoked turkey, avocado, egg whites, potato, tomato, and feta in a sundried tomato wrap. It is huge, super filling and only $7! I promise that you will not be disappointed! It is great for any time of the day, not just breakfast! Another one of my favorite things about D'lish is that they have "doggie bags" for $1.50 which includes leftover natural turkey and basmati rice...the pooches LOVE it!!!!! And for $1.50, it is a lot of food! The line is sometimes very long, but don't get discouraged, it is worth the wait! You're welcome!! ;)

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. AZ Burro heaven!

_NkNxeSGqFhSI7l8tpGkTw.text: I won a gift card and was excited to try this new place. On food alone, this place is a 5. We ordered the AZ burro and the California Club. Both were delicious, but the CC was the stand out! This place lost points on atmosphere. The parking lot was super tiny and with the drive thru, it made it difficult to get in and out. The inside was tiny and super loud so we ate outside. However the street traffic was almost as noisy since it's on busy Scottsdale Road. I will be back, but next time I'll just go through the drive thru.

MFC_Z09OqwnYw_YHTO5r5Q.text: They have great food but the service is so slow. If you go through the drive-through it's a guarantee of 20 to 25 minute wait.

DOY_LbRLl51k98Ub_32vpQ.text: Groovy little joint located in Scottsdale. Not bad for a quick, healthy bite if in the area. Keep your eyes peeled, easy to miss while on the road. But when you find it, go ahead and enter the quaint,  small coffee shop and take a peak around- witness the gleam of natural light shine through the windows,  and walk up to the counter to glance at the menu and decide on your order. I got the California club & egg sandwich, which both were delicious. Hot and fresh, quick and easy- boom! Only downside is no public restroom - go 2 buildings down to the bar and use theirs.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Egg sandwich
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Outside

gHOPyLueFaHRgg4SZ5uT-A.text: The WORST customer service EVER!!!! I have never felt so belittled and the employees did not want to do any extra work to help me. The food is great as always but the older man at the drive through window was extremely rude!

yzcrkhvXzJkVc8jczbgUnQ.text: I'd like to start off by saying there is no parking... the drive thru line takes up both sides of the parking lot. Besides the parking issue this place is awesome. The workers are friendly and so polite and seem to have great personalities. They're quick and efficient! The food was great and had cream cheese in it? I didn't even taste it though. Anyways this place is cool and I'd recommend. Just park somewhere else and walk

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. California club

S3o7ya6dTXf64F5rbqoXoA.text: Not gonna lie, this place is pretty good.  I have only gotten the humanitarian chicken pesto wrap since I've been coming here and it's pretty filling-and super healthy! It is a bit pricey- came to about almost $10 for the wrap, $13 with a drink. And I just had to tip $2 for the great service. But it is pretty tasty and healthy. This is my go to spot when I'm in the area for lunch.

_aWPRo7YmWsratFVOjocBQ.text: Great food & price. Organic and responsibly owned. Because I'm a fat girl at heart, my only gripe was the size of the food. Otherwise everything was perfect. I gave this place 4 stars  because of their parking situation. Totally inconvenient with their parking spots and at times lack thereof.  TIP: frittata is amazing. Definitely must have. Coffee is great too.  Try to bike there or don't bring a car. Even the drive thru is a nuisance with the traffic their parking lot creates.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Responsible joint. Thank you.
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Frittata

NKV6Xx5B53pO8NBBCOx3-Q.text: Love the healthy and delicious options. The quinoa version of oatmeal was amazing. Tuna sandwich was really good. The burrito bowl was yummy. Only complaint is the service. Multiple staff members haven't tried the food and can't answer seemingly simple questions like "Does the breakfast burger have a meat patty?" or "How is this menu item?". One of our orders had to be remade as we had requested the sauce on the side - if they had tried the dish they would know that doing that is a difficult task. Coffee was just ok.

hLZRa7PJhCJjajxuzTuEqQ.text: It's so nice to have a place that caters to a healthy lifestyle. This place was beyond delicious and totally hit the stop. They have a variety of different choices, but we had the Cali club and a latte. Both were amazing. Definitely wish we had this spot in Cali.

_XUom2nD8sG_gHOa6sIohQ.text: Until recently I was the duchess of d'lish and it's about time I updated my review to reflect how amazing of a place it truly is.. a diamond in the rough.   Once I first tried the food menu I was insanely hooked. I now have a goal of trying every single thing on it and I'm about half way complete. It's a great place to swing by for breakfast to not only jump start your day with some protein, but to jump start your day with fun. One time a robot took my order!!  Lunch is just as nice. The staff is great while you are there and really appreciate their customers (and they even tell you).  My favorite breakfast has to be the croissant sandwich (with no tomato) and for lunch I've ended up getting the chicken panini more than anything else.   If I'm craving a hot drink it's always a chai latte and for cold it's an arnold palmer with black tea.  If you haven't been here yet, you should go out of your way to swing by!

9CBfRIOT94C1TIpiFhfjJQ.text: Really great food. Customer Service, Timing, and pricing could be improved. Don't go if your in a hurry.

dK-Cw3vEjGgKgs8koBGWtA.text: This place is busy no doubt, and parking challenging but worth it. The morning buzz is awesome and I have thought of driving 8 hours just to get one again..its that good!

e3w4gsXRTs36eqOHMHz8og.text: Great find on a hockey trip to Scottsdale. Yummy breakfast options and quick, friendly service. Tried the California club based on reviews--good choice (substantial but not too heavy).  veggie burrito was good and filling, as was the low carb breakfast which "hit the spot". Latte and iced coffee were good.

GpR4k9XXY--SQXPRkl3k6Q.text: Food is great.  Service, wait times, and parking Sucks!  I love the healthy and sustainable concept and the food was above average.  I have been to D'Lish three times, and have had horrible experiences with service, and having to wait 10-15 minutes for "fast food".  I understand that quality food takes time to make, but they need some serious help! I am beginning to think that the owners are stubborn and don't want to pay for more help.  I was also overcharged for my food on every occaison, and was so frustrated with the cashier, and the pressure of the long line of people waiting to order that I just said "screw it".  Based on food alone, I would give this place 4 stars.  But the bad service brings my rating down to 2 stars.  I hope that this place gets their act together because I would enjoy their food more with better service.  I also think they should be open later than 4pm.  Seriously, who eats a meal at 4pm?

5lXEFQuPH984aMnW1zYmfg.text: Trying to eat healthier, yet not starve, and "the Man Salad" was pretty good!

VZzCdXmRqLbrUWKBYehBuA.text: Simply amazing! Menu is small but sooo good! I find myself going there on a more regular basis just to keep trying different things on the menu.

FVdzENeRxuXriiOutd0-Yg.text: Eating here now this place is great super health love it the man salad is the way to go they are not open late but a great lunch and breakfast place

42Ig7bzQsZ0qDW0TsDWGOQ.text: Really good and would go back again.  Just can't justify 5 stars when the service was decent but nothing out of the ordinary.  The breakfast buzz was worth the flight from Michigan, but the food seemed a bit over priced--2 drinks, a California Club and a bowl of quinoa for 22.50, you decide.

KKWOTjEcbQHRiS-2Z-EeEA.text: 5star breakfast! It is my second time coming to D'Lish and i just more in love with the food and service. The popularity of the restaurant is amazing! #healthy #organic #cantnevergowrong

Qkj2kXekaZAyxEF8fze4oA.text: Not bad, had the "humanitarian" and it was pretty good, not to heavy. Ordered the hummus plate as a Starter, came at the same time as the food which kind of defeats the purpose, but they seemed a little busy so I don't hold that against them. I would suggest take out because this place is super small, and me and my girlfriend both had to pee really bad but there was no restroom. All in all I would go back again if I'm on that side of town, but I was not blown away like everyone in yelp seems to be.

1-PXxf3CwR7fZzvBfVEmaw.text: Loved this place! Cool little place with very cool vibe and food. Wish they had one on the north west side of town. Will be back as I pass this way from time to time. Oh, and the iced tea was amazing as well.

DNEkbQdAT0AmjpUsWJEq_g.text: Cute place, minuscule parking lot.  Had a turkey wrap, which was on the small side compared to most wraps I've had, but it was plenty filling enough for me (a little skimpy on the avocado though).  Also tried the breakfast buzz shake, which had pretty good flavor, but was more icy and less creamy than I would have liked.

r1ZlUUmQimWnIezFLl7qqg.text: Loved that I could get "breakfast" for lunch.  Great healthy food.  The staff was super friendly.  Got to sit outside ons sunny day.  And, it was not expensive and quick.  I will be back!

PlK3QPzKxyrDqStJEuPi0Q.text: Average food. Noisy inside. Not a lot of parking, actually horrible parking. I got caught in the drive thru trying to leave. It's like healthier fast food. I had the breakfast burro and my wife had the Cali club. Both were average to me.

50TgEs_6G-cNRCLZGT-FaQ.text: Great food and nice staff will return for sure when I get to town again

yhqt_2LC1GeNoTN3JuhGLg.text: A cute, friendly little place on a busy road but well worth finding! We stopped by for brunch on our first visit to Scottsdale. Had the frittata...so good it hit the spot. Our kids ate the California club and couldn't finish them so I'll order 1 dish to share the next time. As previously mentioned some may find it a bit pricy but did not disappoint! We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Frittata

jyYDUL5t1K3qZXlgXlOdtA.text: Great sandwiches, lots of healthier options.  I love that they mark everything for those of us with special dietary needs, like dairy free options.  I have never been disappointed.  You can call ahead and pick up your take out order through the drive thru.

LVm7L_85WlpRwdOPXm1G6g.text: Quick stop sandwich spot. The California club was perfect for brunch

cgLQRgfhTXaawKd-k5Ex4g.text: I am so grateful that Yelp on my phone steered us to D'LIsh. We had planned to follow up a great dinner at Green, just down the street, with breakfast at the same spot, but Green was closed. No problem! We drove up to D'Lish and had a great breakie of the California Club breakfast sand and a veggie sandwich. The coffee with first-rate, and the staff was super cool to a couple of out-of-towners who were gawking at all of the outstanding options on the menu board. Too bad we had a plane to catch. We would have stayed for lunch. PS Get the Breakfast Buzz.

82ea7lwb5crGIy7Z0dXESw.text: The boyfriend and I like to stop here when we're in town, especially when we're in a hurry for a good (and healthy) bite to eat. Well, I suppose it's not exactly a "quick" fix if you go during peak lunch hours, but what place is during those times anyway.  Service is great. They're always super friendly and welcoming, whether in the drive-through or if you go inside.  Food is amazing, as most of the other reviews have stated. I'm a tuna sandwich sucker, and this place makes me feel so much better about eating one. It's a "healtified" version, and it's actually even better than the original that's drenched in mayo. Burgers are yum, and I always love the teas they have. Prickly Pear seems to be a favorite of mine.  Parking lot sucks though. It's highly inconvenient, so be patient and careful while driving through or parking.

J_EgLCjeAiDIZ6gQNBSL3g.text: Great concept!  In fact, had thought about this for so long:  Why isn't there a place WITH a drive-through that actually makes delicious, HEALTHY food?  D'Lish is it. They pride themselves on not serving coke/pepsi products, which I do quite like.   Best dirty chai of my life here. Legit. So rich, flavorful and the espresso was made perfectly. Not over steeped, not burned...not weak, just right! Well, of course their food is incredible too : ) Anything you pick will rock your socks off.  Lemme say, while my dog didn't take the treat they offered (he's a brat lol) - the fact that they offered it was so nice. These folks care about what they're doing, and do it well.  I can't wait to go back and have a meal on the delightful little patio.

eCFderrfDShsVosOy9-BAQ.text: Sometimes you need to feel good about your "fast" food...ie. the awesome protein burger w/pesto.  That made me revise my review and up a star...hadn't tried it before...what was I missing?!  This is a very nice deli and quick stop for a healthy munchie or tasty, cold ice tea on a warm Valley day.  Great outdoor space as well.  The vibe is casual hippie/hipster/health nut in a GOOD way.  My usual favorite for lunch is the cold tuna salad sandwich (NOT canned tuna) on wheat toast.  My breakfast fave changes, but with so many good options (burritos, sandwhiches, etc) I'm never disappointed.  Probably not the option for someone looking for pork, butter, grease-laden hangover breakfast.  But this place has cured an ill or two of mine...

s_KEigrvLKPqfE5GQJPp_Q.text: Not cheap but I come pretty often because I love their food. Stopped by today to get breakfast, wow.. Worst customer service.I have never posted negative reviews before on yelp. Employee gave me attitude. So RUDE. That's NOT how you want to treat costumers. I don't know if she had a rude customer before me or what, but I will never go back to this location. Not worth ruining my day for the food. I agree with other comments that employees at Tempe location is more friendly and welcoming. Would give no star if I could.

YlL-obkBscY39ighCutJ5g.text: I'm not as crazy about this place as everyone else seems to be. For one, it's cramped and crowded, not an enjoyable or relaxing brunch place. It's really built more to serve the drive-thru clientele.  Secondly, the food is overpriced. We spent the same here that we would have spent at a fancy sit-down brunch, but for less quality food and a less enjoyable atmosphere. Thirdly, I did not like the food all that much, my breakfast sandwich was just OK and it was on store-bought bread, not freshly baked. It tasted like warmed up leftovers. And my husband did not like his coffee or his sandwich. The ONLY redeeming thing about this experience was the Breakfast Buzz smoothie! Lindsay J. (another yelper) was right, it is delicious! It tastes like chocolate milk, and you can definitely taste the espresso, bananas and peanut butter. I might come back for that smoothie, but otherwise I probably won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Egg and cheese sandwich

fM5B5CXmUl1VBEPxenTvuA.text: The ratings are not a fluke. These guys and gals are good. Had their signature california club and was not disappointed. Fresh, great flavor. Bread was awesome. Coffee was excellent too. Gotta go back. The menu had a lot of items I want to try. The flow of customers was constant. Great sign of quality over time.

vP8EfmC6_swa2UgfIKSl5A.text: This is a tiny place that gets crazy during the rush and there is very little parking but with that said YOU MUST GO HERE AND TRY THE CALIFORNIA CLUB FOR BREAKFAST.  It is pretty much the best breakfast sandwich on the planet.  I usually use the drive through and it doesn't always go that fast but it is well worth the wait.  This place is popular for a reason...check it out.

CoqmM0U_TIe1wjaW-zwpwA.text: Updated review, they took care of my concerns and I still come here often for a Cali breakfast club and a breakfast buzz. Good people, good food.

xXqAF9SsnDEII5EL6ZstYA.text: California Club and Breakfast Buzz. Nuff said. I could grab either one of those for breakfast every day and still be happy. If you haven't been to D'lish you are missing out.. SO good!

ZI4n9Y4lLMT6faJs5VlzQg.text: If you're looking for a quick yet amazing breakfast, just come on over to D'lish! We were on vacation and wanted to have breakfast on our way out, SO GLAD we pick this place. I got the Cali club with a smoothly. The pesto on my sandwich seriously brought it to another level lol. So good... Wish we had a place like this in my neck of the woods.

w-_YqK4O_qQTvS-MwdTKbw.text: Long lines but always worth it.  The breakfast buzz is my all time favorite pick me up.

GhwwjPSavKHk0IqGCVZWqw.text: The food here is great. Love the burritos and lo-carb breakfast! The burritos have these awesome egg whites that are just perfectly cooked.   The breakfast buzz is probably the best shake I've ever tasted. It's also huge, so it's a better value than most. I love the mix of chocolate, peanut butter, banana, and coffee.  Any time I'm in Phoenix I make it a point to go here.

P4dnCHdWyhcXnX1Ycpz13Q.text: My husband and I needed a quick place to stop for lunch on our way out of Scottsdale. Stopped here based on Yelp reviews, and it was so wonderful. The food was fresh, delicious and prepared quickly. It also wasn't the kind of place we felt awkward having a baby with us. Very casual and friendly.  We also got iced chai lattes for the drive home to Tucson, and they were great! I haven't been anywhere that offers almond milk as a dairy milk substitute, so that was a very pleasant surprise!

_u2A-8CdpnlXVSb5SCXOBQ.text: Yummy!  And great service.  Had lunch with my parents who had to sit and wait for us. But the staff took great care of them. And when we showed up they took great care of us too. We all has the California Club.  It's obvious why it's the most ordered item. It's terrific. They made mine gluten free by putting it in a bowl on top of a potato cake. D'Lish!!  That's your first tip. - if you're GF, try it that way.    Your second tip has two parts: it's a drive thru so drive through!  They're really fast and organized. You won't wait long. But if you feel like sitting down keep in mind there's not a lot of seating so don't hit them at the prime time. Go 15 minutes before or after noon, for example.   But go. You won't be disappointed.

ezspycrMy_qkFY424bybsQ.text: I was very surprised by the food and customer service here...I got the vegan quinoa burger with the mushrooms and cream sauce.  Super yummy, but what's better is that it was yummy drive thru food!  My kidlet was with me and I couldn't find anything kid-like on the menu.  When I got to the window, I asked if they could make him a PBJ and give us a side of broccoli.  "Of course!" was the reply and I was instantly in love!  Yea for yummy drive thru and healthy kid drive thru food too!

qyOmMaoDkV8_UBVI4KunrA.text: Been here several times with the drive thru and eating inside.  Service is good but the food Quality has gone downhill.  So disappointing that the Frittata was not fresh... Nuked eggs were not good.  Reheated frittata was overdone.

Ay6fVRrSqlmPPGZlHuPgIA.text: place was swamped and they handled it very well. Food was fresh, delicious, and fast. the morning buzz was delicious too.

fMyu2m0fZEPQSyKaAN0Y5w.text: I really like their breakfast buzz shake. Chocolate, peanut butter, banana, coffee, protein, ice. So delicious! And can be a quick meal replacement. This shake is one of the few foods I dream about. If I'm in Scottsdale, I try to think of a reason to stop by.  I also like the quinoa oatmeal. Very light tasting but filling. Quinoa gives you protein, chewiness, and a slightly nutty taste.   Downsides: not too much seating. Parking lot is small. Drive through line can be long. None of these keep me away.

Y7myzffeAalz4-lzcrCy2g.text: My favorite sandwich is the California club, if you are not a health nut this is a great option. The mushroom soup is always amazing and you can't beat a drive thru! The salads are great and actually filling, I just wish they were open later, when I want to go after work they are closed. Also the wait is a mixed bag, sometimes there is no line and some times the line of cars spills into Scottsdale road.

BS6pEcVkXja_x6wxBiNuig.text: Although it was a little out of our way, D'lish was worth the drive, times ten.  The guys behind the counter rock the casbah. They inject friendliness like they have a PhD in positivity. I loved every minute of sitting at the counter, I would have gladly swapped my 6-hour passenger seat spot home to LA to sit there and chat and slurp up their complimentary samples of the "breakfast buzz." Apparently it goes by many different names but just ask for the peanut butter thing and your am will forever be changed. The breakfast bagel I had on bialy bread was also top notch, filling, and inexpensive.  D'lish, want to take a road trip to LA?

7p99dV3oPpV59lttLfB7Cw.text: I am so happy we chose this place for January Yelp Office Hours today... we had a great turnout, but better than that, I found my new favorite Old Town area coffee shop!  I started out with a hot peppermint tea, and a few hours later, I chose a breakfast sandwich for lunch - let me tell you... it was d'lish!  Kyle and Chad - great name for your place, and thanks for the hospitality also.    I can't wait for my next visit as I hear the dirty chai (chai tea latte with espresso shots) and the breakfast buzz shake are winning combinations as well.  I love that there are so many healthy options on the menu to choose from.  Not to mention outdoor seating, good vibe/music inside, and a drive-thru - how cool is that?!

uY7BsIIiBqGw0aMGCDODxQ.text: More of a coffee shop, than a restaurant. (It has a drive thru.). Good coffee/espresso bar and healthful alternative to fast food. It's an order-at-the-counter place with cheerful staff that takes orders and delivers food to your table. Breakfast sandwich and breakfast burrito were fresh and tasty -- but more of a "take-away" "to-go" feel. Small parking lot can get a little jammed up with drive thru traffic.  Good place to grab a quick bite.

rjnPgPmAeixYSVbsaOWPbw.text: When I read that D'lish was an "alternative to fast food drive thrus", I knew immediately that we should go here before a day trip on our vacation in AZ.  I'm glad to see that business seems to be good for this little restaurant with organic food. Hippies! We did drive through and though we did have to wait a few minutes longer than we would if we went to McDonald's, it was definitely worth the wait.  Here's what we ordered: Veggie breakfast burrito - this was definitely filling. I couldn't finish a whole burrito. Eggs, portobello mushroom, etc with salsa = delicious. Tuna sandwich - pretty tasty! Carb-free breakfast - the person liked it! The only complaint... there were too many greens at the bottom. It's great that they gave so much, but it was a little wilted from the heat of the breakfast items by the time we got to it. Veggie d'lite - yummy! Lots of greens.

oBS0_JCS1ng6l74NgqMnww.text: California club and AZ burrito very good. Coffee super hot

6vq0OwFFuht0lrGtsnURHw.text: Insane!!!! Please open a location in Cali!! We were in town for the weekend and went here two times! Amazing food super nice staff they help you a lot!! Keep jammin this place rocks!!

igBV_bXFoNGGzj5N-dPPKA.text: Nothing better than a fast drive-through place that actually sells healthy food.  I can't wait to go back to try the entire menu.  My boyfriend and I both got breakfast burritos on a morning when we were feeling particularly hung over, but mustered up enough energy to get in an awesome workout and run up Camelback. After our run we stopped into this place. The burritos were perfect size, not loaded up with greasy cheese or meat, but filling in a way that didn't weigh you down.  After this outstanding breakfast we're definitely going to have an awesome day!

t_PbIG-Fs44NXCcc-2YLOg.text: Cute place!  Nice drive-thru window.  Adorable, really.  Nice patio-dining/lounging.  Noise-level inside was a little loud, but there were eight people, six of w/c were talkative yelpers (ha!), plus Kyle and Chad, owners of D'lish (who were, btw, easy on the eyes... a great asset for any business!).  One special request- please offer Maya Chai!  While Oregon Chai tastes OK, I'm allergic (I suspect there are "natural flavors" involved), and organic Maya Chai is multiple-times better (and, most importantly, I don't recall feeling negative effects after)!  Great spot to unwind and rejuvenate.  Will come back soon to try the food!

h9Jsd7d0gXUeXXDHZISoMA.text: I love the turkey sandwich and the man salad its d'lish  the only down side is the hours

TtKXzu7cYqgIAADJt3xXnw.text: This small perfectly nestled little place is right up my alley so I loved it before I even ate anything. I like that there is no machine I talk to yet they still have a drive-thru. I like that I actually have to wait for my food to cook and it's not pre wrapped sitting under a heat lamp waiting for me. I like the happy, carefree (in a good way) personality of the staff. I love the food! The mushroom soup is something I crave! The veggie burrito is always piping hot and their salsa that comes with it is perfect! Salads, love! Chicken breast panini, love! I just wish it were across the street from my place instead of my boyfriends. Fresh, trendy, and consistent! Consistency is key and they have nailed it! Thank you D'lish!! Cheers :)

JJh1kdEjdYKc0N8gjie71Q.text: I love, love, love this place!!! There are no healthy drive thru places so right away that's major points. Everything on the menu is delicious, literally. I've never ordered anything I didn't like from the AZ burro to the Top Notch protein burger (made with black beans and quinoa) to all their tasty teas and drinks. It doesn't matter what you get you're sure to be satisfied! I hope this place stays open for years to come!!

VRjyw3mQgd8m4OF1BRnIcA.text: My office is in Old Town Scottsdale so I have a lot of options for lunch. This little place is by far my favorite! My "usual order" is the "Man Salad" which is just amazing- lots of protein and good fats to keep you full all afternoon!  They are always so friendly EVEN when they're busy. The thing I like most, however, is simply how consistent they are. The salad is the same every time, their service is excellent every time, and they are as fast as possible every time. You see them hustling to get orders done as quickly as they can. The place is really just wonderful- keep doing what you're doing guys!

LP0UHqJRFvz1CrOVusTAtA.text: This place is absolutely wonderful. Both locations feature good service and fast, clean food. I recommend the Breakfast Buzz, Cali Club, and Traditional Burrito for first-timers. They will also take one-off requests such as for a BLT or something along those lines. Again, very friendly people that really take care of you.

caU0aENivE5tWwUQBVuKmw.text: Wow had their California breakfast sandwich..so yummy. Went thru the drive thru and they had friendly service. :)

6rxTXrLcgUq9Ff1QtrHGbQ.text: By far my favorite place in Scottsdale. California club and morning buzz are amazing . Plus this dude that does the drive thru is great and makes me laugh.

IK7KWSBobrssx9LG4r81OQ.text: Wanted to like this place.... really really wanted to.   Horrible service, I mean absolutely horrible.   I arrived and was starting to say what a friend recommended to me but I couldn't remember the name of it and the guy behind the counter snapped and cut me off and said "I hear that ten times a day." Well buddy since you've heard it before, I can understand that working in the service industry, you'd not expect to hear it again (sarcasm.) Whatever, I made my order and was told to go relax at a table. Well, I relaxed for 18 minutes with no food (turkey BLT I ordered) and watched everyone else get their food. I got up and asked if I was forgotten and there was absolutely no apology offered, but said they would bring it to me.   When the guy brought over my sandwich, he kind of slammed it down on the table and walked away. No apology still, no offer to refund my meal, no come back later and try us again. They were just extremely rude about it. I understand, it happens... It's part of life, but they acted as if me not getting my food was a bother to them.  Horrible customer service. I'll tell everyone I know about this story. Nobody should be able to treat their customers like that. A simple "I'm sorry, come back and see us again for a free coffee" or something to that effect would have gone a loooooong way.   Too stupid to get it probably. Or maybe because I didn't have a rat-tail with a mohawk, a basketball jersey, converse shoes, and an obvious roid rage attitude, they just didn't care.

3nQlc7JgpuS3bGsbYjMt2g.text: 4 stars for the food and the extra star is for the customer service. Pulled in this morning when it was still dark. Mind you this is a drive-thru health food/coffee spot. Roughly 6:15, 6:30 AM. A guy was in there already with a smile on. Hard to find at that hour. I ordered a quad espresso with cream and the low carb breakfast. After he punched in the order I pulled kind of a d*ck move and asked for an extra egg. Told him he could charge me. He said no problem and told the cook to add the egg. Didn't charge any extra at all. Bonus! He had me test the espresso to make sure it was to my liking. It was fresh and strong. Cream was perfect.   Now the food. 3 perfectly cooked tender eggs on a bed of mixed greens with a pesto dressing. 3 tomato slices and 4 avocado slices. Also a thin hash patty. Everything was cooked perfectly and you could tell everything was very fresh. No weird tomatoes, no brown avocado. Everything was just right, even such an ungodly hour. The only recommendation I can make it put the hash patty on the side or on top so that some of the crispness would maintain. Other than that you can't get better service and quality and that early in the morning to boot. Highly recommend. I will be back for a lunch sometime.  PS I tipped him a few extra bucks before I pulled away. Well worth it.

c3i_Aa4NJV0pc8TX-_s6mQ.text: MAN BUZZ! The breakfast buzz is the ultimate meat head drink. I mean espresso protein and smoothie all in one? Can't beat it!   I have had many things on the menu here and all good. The bowls are awesome the breakfast club is out of this world and the veggie wrap add chicken(come on gotta do it!) is also awesome. Great drink selection, if you like Arnold Palmers ask for the Tiger Woods the next time you go in. E  Atmosphere is super laid back with a great stay. This is the only thing to warn you about it can take some time if you don't call ahead but its worth it!

5kv1XJe8n2tEAza40VlucQ.text: New favorite spot for quick and healthy food. The best eggwhite burrito and protein shake.  eat here 5 times a week, and I notice that the drive thru line is getting longer.  no longer a secret, the word is out about Dlish.    have not tried the dinner menu, but will soon.  Some great dishes.

zX3n396uHSBLR9-Zcqvx2g.text: The California Club is amazing!!!! Staff is always upbeat and super friendly, this is a great place to eat healthy.

x9-_cy-S4ynpUL06OGR_7A.text: I LOVE this restaurant! The food is delicious, healthy and fast. Every person I have interacted with at this location is friendly and efficient. I am addicted!

qE8v81u4_Tv0iKODsmh8_g.text: Honestly, the food was ok. I had the california club and my wife got the Southwest frittata. They were good, but nothing really to write home about or special in any way. I kept thinking my sandwich was good but was it $8.00 good? Probably not. It was crazy busy Saturday morning at 8:30am. So they must be doing something right. Maybe it's the shakes or teas or something. Maybe it's just the location. Idk. It was good, but probably not all that good.

NyWxfWabyIlFjySAT0lfDw.text: This place is my too lazy to cook breakfast on a Sunday go to spot. Cali club, breakfast buzz and AZ burritos are my favorite! The location is a little inconvenient because the line piles into the road.

r2PQyoGxfVWYruY6tIkZyQ.text: Delicious, healthy food I love having for breakfast or lunch! They're vegan buzz is the most amazing thing you'll drink. It's chocolatey with coffee protein and more. I love living right around the corner from them!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast sandwich sans bacon
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hummus &amp; veggies

tyMY7BTIY2W9sdLfID8_dw.text: Oh my Atlanta! Let me tell you something, I drove 20 mins out of my way for this place and boy was I not disappointed!! I got the California I believe and with a little hot sauce (because I put it on everything) it was serious the best breakfast Sandwich I have had in long time! Explosion in the mouth for sure!   Good job guys!!

miVMXYOQr0JLSSbsFIhRoA.text: This place is a delight. Best for breakfast. The low carb breakfast is light yet filling. The pesto they drizzle over it is amazing and also used in some of their sandwiches. I also frequently get the egg and cheese sandwich- add avocado! The bread they use is so soft and yummy. All the ingredients are fresh. It really is healthy on the go.... the food comes out so fast! Ok the one down side to this place is also the best part about it- when you sit inside the blenders are constantly going off and they are LOUD buttttt these blenders are making the breakfast buzz! A delightful mix of peanut butter, banana, espresso and chocolate protein. Quite possibly the best way to start your day, or afternoon! If you're coming later in the day try the hummus and don't be afraid to still get a breakfast buzz. Your taste buds will thank me.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Egg and cheese sandwich add avocado
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Low carb breakfast
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Half green and half black tea

GdyUIXocBblXK0rt1UV8ig.text: This place is the way to start your day if you want quality food and fast service! I was always hesitant to go due to the line that always forms outside the drive through but WOW it was well worth the wait! I waited no more than 8 minutes and got the best breakfast EVER. I got the California Club with no meat and an extra egg with a breakfast buzz total came out to about $17 and well worth it.   I will D'Lite two thumbs up and five sparkly stars !  xx Paola R.

wKfBr93tYqRsLP24KD3qcg.text: I come here at least once a week for the turkey club.m and a cactus blossom iced tea. I love their nuts n berries salad too. It's the only place you can dive though and actually get decent healthy food, I wish they were open 24-7 but I guess that would defeat the goal to "staying healthy" :) love this place

SKqAmeDdJZAEkHdqyGrv_w.text: The food is good but this location is a serious risk to drivers safety. You have people waiting out on Scottsdale Road, often causing last minute decisions by drivers not realizing the car is stopped in the middle of the road, waiting for the drive through. Very dangerous. Please correct this.
