If there's no place to properly wait for the drive through and cars need to be on the street, you should have someone out there diverting traffic and pushing them off the road.

1cAb0T9ZVS8e_LbcGey7ug.text: I used to live in Arizona and now I'm back visiting with my girlfriend and the first place I thought of for breakfast was D'Lite. The breakfast buzz is a great shake to get the energy going in the morning. The clubs are excellent as well. They also have a solid focus on recycling which is always a plus. Definitely a must for everyone visiting the area and a staple breakfast place for everyone that lives here.

0T5jrPbCEFOEFdA8fYTU5g.text: Love the Breakfast Buzz. Very filling and could be a meal. All sandwiches are great, love this place!

0r1Dt76y3U5nEIm4E9YKKg.text: Food/Breakfast Buzz would make this a 5 Star alone, but the drive thru/parking brought this to a 3. Half the time I go I end up going somewhere else because the line is into the street (safe) . A tip I'd give is to get rid of the parallel parking spots on the side by the street so people can get through to the spot in the back.

N9Gtdq7wrjB6tsW0Cfwn-w.text: I was honestly pretty surprised at how huge the menu is at this place - and for a drive-thru, too! Lots of lighter, healthier options on the menu, although I thought my "signature" California Club was a bit heavy. I'll try something new next time. Expect to wait a bit in the drive-thru line, because they're running a full kitchen inside. I'll be back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. California Club....to go! $8
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Drive through menu
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Drive through

hev_lpmiRcEEPfHytnQTNQ.text: I really hate the idea of depriving myself of things i love in order to be "healthy" (you only live once, that kinda mentality) but d'lite introduced me to new things that i love that just so happen to be healthy!!  I cannot recommend this place more, especially those of us who live busy lifestyles and are on the go constantly.  The breakfast buzz is my favorite, and the California club!  Can't wait to try more!

glHqlGtAqfW4Pj5y945kYw.text: This is definitely a great place to go! I usually stop by when I want light, healthier food but they do have more filling options forsure! The food selection is definitely vegetarian friendly which is amazing! They have a broad selection of food as well as beverages from protein shakes to coffees and teas! I feel like the wait is never too long especially for the quality of food I'm getting! The staff is always kind and gets my order right every time! I love that they're expanding and making new locations too!

JOcxwVCh1ZHx7PNCBx1ggA.text: Love their sandwiches! They are so fresh, flavorful and they have tons of healthy options for everyone.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

HxNbKAzY4GqYX1OJxh5BHw.text: This place never fails my appetite or my need for coffee (& tea)!! Sometimes the line is crazy long but they are great about sending employees out to the line to get orders and payment!  Keep it up guys!!

_RfVeMJDc9SYvGYZluL_9Q.text: This place is my go-to when I'm in a hurry for breakfast in Phoenix. They have delicious Nitro Toddy and I LOVE their breakfast burritos- the veggie and the AZ Burro. My husband tried the low carb breakfast and he was impressed too (see photo). Quick and efficient service, healthy and delicious food/coffee and a great price point.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

aoJlHpwgNfjcK6ZtxOlVmw.text: Always good, fast service. Everyone is very friendly! Food is Delicious!! I always look forward to coming here.

cTq6Vm5eYb3GCq1BiOzCpg.text: The Breakfast Buzz is so addicting!! I wish there was a D'Lite closer to my house in Gilbert!

Xpbw7bN6XKV-oHUFm-YJjg.text: The food is delicious. The service is quick and timely which I was really impressed by. However the customer service is awful. The girl who took my order acted like I was stupid for not knowing the name of the sandwich I wanted even though I listed off the ingredients, so she handed me a menu and walked away to the next car. I understand you have to keep the line going, but I felt almost ridiculed with her "yeah we don't have anything like that but here's the menu" lmao and they had exactly what I described on the menu. a know-it-all that didn't know it ALL. Attitudes are definitely terrible, guess they don't train them on customer service. Good food tho

rkCye1WMfDdqiUR_He1dlg.text: The AZ breakfast burrito with the side salsa is so scrumptious. This place is a must try for a delicious breakfast while visiting Scottsdale! 5 star rating!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The AZ breakfast burrito with the salsa is absolutely delicious

MAex3pYvOD5fMa8KfDF0Ww.text: The best! California breakfast club is so good. Its easy, quick and I know it will be good!

G4z2zmQA_1Cs8aPJTIJX0g.text: Normally long lines are frowned upon but in this case it doesn't bother me because the place is that good and it's worth the wait. Incredible food and amazing service-I always go thru the drive-thru with my dog and they always offer him a treat! And I love getting my puppers the homemade dog food, the basmati rice and roasted turkey breast, which is literally good enough for humans to eat. Favorite breakfast menu item is the California club. Favorite drink is the iced dirty chai tea latte with almond milk. Cheers!

WuhyWY_6f2t13FI0q0oNKw.text: Awesome, tasty breakfast/brunch options. Everything was hot and fresh. Everyone was super friendly. The orange glorious smoothie was to die for. The kitchen had a mixup with our order and they completely went above and beyond to make up for it. The people that work here are truly good people. We will definitely be back.

X_caSFVE-vFNPtV3MYH3-A.text: Breakfast buzz! Pretty much all I should have to say lol. Nothing on the menu here is bad. Amazing breakfast sandwiches and great lunch salads. Haven't had one bad thing ever. Recommendations from me are obviously the buzz, (I get mine with almond milk which makes it a little more sweet), California club breakfast sandwich, croissant breakfast sandwich, man salad and Portobello soup, but like I mentioned before you can't really go wrong with anything you order.  If I had to give a tip, I'd say if you haven't been here before you should try to park and go in so you don't back up the already long drive through line. Unless you scope out the menu ahead of time so you're ready to order.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The famous BuZZ!
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Drink menu

q5yPPVTlJYwG9tZfr02CqQ.text: Love this place! Delicious and nutritious selections. I love that they have a drive through and service is always with a smile!

EVI4IMd48q8DglE7CCxFiA.text: I would give it five if they could figure out the damn parking.... sitting with the rear of your car on Scottsdale Rd is just plain scary!. Yet worth it. I have had several things here. I would say that the chicken Panini ranks up there. The food is fresh and local and all that, so driving by this place to stop at Mickey Ds or T-Bell is just plain crazy. You will spend the same and get high blood pressure. I also enjoy the veggie wraps on occasion. There is one with hummus that tastes unlike anything you have ever had from take out. If you eat your veggies, that is. They have meat eater food there, too. But when you go healthy, it seems better  to get some greens down the pipe!. Line of cars my only issue...dang.

9nWCJ1ifDOecjdhnCvVYZQ.text: Yum, yum, yum!!! This is such a good place to get a breakfast sandwich in the morning. I always get the California club, the best thing on the menu. It's on soft ciabatta bread, with perfectly cooked eggs, bacon, turkey, cream cheese, tomato, avocado, and the best part......PESTO! I would highly recommend this place. My friends enjoy their style of oatmeal as well as the black bean burger. It's great quality and the never let me down. The one thing that kind if sucks is their location. It's very small and the drive thru sometimes goes into the street. Not good! And parking is a bitch too. There's hardly any and it is just a very tight squeeze to get in. But the food makes it worth it!

StvCTo49Vmr9W-Z1-d4cJg.text: Just went through drive thru at 9:55am and the girl with shorter hair working the food window was very unhappy and rude. She didn't know my order and was just surprised at the unpleasant experience, it's not like D'Lite.

Yt7YGsD8A5FOynhM06TeCA.text: All the salads from here (we tried the nuts and berries and the man salad) were really good. The Veggie bowl is more of a soup and pretty good (we had it to go). I had the veggie wrap and it was the perfect portion for one person. The protein shakes here are HUGEEEEE. I felt like all the good was tasty, well prices, good quality and made you feel good about what you were eating. I would definitely come back again. Great place to eat at before or after a hike. :)

kbmlQLyjRn_YHGHMRnqMlA.text: I love stopping here for a quick bite to eat during lunch or breakfast. The traditional burrito is really good. Has the perfect egg to potatoes ratio. Last time I had lunch here I had the chicken pannini with pesto and sour dough bread. Arnold Palmers are the best here too!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. They updated their menu since I been here last.

ruffFBmIwvjJpJi_kvgbRg.text: Super fresh fast fun and friendly !!  Sometimes the line gets super long so I guess not that fast at times . Friendly staff and just love the vibe .  Wish they could tone down the industrial loud blenders they use to make the Breakfast Buzz!  Good concept i would buy into a franchise ...

nBvINHWixhn03OYlVFW3Ug.text: This place is SO GOOD. The salads and sandwiches are fresh and everything seems fairly priced considering the quality of food.   Though the drive thru is often packed and can be tight with the small parking lot around it, I love the concept of getting fresh quality food in a fast drive thru and it's totally worth the wait. I wish there were more D'lish restaurants in the valley, but not if becoming a chain would sacrifice their quality of food :)

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Small iced coffee with cream and sugar - great coffee and less than $3.
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The tuna sandwich is d&#39;lish!

Ew6QomhmPrpAqpUp3Aj2IQ.text: LOVE THIS PLACE. Been eating here for 4 years now and I crave it regularly. I always order the same thing now because I know what I love: The humanitarian wrap with a portobello soup and the orange glorious. Their hummus plate is fantastic though! Really satisfying for a light lunch or snack.

8sc4Xz6_t9gWdfN8H0-2Pg.text: This place is sooo good!  Had the California Club. Probably the tastiest I have ever had. My friend had the chicken breast panini which was also very good.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. California club and Chicken Breasts panini. Awesome!

wcGjkQ0caDJcUpMfPsrEmQ.text: Really tasty food fast at a good price. We had the California club and the low carb breakfast as a wrap. California club stole the show.

KpyPRZAZzpOPWZlv97WHNA.text: First time visiting today and I am impressed. Best tuna sandwich of my life and the iced tea I had was incredible too. Tiny inside, but very cute. Staff members were super friendly, helpful, and quick. Will definitely return.

LzAww7y-65CCZQ5Z7fizfQ.text: I love this place, always good food, good service and did I mention the good food...  They recently raised their prices and were courteous enough to post a letter on the door. They are worth every penny

fqmM3KleoDIAC2vdxaRwbw.text: The GREEN LEMONADE is AMAZING!!! It's the best combination of sweetness and greens.  The addition of ginger and cilantro makes it the best juice ever. I couldn't put it down!!

ZtuLscZ8A8BwJNWiKCEOwg.text: This place really delivers on their promise...Good food fast - but not "fast food!" I had the house style frittata and it was d'lish.   The staff was friendly, the place was clean and the ambiance was irie! I lived in Scottsdale for a few years and wish this place was around when I lived here. Enjoy a good meal and know that your pocket, your body (and the earth - they recycle and buy local) will be glad you did!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. House style frittata with black coffee...truly D&#39;Lish!

Cy1ZIpr1rf60x9No_AeWLg.text: This little cafe is just great. The staff is friendly, serive is quick and if you just want to hang out and use the wifi that's cool too. They offer good coffee, good sandwiches, and good conversation. I have nothing bad to say about this awesome little coffee shop.

s4rCkEbY7xQdGxKZj8VWFA.text: d'lish is for sure the perfect name for this little place. When you walk in, the atmosphere is great, what with the snazzy furniture, friendly staff, and the plenty of customers in line, eager for the fresh food they serve up. Their menu is expansive and you might feel overwhelmed by all the breakfasts, soups, salads, wraps, sandwiches, are you feeling overwhelmed as I talk about all the choices that will overwhelm you?! Last time I went there, I ordered the nuts n' berries salad, the perfect toss of greens, blueberries, goat cheese, candied walnuts, and a raspberry walnut vinaigrette. It's perfect! I've also had their butternut squash soup, YUM! I try to try something different all the places I eat, and at D'lish, it'll be a while till I run out of new options. Go here!!

djea5xvqvv8NG-kRXGuUlg.text: I generally don't believe five star reviews myself, but this place is the real deal. Great coffee, fantastic food, the best service around. The people who work here are genuinely happy that you walk in. They will chat with you if you want, or let you do your work on their free WiFi.  The Breakfast Buzz has been deservingly and glowingly reviewed here at length, and is well worth the hype.  One of the best surprises on their menu is their tuna sandwich. I am extremely fussy about tuna salad, and this one is my absolute favorite. I could go on, but your best bet is to just come on by and see (and taste) for yourself!

8zsUR5NHosn97tXxao0ciQ.text: I had the frittata and the espresso shake. They were both delicious. The service was great, the prices very reasonable, and you can either drive thru or eat in. Great customer service.

CWNrwMut226fUx-8l4CxRQ.text: Love love love this place. It is a unique spot in a not so likely area, just one the things That keeps me coming back. Not mention they also offer great food and friendly service.

zFfX-ewpKb1ASPaQro_rtQ.text: Very, very good food.  My only complaint is that it should have two dollar signs on Yelp ($$) because it costs more than $10 to eat there.  I was a bit disappointed by that, but the food was really top notch.  Great service and staff too.  If I'm feeling a bit pricier than I normally am for lunch, I'll be back.

pbHHuOWgcxnDeZzr6dHm0w.text: okay, i finally know the name of this place. i think it used to have different owners when it originally opened.   i live 5 minutes from here (you know, on the other side of the tracks) and have been going here since it opened a few years ago. the quality of coffee drinks has gone up and up and up since the first time we tried it.   i love their lattes as well as their plain old cup of joe. the service has always been great; typically my dog gets a treat if she's riding along with me through the drive-thru.   great coffee, nice, local spot to support.

9D7-37awa9dwFNmoNj4t3g.text: The California club is so yummy!! Thick cut bread, over medium eggs, avocado, pesto, bacon, tomato. So good...only thing they could do better is use better quality bacon. A couple of times, the bacon was super fatty, not crunchy. The dirty chai is amazing.

EemJkaD5dbsvYsbH8hfwtQ.text: Went to Dlish for the first time on Sunday for lunch.  It was a great place to go.  Ordered a turkey cranberry sandwich and had it switched to a style without bread.  They tried to make it as close to what I wanted and they well exceeded my expectations.  Great place to go for breakfast or lunch!!

o0SHqu0JkxbjMgxNK4bE4Q.text: Wait took FOREVER, and parking is a bear. Bottom line, I won't be going back here on my lunch break....   which they made me late for.

Tm1b7AHpbKpx5R04U8tFOg.text: Every Sunday I travel 15 miles for the best coffee in AZ. I love D'Lish and I love to see a local restaurant do well. Thanks for opening your doors!

k0mmy3FoMDWOMO5uLRBW1A.text: I have been to this place a couple of times now for lunch and really enjoy it.  It has a small menu with just a few sandwich and salad options; you can also get breakfast all day (I believe).  They are known (apparently) for coffee, which I have not yet had the pleasure of enjoying.  I had the veggie wrap the first time and tuna salad sandwich today - LOVED the dill spice in the tuna.  Very fresh and well...D'lish.

0OwSSU8yrhubFsVFOYrSdw.text: The food is excellent, very fresh and always high quality.  Service is great and the stuff is very friendly.  Check it out!

x4g93o-WzUMj4LrpoH6vuw.text: After seeing the size of the parking lot, I was pleasantly surprised with this little gem! We were immediately greeted by a friendly and knowledgeable staff. The "man" salad was wonderful! The ingredients were all fresh and the tuna was delicious! The prices are great for the quality of ingredients and the portion size. The sandwiches looked awesome! I will definitely return!

l5OYjaSuQHEChEVnj97GAQ.text: Quaint little place with a nice young couple that aren't shy about recommendations running the show. Decent coffee and the drive-thru is a plus.

FIlSiNkAaTvi9aB5iCHE1Q.text: I freaking love this place. The food is always awesome, love the buzz, the staff is always hilarious. They can blare all kinds of reggae music, hell even country ( and I hate country quite a bit) and I'd still be there pretty much everyday. I do wish that they would be open later  so after work I could get dinner lol.

LQYV2Ht-pS90raDy1jUqOg.text: I needed some coffee today... so I rolled through the drive through and ordered my usual triple shot cappuccino with honey.   They do a great job here and I will definitely be back.  The coffee here rivals my usual spot copper star coffee.  The drive through is awesome... I love not having to get out of my car:).

eqSMTrjx9I6camM0YMsuxw.text: Food was excellent. Slightly limited menu, but any place that is vegan friendly is hard to come by, so I was happy. Small place with a peaceful atmosphere.

aTcvOSknR9R0LbhMypuSGw.text: Hangin' out at D'lish this AM,working the Wi-fi, drinking the java and enjoying the chill dance track soundtrack. Had a good (not great) egg 'n' cheese, and the barrista is generous with coffee refills. Definitely worth a visit if you're in S. Scottsdale. Fresh bunch of folks in and around.

ACXGuqFt4xp9Dwd3fsNUmw.text: We just went to D'lish with a friend on a lazy Sunday morning.  I had an egg, cheese, and chicken sausage bialy sandwich.  It had great flavor, and the eggs were cooked perfectly!  I never drink coffee, but I tried my fiancee's coffee and was very impressed.  The service was great and friendly, and everything came out quick.

MZtHNRNIHRaEzr7xO_MEGg.text: My mom and I were looking for a good place to eat yesterday and we thought we'd try this cute little spot that seemed to be full of people as we drove down Scottsdale Rd.  And yes, when we arrived inside the cafe, it was booming with young, fitness going clientele. Nice. No limping people here.  My mom ordered the low carb breakfast which she seemed to love that included an egg with cheese covered in a pesto sauce over a bed of greens. It also included a hash brown patty.   I ordered the humanitarian wrap, which consisted of a tomato wrapper with an assortment of veggies including zucchini, yellow peppers, broccoli, tomato, quinoa and hummus. So good. Right up our alley.   We loved the food there but I think what we loved most was the staff member who pulled a table for us because he saw that we were eating our food without one. The place was really small and there were tables outside but it was hot as shit so my mom decided she wanted to sit inside even if we didn't have a table.   There was a large group of people next to us still chatting away after they had finished their food, so the staff member just kindly grabbed one of their tables for us, letting them know that we needed it to eat. That was awesome. Those people were totally oblivious to the two ladies sitting right next to them eating food on their laps, like that's something we would have chosen to do even if there were available tables.  Anyway, lovely place. Wide variety of great healthy food. Young crowd mostly. Tiny location. Great service. Can't wait to return.

pXpF_ySYz_YUbO0Jv_hPSQ.text: Great breakfast.  I had the California Club based upon the reviews and my friend had the AZ Burro and we were both very happy with our choices.  Parking is horrible - so just be prepared.  Worth the trip for sure!

gUwgw3aw4yFGr-rcRCeGww.text: I love the food here! The restaurant is all about being organic and earth friendly, however they do not use cage-free eggs. ( So, not so earth friendly) Cage free does not mean the hens are treated well, but it is better! So my only suggestion would be to use cage-free eggs!

C_gGShVL6FUJGP2wYeJumQ.text: I honestly have only had the morning buzz with almond milk and it's my all time favorite!! The man salad is great too!! Healthy on the go!

VL3hPr5FBa7q8zRjPmNtRA.text: I had the "low carb" which consists of a slice of cheese, an egg, and a hash brown patty on top of a bed of greens and vinaigrette. Not sure of the nutritional content of such a mixture but I can tell you that it tastes damn good.   Unfortunately it's just a really, really small building that is ALWAYS busy. Not to mention that they have an industrial mocha-mixing machine that will give you tinnitus in 5-10 minutes.   The price is right, and all my friends say the smoothies are fantastic. If I want a late breakfast (because you'll be waiting any time before 11) that I can feel great about, D'lish is in the top 3 for sure.

9JHrQGTbf89evRLNULIUTA.text: I travel 30+ weeks a year; hands down the best breakfast sandwich I've had in years! Coffee pretty darn good too. Try 'me out fer sure

uXNoP11i8FNQHI4H8FPozQ.text: Staff is rude; food is full of salt; portions not as advertised.  Don't waste your time or money.

LHUdDqHwJ9hzbjFq5k3xNQ.text: What can I say...the best healthy fast food in the world. A few of my favorites are the veggie burrito, green lemonade, & the vegan breakfast buzz. I'm addicted & my experiences have been seamlessly amazing! I miss decly though!

eL6BYU5VgXba8OpDiKlXyA.text: I can't believe I almost drove on by!  The drive thru line spilled out on the main road, and I was hungry.  At the last moment, I made an illegal U-turn and found some parking a block away.  When I got to Dlish, the long line was gone.    The friendly guy behind the counter took my order and gave me a number.  We sat at a table outside with our puppy.  Patrons were dog friendly and we didn't get any dirty looks.  When friendly guy showed up with my drink, he asked if our dog would like a treat and promptly brought him one.    California Club is as good as everyone says.  The Breakfast Buzz was even better than I expected.  The ice teas were also good.  Drinks come in big sizes.  That's the way uh-huh uh-huh I like it!

iO8Ukatl6y6AOFwP0gVM3Q.text: I've had lunch here a few times and haven't been disappointed yet aside from VERY limited seating. Their protein bowls and veggie bowls are amazing and it's always a struggle for me to finish. Thanks for giving me the energy I needed to knock out the rest of my crazy work day! You guys rock!

uu6Tho1mt5GxB1IFcgtwiA.text: I first learned of this 'hole in the wall' fabulous gem when I was taken by the hand there by a former love last winter.  I hadn't been back until a few weeks ago and I am still in love with the YUMMY YUM YUM YUM food and smoothies they whip up.    While dining there they make me feel like a Goddess and will act as your 'date' if you go in solo or with another girlfriend.  It doesn't hurt to have amazing company and laughter while you dive into your California Club and inhale your Breakfast Buzz!  The oatmeal is something amazing and everything is simply tasty!  The price is nice and is someplace I would take the snobbiest "Scottsdalelight" for a pleasant surprise and an amazing meal.  The portions are sharable if you are watching your wallet or waistline!

U8CZIxus5zAva9GQzMMmng.text: Breakfast Buzz is literally the best thing that could ever happen to your tastebuds. Staff is always so sweet- even gives my puppy a treat when I take her to the drive thru with me. My favorite breakfast place BY FAR!

M6foUpc1iUX8UUTv-bk4Yg.text: OMG! The house farmhouse frittata is D'lish for sure!!! My taste buds fell in lust at first taste. Food Porn in FULL EFFECT! ...plus to really indulge in naughtiness I ordered my Dirty Chai EXTRA EXTRA DIRTY! y u u u m

Cqq4TTQ1c0HIm6PWKuZ0Dg.text: Love you. Really do. Love you even more because I can't have you.  Because I live in Chi-town and you live in Scottsdale.  Darn you.  I ate here three times. In two days. Yep.  That amazingly good.  Iced tea is the bomb. I loved it. They have great flavors. Protein shakes are delish.  Hence the name of the place.  Rockin' to say the least. Breakfast salad was so good, I now crave it.  Sucks to crave something so far away. Quinoa oatmeal was also wonderful and healthy and tasty.  Basically, I think you are nuts if you don't like this place. I'm super jeals of all of the peeps that live out there that can eat at D'lish whenever they want.  As for people crabbin' about the price?  It's independent.  It's different. It's got a great vibe.  And the food is tasty.  Eat and hush up and enjoy.

LaLuocjIj-tQ5nDOINvS4g.text: Sooooooo good! I get the Southwest rice bowl every time and am never disappointed. I always walk in for service because the drive-thru is usually 5 or 6 cars deep, so that sometimes slows down service. However, the food is great, employees are friendly, and I do not feel guilty after eating this "fast food". Definitely recommend!

Vm--QeZ9D7Mjfc3qe4Re4A.text: Cutesy place with fresh ingredients.  We had the burritos and oatmeal which were very unique - a good thing.    Love the quaintness and outdoor seating.  Very difficult to park and the back has an interesting smell.  Avoid the bathrooms but go there for breakfast!

RHtYaMH3ExzpSIjNcXZaHw.text: There needs to be more fast food places that are super healthy and have awesome staff. I love their food, their shakes, their service and their concept! Get the breakfast buzz and you wont regret it!

y8aGYgNgshBFco2YkQuLVg.text: This place just isn't for me. All my friends love their breakfast sandwiches (as do most) but I don't like their eggs and I feel it's a little pricey for what you get. Everything comes with avocado and they have absolutely no room for cars during busy hours. If you're in south Scottsdale it's worth a try as you'll probably like it. 6/10 on the hipster scale

uX4kA5MWUF7dzq6XBF7pmw.text: I absolutely love how this restaurant makes eating healthy, fast with their drive thru. The Vegan breakfast buzz is my all time favorite! Along with the AZ Burro! The only thing I really don't like about D'lish is that they close at 4pm so I can't stop by after work to get food. Wish they would stay open until at least 7 or 8!

cjPFQVUZJLPI5lJbn98xCA.text: Great spot to pull through once and a while for a blended coffee drink and breakfast sandwich / burrito

R6L02H7WKKsK4-jl9nxqmw.text: Love this place its healthy, fast, close to home! No matter what I order it's always good and I leave satisfied.  Breakfast favorites are California club and oatmeal our way, coffee is pretty good and they have almond milk.  For lunch... Man salad,  chicken breast panini and southwest bowl!!!  Cons Pricey Small location They close at 4

Mg8f_fYH9Q-ugrmEnPS8cQ.text: Are you serious? !! First time here visiting from Cali and they don't have ketchup?? -___- disappointed

WooQxfntlaAM5oCUpnz0kg.text: My fiance and I went here while we were on vacation. We walked away so impressed with this place and it made me wish there was one of these back home. The food was phenomenal and felt healthy. I felt great and not overly full after eating despite eating a lot. It is a little on the pricey side but I thought it was still pretty reasonable and you definitely get what you pay for. I'd go back here in a heartbeat if I ever find my way to Scottsdale ever again.

4Q0q_cHy2p2b2P7nHe2vZw.text: Breakfast Buzz is the best espresso drink I've ever had, not like a lot of the shakes with protein where you can taste the whey

ZOX9NIjdVRgJTplCdPbw3g.text: This place is an amazing breakfast spot, I usually go here once every weekend. The staff is super friendly and down to earth, and they have a lot of vegetarian options on the menu. I usually get the veggie burrito, which I highly recommend. The drive-thru is fast, which I thought was amazing for a health food spot. Make sure to get their fairly early on the weekends though because sometimes the line can get pretty long, but it moves fairly quickly.   I have yet to try any lunch items here yet, but I'm planning on it since their breakfast items are so good!  They also do a punch card, where you can get a free drink if you fill one up, coffee and smoothies included.

oIaOpgeZYHHpakwxguqh0A.text: I go there about three times a month and every time it's a great experience... I typically get the az burro which is delicious, and really tasty enchilada style... The staff is where it's at though...always always extremely friendly. Love this place

x_eqsB_8bPpA7TCEDs2ntQ.text: Long wait unless you call your order ahead, but so worth it!  Delish food, tastes great, very healthy, portions which leave some for the next meal.  This is food that makes you like it not just when you eat it, but after as well!

XQBQYklPU6_xFlhrrcTE3A.text: I must admit I was very skeptical before going.  it's just a sandwich/wrap shop I thought to myself.  I was surprised with the quality of the food.  We ordered the d'veggie bowl and it was amazing.  The vegetables were fresh and crisp.  They were out of quinoa, and rice was substituted, but it fit the bowl perfectly.  The sauce was tasty without being overpowering.  Friendly service.  Excellent place.  Hopefully, i'll get a chance to go back.

v-iRtuE6ta7zNOVnwKcSTA.text: For anyone who wants a quick and healthy meal to go, d'lish is the place to go. The california club is one of my favorites along with many more items on the menu. The service is always positive and quick. WIth its small interior, it makes for quick and easy service. The most popular item on the menu is the Breakfast Buzz which is a shake with bananas, vitamin, coffee, peanut butter and milk. If you want something healthy and fast to eat, the buzz is the way to go.

uzT9LMQTOTJaUNDnzRE-tA.text: Love this place! Cali club is the best also the breakfast buzz! Customer service is always great! A little pricey but definitely worth the price

9aielFyYclBS3aqZbD_yqg.text: Killer drive-thru breakfast spot. Love the Breakfast Buzz, really kick-starts my morning with the heat of one thousand suns. 5 stars.

6PYKAsL0uPRL7ry9LAJzEA.text: The most incredible thing on the menu is the AZ burro. Egg whites and feta are the best combination. The iced coffee was "d'lish" and the food was promptly brought to our table. If I lived in Scottsdale,  I'd be eating here all the time!

ECjfeIqrQj6e7VXVCTOleA.text: Awesome lunch spot! Every time I go here I leave satisfied... I used to go here all the time when I worked at Skysong but now have moved up to DC Ranch area.   Not going to lie, I have driven all the way down to Old Town on several occasions just to get lunch here... Granted I am obsessive and like the place alot, but either way, great little spot that you might miss driving by it!  Here are why I don't give it 5-stars: --They need more hours, open later... I mean their location is out of the Old Town foot traffic, I get it, but still! --Need to get the Drive Through situation worked out a little better...

hMlbdngPT2qft3NHxP_apw.text: As the name implies... EVERYTHING here is D'lish!!! From the breakfast sammies to the Man Salad to the Breakfast Buzz, I have never been disappointed with the food!!! I do suggest going to the drive-thru, as it can get very loud inside. Plus, the restroom facilities aren't the most accommodating. But the staff is always laid back, friendly and efficient. I do love the Tempe location but it is a little to far from my 'hood but if you are in that area, I definitely suggest making breakfast or lunch there a regular thing... as I do at the Scottsdale location!

RDa5D_6Dj5M4ISAR4OsobA.text: The California Club was pretty good. Their iced coffee is really bad. But what I'm most hung up on is their service. I went with my coworker to pick up a couple orders for the rest of the office; I forewarned the woman taking the order that it was going to be a couple different orders - on different cards- she reassured me that it wasn't a problem. Obviously, it became a problem. Another woman came to the window and snipped that if we wanted to make several orders we should have came in. They were not nice about it, and became obviously flustered. I felt badly, I know what a pain in the butt it can be. However, they were not nice - very rude and I felt my business was not valued. Needless to say I will not be going back; not because the food was bad but the service was very off-putting.(1/28/16) Went back today because those idiotic women charged my card twice. The manager there, however, was as nice as can be and gave me a gift card and was extremely apologetic. Looks like I will be coming back. (1/29/16)

KhkQC-OFJb1RnHg8B1pWqQ.text: You want healthy drive thru food that is not grease & packed with a 1,000 calories. Then this is the place! It is a diamond in the rough. I LOVE the Breakfast Buzz! Their wraps are awesome! Everything is great!!

LAYmO7BgLvlXceo91r56yw.text: This place is fabulous! Everyone who works there is very friendly and great at helping you find something you will love. I go there at least once a week and get my favorite drink... an iced chai latter with almond milk. It is the BEST coffee drink I have had! I definitely recommend trying it, as well as their food items. I have only ate there for breakfast but everything on the menu looks d'lish and healthy! Plus, all of the items are all labeled as either vegetarian, gluten-free, dairy-free, protein packed or balanced, which is helpful for those with food sensitivities.   All in all, I highly recommend this place for coffee, breakfast, lunch and even a mid-day snack.

U7H2itDlqgcQnE4n5zxk6Q.text: I stop by for a quick lunch near work. I've enjoyed several of the dishes they serve here: -The chicken panini ($7.25 with chips); the chicken, mushrooms and pesto were very good. -The Breakfast Buzz (peanut butter-banana-espresso smoothie) -The baja chicken soup and the bagel chips that go with it -Pomegranate green tea (not artificially/overly sweet) -Man Salad (Nice assortment of protein to fill you up) -Lo Carb Breakfast (2 eggs, avocado, & hashbrown on top of a salad) -The AZ burro (I only had a bite but seemed tasty and more filling than the regular sandwiches); saw someone eating this "enchilada style" (baja chicken soup on top) and it looked glorious.  Wouldn't try again: The hummus plate. The hummus itself wasn't that great and even though I usually like crudites, the veggies that came with it weren't standout either. Oh well, can't win them all. Won't deduct a star for this because of how good everything else has been.  The guy at the counter was really nice and friendly and didn't rush us to order even though it was getting busy.  Parking sucks (something like 9 spots?) and the drive thru line looks like it can get crowded fast, but I've had decent luck with it after 12:30 and when I call my order in ahead of time.  Also, God help you if you sit inside and someone orders something that needs to be blended (like a Breakfast Buzz). It gets really loud with that machine on. That being said, it's nice to sit at one of the outside tables when the weather is good.  I'll definitely keep swinging by as almost everything I try turns out to be quite tasty. As far as food goes in that area, it seems like one of the better options. Only wish they were open later in the day so I could grab something on my way out of work.

qGRnRvutmXUr91yxJsqEzQ.text: Hard enough to find organic restaurant, these guys have a drive-thru. It can get over-whelmed during breakfast time they need to expand.

7kGxOoefe5H-HMxKIS9QrQ.text: Yes, there is a party in my mouth...a breakfast party!  Definitely one of the best breakfasts I ever had.  I enjoyed the arugula salad with hash browns, eggs, and bacon (all in the salad, not separate).  It might sound weird but was fantastic!  The only thing keeping this place from 5 stars is the abysmal parking/drive-thru situation.  Words that best describe the situation I cannot use on Yelp....so I'll just say I had to make a 500 point turn to get out of the lot, and those in the drive-thru line were none too helpful in letting me depart.  I will definitely keep this in mind on my next trip--or buy a smart car.  Patio is dog-friendly, food is fresh and fantastic.  Just don't park in the back--and enjoy D'lish!

DZ7b6xtLrouALeaOuP8j9Q.text: D'Lish is DELISH!  I finally visited this darling establishment after reading my fellow Yelper's reviews, and I'm glad I did. The guys that work here are super friendly and super cute ( that is soooo inappropriate for me to say at this age)  and they can make a very nice latte and wonderful food! When you read that this is "fast food", don't be scared off that you are going to a chain-type establishment: this IS fast food that is freshly prepared and absolutely D'LISH!

Ogh8XC1xQagZ_Nm7RXwSQw.text: The food is always fresh and delicious. I recommend the California Club and the Az Buro. Fast service. The True mark of a great place is how they handle issues. This place surpasses the mark. This morning I received the wrong breakfast sandwich. The manager made it completely right and brought us a gift card for future use. He was friendly, apologetic, and I remain very impressed with this place.

ayLpNLiIw3zFfOnZT0SxEA.text: Breakfast buzz.  There is a reason every review mentions it.  It's that damn good.  Go there and buy a breakfast buzz.  NOW!  The reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the parking.  Yes, I understand there are some things you cant control.  At this point I think you are making enough money and you have a big enough brand that you can upgrade A) your location or B) buy out super burrito so you can use their parking lot.  It was understandable 3 years ago when you were just getting started, but it is now at the point where you guys need to do something about it.

iJ33jvGohyyrcHnZR4GCyA.text: I totally loved this place, I have burnt out the fruit/cheese/nut salad for myself cuz I keep ordering it, but i just had to again.  The berries were amazing and sweet, the nuts were sooo yummy, creamy goat cheese, it was great.  The hubby had a tuna sandwich, and I stole as many bites as I could it was soooooooooo good!! The price was GREAT! The customer service was totally nice.  I can't wait to go back and try the cali breakfast club, the man salad, maybe a bowl.

RusjgQ2eZ6oKqH-7Dt1LsA.text: D'lish can be hit and miss, but when it's a hit, it is soooo good. I love their breakfast sandwhiches, and they usually have really good coffee. It gets really busy on the weekends, so prepare to wait a while if you're there on a Saturday or Sunday morning. If you ever drive by on the weekend and don't see a line, you owe it to yourself to pull off and get something to eat.   I typically get their egg and cheese breakfast sandwich, and I'll add either bacon or chicken sausage. My wife loves the croissant sandwich, which has egg, cheese, tomato, bacon and pesto. We'll also typically get coffees or a blended protein drink or something.   It's a great place to come for breakfast and coffee, but at times, the wait is really long, and the food/service can suffer when it's really busy. I'll continue to go there pretty much every weekend. Highly recommend.

xep08_dViucuq-83BNp12A.text: I have been coming to D'Lish fairly regularly for about 3 years or so. I enjoy the fact it's not a huge chain and offers healthier food options. I've eaten just about everything vegetarian or fish on the menu as well as trIed the smoothies and tea options. Recently after having been frustrated many times over the past few months I finally had to give up on this place. The parking is situation is horrible or the ability to turn into the drive-thru line. The business basically needs someone conducting traffic duties to control the situation. It really is a huge traffic situation that oftentimes blocks the curb lane and either forces you to be a jerk who also blocks the lane or just give up. The staff typically ranges from barely polite to outright rude and they have no public restroom on the premises so I would recommend against eating in because even washing your hands after or before eating is completely out of the question. While the food is good it's not so amazing as to make up for these problems. Save yourself the aggravation and go to one of the many other options in the area

GZx48hFtguSKw7GNY9uYMw.text: Everything is delicious and fresh. Can't go wrong with the breakfast buzz and Cali club!!! Wish they had a D'Lish up in the north Scottsdale area but for now I don't mind driving to south Scottsdale or Tempe!! Highly recommend this!

GuKpEW5sklu7-yOcwEazMQ.text: First time to D'lish and I must say I am impressed.  The drive-thru may have a line, but they do their best to get people through as fast as possible.  I had the Veggie Burrito.  It's probably the best I have ever had...delicious Portabella mushrooms and perfect egg whites and potatoes.  The salsa is great, the people are friendly....I will definitely eat there again (and again).

Cy5CW2hR0DkJSSDanEEEKw.text: D'lish would be a perfect start to any type of day, whether it's action-filled days of snowboarding, inaction-filled days of laying by a pool and reading... or even, for the approx 90% of working-aged Americans who are sauntering, driving, running, biking, whatnot off to work.   My New Year's Eve day was perfectly (obsessively) planned, and I wanted to make the most of it. So it was with slight trepidation that I decided on D'lish to start out my day. And... it was perfect!  Perfectly hot/warm burritos filled with perfectly fluffy eggs and potatoes and savory meat to fill me perfectly full, at a price point that did not mar the perfection.  5 yums up!

seWB0I3mAQuPaGLpkaFYtQ.text: Amazingly delicious iced coffee and turkey club sandwich for a post-ride lunch.  We were in town for Collegiate National Triathlon Champs and looking for a tasty but healthy place to nosh after exploring AZ on our bikes.  The waitress even gave us all free refills on our iced coffee!  Everyone's food was delicious.

LCAfHFoyeRAkeMDYhlR4NQ.text: NOM. NOMNOM. Let me eat this delicious fuhd forever and always!  Specifically, let me eat the quinoa burger all day err day. There's something about the cool cucumber sauce or the tangy pesto or the gooey melty sticky cheese and thick juicy tomato and can you see me drooling through your computer screen yet?   I am a vegetarian. Yes. So, the options at this lovely little restaurant fit my moral standards and they did so deliciously. On top of that, the staff is so friendly. They hand out free smoothie samples regularly, all of which are quite scrumptious. I will never turn down a free smoothie sample. Ever.   The only bummer was that at around one in the afternoon one lunch date awhile ago they had ran out of kombucha to pair with my quinoa burger. That was probably the only time that unfortunate drought had happened to me, though. It was quickly forgotten after a free smoothie sample was placed in my palm. Thirst: quenched. Stomach: filled. Wallet: thick. Stars: five.   Eat at D'lish, just don't drink all of my kombucha.

kMPSDzfInOBgQJayN-d2Kg.text: Great food, not great coffee. Chad the owner has crafter an excellent menu that is healthy and tasty. All of the salads are killer, but I can't get away from the breakfast sandwiches. I love the California Club. It's perfect. The drive through is fast and awesome. But if you are looking to have a lunch business meeting, don't do it there. The seating is very limited and the blenders are super loud. So it's hard to hear and pretty distracting. Other than that, D'lish is awesome, and I'd definitely recommend it.

Mtmmpnwd552Ujif80ZuI_A.text: D'lish is the best quick spot to get lunch without a side of coronary artery disease. Who would have ever thought that people would like healthy food coming through their car window!  Favorite things: The Orange Glorious. this my friends is new school orange Julius on steroids. all natural ingredients include an entire banana. so D'lish!  The California Club..phenomenal. like a flavor explosion in my mouth!   the staff is super personable and always chatty and friendly. I suppose when you take away the trans-fats, processed meats and general corporate shittyness of your average drive through food, everyone is just happier and better off!  my one and only gripe: they close pretty early, (4pm)  ive driven by a couple times for my black bean burger or chicken panini fix only to find they were closed for the day.

5NQrRDyzhDiTkL7u6O-3OQ.text: Great food! Great friendly service! I love fresh healthy choices... This establishment would do well in the good parts of LA and I for one, would like a piece of the action!

BQkWwu_1jXKkNaExhrrMNg.text: Easily worthy of 5 stars based on the food alone. However, accessibility & efficiency are not D'Lish's strong points based on a building they've clearly outgrown. Congratulations to creating a successful business, but everybody's favorite neighborhood secret has literally outgrown its charm.   I find it annoying to wait 15 minutes for a blended drink (Breakfast Buzz) which I can easily replicate at home. I could go on and on about the cramped seating, rough chairs & the worst parking lot in S. Scottsdale, but I won't. I want to see D'Lish succeed on a bigger scale. It's quite simple. Rent or build a bigger building. Build your brand; because waiting 25 minutes for breakfast food isn't good business.

ZtV7RQtBfnTnW76bK0-dTw.text: Stumbled upon D'lish whilst looking for a different breakfast alternative and was very happy with the discovery.  Food is top notch, creative, and right in the range of what you should expect for good quality breakfast food.  Thumbs up on the service.  Biggest knocks against the place is the ambiance.  Overly loud, somewhat unpleasant club music not conducive to a sunday morning breakfast that did nothing to conceal the very loud shake/ice grinding machine.    Definitely check the place out but after ordering find a table outside.

OLoBqITfdYx9mswr0FsUVg.text: I love this place! Everything Ive ordered has been amazing food! The Man Salad is probably a top fav! I wish it was open for dinner, LOL

FilpQZHRBjoiHOUb79Mh9g.text: I don't know why I haven't reviewed this place yet.  This is one of the best places in the Scottsdale/Tempe area to go for a filling, delicious, healthy meal.  I love, love, love their soups.  Their sandwiches and "burgers" are pretty tasty too.  The only thing I could ask for is that they start offering at least one gluten free bread option, like Chompies's gluten free rolls (so far the best gluten free bread option I have had), so that individuals with gluten sensitivity can enjoy their sandwiches and burgers.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. My tuna and soup combo w/ GF bread, and a large iced green tea.

bbRCMYgwOvIoqJI0NFviIA.text: D'Lish is that total local spot that you keep to yourself. You don't want it to blow because its too perfect the way it is. All of the food is amazing, the management is awesome and they have some of the best coffee around.

dlahcVYuKjSJZMoEJpnLzg.text: The thing I love about this place is that its simple. Sandwiches, salads, soups. Breakfast and Lunch. There menu is specific.... what comes on the meal and what health benefits (if any). They do not serve soda. Tea, lemonade and coffee. Staff was knowledgeable and quick. No complaints.

ZY11W3j3CBdraHGD4J3UJg.text: Good little find thanks to fellow Yelpers! Nice little hole in the wall / diner, drive-in, and dive joint. Service is great, guys have a friendly and terrific attitude!  Menu is very diverse. My spouse is an RD. LD, and gave it two thumbs up for healthy variety.  Give it a try!

empZnY85WbrUnvn9Ujrang.text: This place is an awesome hidden gem! Never would have thought from the outside the greatness that lies within. The Breakfast Buzz was beyond amazing! The perfect breakfast protein shake of chocolate, PB and espresso. Went back 3 times in our week stay. Had the southwest rice bowl for lunch- very yummy and Fresh!

819evPAb-hhr9RLvP5JGPw.text: Nothing beats D'lish after a nice Camelback hike.  Some of the best iced coffee in town and the food choices are healthy, appropriately portioned, and diverse. I've enjoyed mostly their vegetarian options, but their carnivorous offerings are really, really tasty as well--I recommend the Low Carb Breakfast, which is mixed greens and fresh tomatoes topped with a hash brown, fried eggs, and some pesto.  I don't recommend the "drive thru", you'll be waiting for looooong time (although I've heard you can call ahead and reduce this wait). The seating inside is a bit cramped (the new Tempe location has a cozier patio) but I kind of like that charm in a place like this.

OLj-42-p0U0MYwGMDChlYA.text: BEST BUSINESS EVER!!!!!  A HEALTHY, vegetarian friendly, special diet accommodating DRIVE-THRU! Where have you been all my life, why aren't you in CA, & how come you are in Scottsdale?! No excuse not to eat right when D'lish-ious, healthy food can be had quick & easy from a window, just like fast food. I also love that they are open early so I could get coffee & a healthy breakfast to start the day first thing in the morning, AND it was friendly, helpful customer service! They also got my order right, with my customizations. (Whatever, I particular, not picky). I got the low carb breakfast with no cheese. I was happily surprised by the portion size! It came with a generous helping of scrambled egg whites, a huge bed of mixed greens, tomatoes, pesto drizzle, & hash. Unfortunately I couldn't eat it all (not even close!) & it was left to sit & die in my car under the hot AZ sun :(  I wish I could come back, & I know I will if I am ever in Scottsdale again! You go, D'Lish!

4IjD7CFMppFLF5jfeyqCRQ.text: Kitchen sink salad is amazing! It comes with chewy, soft bagel "chips" on the side and the salad itself is a pretty decent portion of yummy quinoa, lettuce (arugula?), and lots of other goodies. You won't get bored with this salad, that's for sure. This salad has bagel chips in it, which I was skeptical of at first, but they came in a separate bag and were soft and chewy, just like a bagel should be!  I've tried a few bites of other items like the breakfast burrito and the club, both of which were tasty. I've been wanting to try the burgers since they sound so delicious, but they're always out of them, even before noon!   As for drinks, I've tried the soy chai, almond chai, and dirty soy chai. I've gotta say, don't mess with perfection-the soy chai is where it's at! Also, their lemonade is BOMB, and I hate lemonade usually. The girl behind the counter said it's not homemade but it's "really expensive" lemonade they get delivered, and I totally believe her.  Only complaints are the hours (they close so early!) and the parking situation, which totally sucks. Parking requires Austin-Powers style maneuvers going from reverse to drive back and forth, but its totally worth it. Part of this is because they have a DRIVE-THRU, which is awesome, but the line is sooooooo long (all the time!), so it's worth it to just park and go inside or order if you don't call ahead. Also, you can call ahead and go through the drive-thru to pick up your order if there's no line!  Overall, cheap and delicious but lame hours and parking situation!

T2oPJnA249ws8djMh0Jj6g.text: I stop at D'lish almost every morning for a large coffee and a bagel.  The coffee is delicious and is great black.  To me the sign of a good coffee is one I can drink and enjoy without adding sugar or cream and this is it.  The D'veggie (sp?) bowl for lunch/dinner is so good I would eat it every day.  I did try their version of breakfast oatmeal the other week and it was phenomenally good.  I will definitely be having it again.  2010/10/06 - Went for lunch today with some coworkers and it was as good as always.  All of the inside tables were full, but it was cool enough to sit outside and the guys brought our food out to us.  One of my friends had the protein burger and said it was really good.  I once again had the D'Veggie bowl and really need to get something else, but it is SO GOOD!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ordering some delicious food!  D&#39;Veggie bowl is fantastically good.
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Taking random pix and didn&#39;t mean to upload this one.  Sorry!

Rp54ukw0BUfvojJzVCcI2A.text: So freaking delicious. Bit my tounge trying to eat too fast but good food and great shakes. Really enjoyed breakfast this morning. Dont hesitate to try its bomb!

xc6VEG2imMYYYzelG5_4yg.text: Great spot, great atmosphere !   My husband had the tuna sandwich which he said was the best he ever had- coming from him that is huge. I had the d'veggie bowl- comes hot- not a salad but delicious,  only negative is no bathrooms - so go before you come.

KMWSNXalEl9Vy4Kl4rgz_A.text: First time at D'Lish and I was quite D'ssapointed. I ordered (to-go) the quinoa bowl that comes with veggies and it came out soup style...which then exploded in my paper bag on the drive back to work. I ordered mine without cheese expecting the bowl to then be a vegan dish but it appeared to be full of cream! Ew! Why would I bother to ask them when ordering if their "quinoa veggie bowl" has cream in it? SO weird. I also ordered an iced green tea with some lemonade mixed in and it came out pink and tasting like sugar water. Ummmmm.... when does green tea look pink... This place is a nice concept but it's overpriced and lacks vegan options and I won't be going back for food. I do want to try their coffee so I'll be back to see how that goes. All in all, D'Lish left a lot to be D'sired in my opinion.

Xizw_70yeJM5Nz0T13bIgw.text: I was a bit skeptical when I asked Siri for a good place to get breakfast being an out of towner.  I was not disappointed at all with D'lish as the selection.    I was looking for a light easy breakfast, and went with the quinoa oatmeal.  I was a bit nervous having oatmeal without the oats, but they nailed it.  The fresh medley of fruit , the vanilla macaroon granola, and everything else just mixed perfectly.  Will return without question.  Can't wait to try some more of the menu.

DNlKoTqQtH-LLID8aX-kdQ.text: This is supposed to be a healthy eating establishment.  I am usually on a very restricted diet no sugar no starch as well as the use of HCG and most diets now a days seem to be jumping on the same bandwagon.  Its all about eating clean.  Hormone free meats, fruits and veggies thats it so when I took a look at the low carb menu that came with hash browns for every low carb entree I was a little confused and disappointed but rather than try and decipher their menu I just told the lady taking my order that I needed something with virtually no calories like an egg beater omelet she said we can make you an egg white omelet which isnt really my preference but I figured my choices were pretty limited so I said o.k. then I sat down pretty much prepared to hate whatever they brought me.  These people know how to make boring egg whites taste good.  It came on a bed of greens with tomatoes and onions as I requested along with a few slices of avocado and a very tasty pesto sauce just enough to give it flavor.  I loved it and felt extremely satisfied even though it must have been under 250 calories.  I would definitely go here again and order the same.  Make sure you get there early for breakfast because seating is very limited inside and out.  There is also a drive through.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. I love this.  HCG friendly food!  www.myhcgsupplies.com

R99M-OdTJqtJGHzW66XDgA.text: You might think that healthy fast food might be unappealing but do not let that hesitation keep you away from trying this place.  Knowing that it's healthy and tastes wonderful will now make me a regular customer.

DTjsIpWOeNQYE5nJ_hyOlw.text: Go here a few times a week for their healthy food and amazing Breakfast Buzz drink! The staff is always friendly and very quick with getting their customers served! If you have a chance to go to D'Lish, absolutely do it!!!

bnwIznxf_M6m3em6CW7emQ.text: Looking for something quick, yet healthy, and delicious?? This place has a drive through which is convenient for anyone on the go! Although it's not as much room as the tempe location when it comes to the drive through...customer service has been great & they are always attentive/ to what you want! Thumbs Up!

c8P_BD0Vh6z-DbWE_aGcXA.text: DELICIOUS FOOD - ALWAYS BUSY  That's the sum up. The Breakfast Buzz (banana chocolate smoothie with espresso) is AMAZING!!! The California Club is out of this world. The Oatmeal Our Way is a little odd because it's not oats, it's quinoa. Very filling but takes some getting used to if your mouth is expecting the mushiness of hot oats. The hummus comes with seasoned pita/naan and the smell is a little odd, but it all tastes good.  This place is the BEST fast-ish food place. I can't say 'fast' in all truth because I've often sat in the line for several minutes with other cars behind me. Good news is, that SHOULD mean they're taking time making your food even more awesome and not just slapping it together in uniform fashion like McD's or the like.  If you're coming here, plan ahead and either come early when you know you gotta be somewhere. The food is TOTALLY worth it.

QTBgH9HvDUh1gfd6yFly0g.text: My boyfriend and I have been wanting to try out this place for a while and finally got a chance to stop by. The food was mediocre but overpriced and the portions were small, pre-made eggs and such. There was trash overflowing, on tables, and all over the floor. Dead plants and open peanut butter containers sitting out for the MANY flies to get to. The service was bad. The man working was on his cell phone yelling about having money stolen from him and spent the rest of the time looking at motorcycles online.   I used the bathroom, which has no air conditioning and no working faucet. I got a glimpse of the kitchen and, again, it was worthy of  a cringe.   I was almost unable to eat my sandwich when it came. I was a little worried I'd get food poisoning.   Stay away from this location: bad service, expensive food, and extremely unsanitary.

K-Lzpdp8wRK2etJpaU9dxQ.text: Went here twice while in Phoenix last week.   Both times I was in a big rush and it was awesome to be able to get a healthy meal so fast!   REALLY exceeded my expectations in terms of taste and quality.

O-UtYN3yKr9gNFmbePxx2Q.text: Two words.  BREAKFAST BUZZ.  If you haven't had one, get it now.  I am addicted.  Espresso, peanut butter, chocolate & banana in one drink?  Count me in.    The rest of the menu is so great as well.  A bit pricey, but it is worth it.  Some more of my favorites:  sun dried tomato bialy, iced chai, frittatas, & the veggie d'lite.  I still have so much to try...& I will, it is just a little out of the way for my daily routine.  I wish they were open later...I crave one of their salads or a wrap after my evening workout, but i'll forgive them.  Another plus: they use a lot of organic & local ingredients & recycled products.   I'm a fan of the drive thru, even though you may as well park & go in instead of idling in your car while they make your food!  (just get out...it's better for everybody!)  The guys who work there are awesome too.  Basically, d'lish is the food I wish I could make for myself!  I might just go get something now....

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ts91wJfuYMHN9EPnrK1MfQ.text: The coffee was similar in quality to Starbucks and a better value.

_j1_s67-V11BfGKWl3a_Ig.text: Love this place!!  The California breakfast club is amazing!!  Love it had a drive thru!!

OKd3n50fYplGGKfG8Dh9UQ.text: Being new to the neighborhood, I was seeking out unique places to get a good cup of coffee.  I like to give the locals some business once in a while.  I find their coffee is often better too because it has to be.  This place is great!  They have a drive through (majorly important) and their coffee doesn't have that burnt taste that you get at Starbucks.  The service was really efficient.  I want to go back to hang out for a while some lazy Saturday or Sunday morning.  It seems like a great place for doing that.

R1JwBaRaBS8co4NazwoIig.text: Hidden Gem! I found this place on Yelp and so glad I checked it out this morning. The food and coffee were great and the prices are so low. The staff was very friendly and made great suggestions for us. I am already planning on going back tomorrow to try something else!

TNoRn9DAAvMgs1CIaMiyvw.text: Need a fast, yummy, CHEAP, breakfast burrito in the morning?  This is your place.  And trust me, I am a bit of a bfast burro connoisseur.  I've been perfecting them since my freshman year in college.  This place almost has me beat.  I've tried all three varieties; chicken sausage, bacon, and just eggs/cheese/awesome potatoes.  they were all d'llsh.  Additionally, the drive thru was quick, easy and enjoyable - staff is extremely friendly.   Great stop for a quick, yummy bite pre-work, during-hangover, or post-bank over-drafting (it really is cheap!).

0QjTB6IwFTqqGoqYh69x5w.text: i was having the tires replaced on my car and needed to kill some time and get some caffeine (and, hopefully, some decent food). we'd only been in scottsdale for 24 hours and were on our way out of town...so didn't know where to go.  we left the tire place and started walking. just as i was about to get pissed off about walking in the arizona sun...i saw a cute little coffee house. we walked in ...and were greeted with a smile and a nice menu.  i love the decor...the place had lots of sunlight and the perfect combination of air conditioning and ceiling fan. i ordered a large iced latte ...it was enormous and d'lish (sorry....couldn't help myself). my man ordered the house blend smoothie ...he's still raving about it.  we sat for a bit (we had lots of time to kill) and checked out the menu. it's not a huge menu, but a really nice selection. i had the turkey club sandwich and he had the breakfast club sandwich and we were both very happy.  the staff was super friendly ....really made us feel comfortable and welcome...even though we were hanging out for awhile.  my only complaint about this place....is that it's in scottsdale and i'm currently living in tucson. :(  i think anyone who lives in scottsdale needs to go check this place out.

8Uv8wm4devJqDDLApC__Sg.text: Really cool local place, checked it out during Spring Training before heading to the Giants game. I read the great reviews so I got a little of everything to try it out: a soup, sandwich, and smoothie. The soup was excellent gourmet quality, on par with a top restaurant. The smoothie was excellent, very fresh and refreshing, more of the low-dairy, low-powder, high fruit type smoothie that is really cold and icey and has a sugary bite to it like you might make at home with a blender and some fresh fruit. On the sandwich I think I called a bad audible, as I read their cali club was great on my phone, then arrived to order and saw that included egg but I wanted lunch, so I switched to the turkey club. Although the turkey club had quality ingredients, I think the strong flavor of the whole wheat bread overwhelmed the subtle flavor of the turkey, which made the sandwich less flavorful overall. However, my friends said their sandwiches and coffee were great, and they made a good tuna sandwich. I think my friends and I will definitely return in future springs!

clEiUyoV9HxlSrDdLPcpeQ.text: I came here a few weeks ago and I really loved it. I thought it was great that most of the ingredients were vegan and vegetarian friendly. My husband and I came here for breakfast. I had a strawberry banana smoothie and my husband had a chocolate, coffee peanut butter protein shake to die for. And we had bagels that were very tasty. I would love to come back here for lunch, everything sounded excellent, especially the soup. I was also impressed with the staff....I thought that was the best feature of this whole place. They are super friendly, and this one guy, was SOOOOOOOO Funny the way he was greeting people and making jokes. It was very outgoing and it made the customers feel like they had been coming there forever even if it was their first time. It also makes patrons and business owners feel like they are an important part of the community with the camaraderie that takes place here. I am looking forward to returning.

t6ndfHtZ2L8sf7rrnhg2rw.text: Dave was so friendly to us right when we walked in. He was great! I'm from San Diego & want one in north county! I would be a regular there no doubt!! I had the oatmeal (d'lish) & girlfriends had low carb breakfast with portobello  mushroom & quinoa protein patty! So good! Also had the buzz smoothie!

479hMqiDc68bnY_dqpL5Fg.text: I have driven by Dlish about a thousand times and about two weeks ago stopped in. AMAZING I have since been back close to a dozen times. The food is awesome breakfast, lunch if it's on their menu it's sure to please. Organic, local and awesome friendly staff makes this one of my new faves

FuztLdwoQEZ--wVqgopvog.text: Good place to take your young out-of-town guests to show you're still hip. Not a good place for us senior citizens. The music is so loud as to be painful. The staff are disdainful of older folk. The food is strange hard core healthy. Might be good spot to cure a hangover.

WHohh4wcii_Hdx7G0f9Ceg.text: I've spotted this place while driving down Scottsdale and saw it had great reviews on here and had to try it.  They have drinks, snacks, bfast/lunch items that are creative and tasty.  Healthier and more nutritious than others nearby.  Fast and friendly as well.

1y4M2dKoy8UUZiheuYpjDA.text: A great alternative to Starbucks to grab a coffee in the morning because they open at 6am and because the staff is friendly, courteous, and knowledgeable. The food is awesome. I had an egg, cheese, potato, and bacon burrito with the house blend coffee. Delicious! Really cool that they have a drive-through window, as well. You gotta go here!

q16Ji0dYZezNdVLv2PDyRg.text: Just found D'lish through a friend's recommendation.  Portabello soup and turkey club are amazing, coffee (their own) is smooth, and the service is friendly and fast.  It really doesn't get any better than this!!!  I will be back often!

Js77zOgG0eEIoLxx575yTw.text: An experience that I will never come back for. Had the Quinoa oatmeal loved it. Asked for some milk for my coffee from the server who had his back to me but was screamed at in all sincerity "CAN YOU JUST HOLD ON A SECOND!!!!" ... I've had better service at Starbucks, If you can't handle the espresso machine then maybe you should be in the back. OR put cream and milk next to the sugar? ....no lets just yell at our first time guests. THX!!

CrJxMmHDwJFt093F8ZaBNg.text: Dirty Chai (w/ almond milk) AMAZING. I went out of my way to get this drink!

7lVMSXpXsH094pUGoYD3Jw.text: When I lived around the corner from D'lish I would go there every morning. Their coffee, fabulous. Their food, amazing. The service, excellent. I specifically recommend the Orange Julius and the Breakfast Buzz (with an extra shot). Really miss this place.

sj7Sf2aSFZ8zx1Ab0clqng.text: Great lunch spot!  Fast, delicious, fresh food!  We were in town last week from Chicago and based on the yelp reviews checked this place out.  I had a yummy hummos plate and my husband the turkey sandwich.  Returned 2 days later for more.  Good prices, friendly service, and great food!!

b0dynRjwrg01gE7xMVKLlw.text: This particular Monday I was in the mood for something healthy and affordable and with it's overwhelming positive reviews I figured it would be a place to check out.  After waiting in line in the drive through for what seemed like forever, I finally inched through the tiny drive-through/parking area and ordered my food.  The selection is limited and I think the price is misrepresented.  I would probably put it at least at $$.  For a simple tuna sandwich and a medium drink to put me back almost $11 without any sides.  For $6.50 I thought, this sandwich had better be amazing.  It was meh.  New flavors and combos with the tuna salad that I hadn't really thought of before, including diced carrots? Strange, but the flavors were interesting.  Sweeter than I would have liked.  I'm more of a savory lover.  All in all, I was not that impressed with the food and the price.  Especially since I could've gotten a bigger sandwich with a side of chips (or salad) and a cookie from Bread Basket Bakery for $.25 cheaper.  Thanks for the experience, but I do not think I will be back.

dO60AdBsCR5quCzp4CynUg.text: EAT AT D'LISH!  Food is great. You can have a healthy breakfast/lunch or cure your hangover with fritatas and breakfast burritos. The coffee is the upper echelon as well.  The atmosphere is great - friendly, hip, personal - the likes of which i haven't seen since I left Manhattan (with the exception of a couple vacations to San Francisco and Amsterdam).  BIG PLUS: d'lish is staffed by pretty good looking people and the clientele is as friendly as they are.   STOP DRIVING UP AND DOWN SCOTTSDALE RD. WONDERING "how that place d'lish is." I finally stopped in and have been back every Sat & Sun since.

wny1l8XldCaN8HNRhyg1lQ.text: great food, cool concept.  a little pricey and the location in scottsdale has a horrible parking lot.

mJyYTXl9lwED1FaqLwV9cA.text: great low key breakfast, friendly staff. yummy quinoa granola and breakie burrito ($4.75).

PZZQW5reYHFkKseMz_lHXg.text: Perfect place for a healthy yet tasty breakfast and quick! The breakfast buzz smoothie is must, especially if you're in a rush or want a light breakfast. I always go for the breakfast club as well. The tomato bialy adds the perfect extra flavor.

Qv4YsftAKQP1OI3icNWcVg.text: I love this local spot. Everyone that works here is friendly, laid back and willing to help you figure out what you're craving.  My breakfast go to is their breakfast buzz with almond milk. It's a quick, nutritious and equally delicious jolt of caffeine with protein. It's filling and it keeps me full until lunch.   For lunch, my go to is there tuna salad wrap. It's not your typical tuna salad, because they refrain from using mayonnaise (thank heavens ), I also sub out the wrap for a sundried tomato one. So good!

JayMjUHwzlMdZ7fcUMfwzQ.text: AMAZING spot for breakfast/brunch. Have not been here for other meals but wouldn't hesitate to come back and try.   My Order:  Croissant Sandwich w/ Portabello soup.  FOOD: 5/5 To begin to explain how amazing this was, I have to mention that I savored every bite and even tried to eat slower with smaller bites because I didn't want the flavors to end. The croissant is rich in flavor and balanced very well. The pesto was my favorite part and would recommend maybe asking for extra.   AMBIENCE/DECOR: 5/5 Small but cozy. It wasn't very busy when I came but can see this place getting quite packed. Drive thru line went out to the street. Parking is a bit of a hassle but there are plenty of nearby establishments you can park at.  It can get a little noisy as well when the blenders are running but it's expected for a small little place.   COST: 5/5 Cost is a bit high but it is obvious they don't skimp out on the ingredients and preparation. The food and the experinece is well worth it. Everything is fresh and healthy.   I can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Croissant Sandwich. Eggs, bacon, tomato, pesto in a warm flaky croissant.

1rWXqzV-yRs_UApcwkI_Tg.text: I had read so many wonderful reviews about this place so I had high expectations.  I also thought it was a cheap place, but I see that you don't get much for the price you pay.  I ordered the Cali Club and was not impressed by it.  There was too much cream cheese so it overtook the sandwich, rather than just make a mark on it.  We ordered my son a quesadilla and a green smoothie.  The smoothie was fine and the quesadilla was meh.  I would not come back, but it's just not my cup of tea.

psildzJ_-g67FKn-bpHCQA.text: Amazing spot. Great concept - fast food that is fresh & healthy. Breakfast Buzz with almond milk is amazing. I've had almost everything on the menu. All of their items are tasty. You can't go wrong at D'life :)

hBtlPa45lDvtu6Zz-Op9BA.text: Went here for the first time today after seeing the reviews and it was just as good as everyone says it is. I got the man salad and although it wasn't exactly what my stomach wanted, it was still really good. The service was very good and the staff was very polite. I will definitely be coming back to try more of the menu.

CPfp3jzh_dfFufu7JZaXzA.text: Yeah I was addictd to the breakfast buzz for a month straight , actually still getting 2-3 a week. The California club is good, the man salad with tuna is a favorite.  5 star !

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yummy buzz!

BsBHrPwHTDqOFVn9UBlGFg.text: This place is so delish! The breakfast buzz is a genius idea to get you up in the morning.   Protein, almond milk, vitamins, banana, chocolate, peanut butter, and an espresso shot.  This place offers fast service, amazing quality and service! Thank you !

a3pepYOjIRJOR-qFxZ_8MQ.text: The food here is so good!  I love the breakfast sandwich california club!  I wish the restaurant was bigger, it's not really comfortable to have a meal with people there, so we usually just go drive thru.  Everyone is super friendly.  Great local place!

-M4N0P3p5zQUI1La7OjdDw.text: Free refills on iced coffee!!! Amazing breakfast sandwiches and it's good for you. Parking is super hard to find, you're better off parking down the street and walking. Service is really fast and staff is very friendly. Love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Why can&#39;t all restaurants have this mentality!

cHRqWl2rFsddwCoYEsGgrw.text: Always consistently great for me... I love the low carb salad... I see a lot of ppl are upset with the long time for the drive through.  The secret is to park at super burrito and order or dine inside..  or even better call in your order ahead of time!

G7f-uy8B-baVOyOHmSPnyg.text: I have two words for you... breakfast buzz. Stay warned its an alternate for a meal.. but it is amazing. Add some soy or almond milk and an extra shot of espresso and its golden.   Best part of the morning.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Seasonal shake. Apricot and strawberries.. soo goood
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. If you are going through the drive thru. Make sure to check the menu online. They go to your car before even hitting the menu!

VDtx9Z5NfHg5N7I1k56pKg.text: So I've been to D'lish many of times before and I've been meaning to write a review for months but today....I just had to document my experience.  D'lish always has a pretty big wait and rightfully so. I ordered a banana strawberry smoothie that was killer and a AZ burrito BUT...I got this bad boy enchilada style. Best decision I've made her by far.  I've had the black bean burger, the bowls, the sandwiches but this burrito enchilada style is the best if I haven't made my point already! Service is always great and friendly and there isn't really much negativity I can bring to the table for this place.  Maybe one thing is to stay open later! There's not really a place like this and I'd come here a lot more if they were open later too. Keep it up D'lish!

eVCP_aALl7GgzmzLVKd1sQ.text: This place is delicious! I had a breakfast burrito with black beans, mushrooms, eggs and cheese and fresh salsa on the side! I also had a prickly pear tea and a almond milk latte both were on point! The second time I dined in and had a big salad and a wrap that were also yummy! I love that they have a drive through. I wish they were open later in the day. For a quick healthy bite to eat I definitely recommend this place. My only negative would be one of the staff members she has been there both times I have been there, she mumbles and doesn't really smile.... if you don't like people, don't work in customer service! All the other staff was great! I can't fault them for one bad tomato!

O7GhJva1WVViBaf2VMwclw.text: This little place is great (emphasis on LITTLE). This place is always packed for good reason but the wait to park or get through the drive thru takes a bit away from the appeal of a quick and healthy meal. That being said the speed is only slowed by the traffic. The food and drink are always ready promptly. The food is awesome and they are friendly to those with special diets. My top picks are the Breakfast Buzz, butternut squash soup, and California club. They have a soup and salad combo that hits the spot! Those are my top three but everything I've tried is very good and they have a patio that is doggy friendly.   The only other thing I might add is that this isn't the cheapest place but it's definitely worth it.

IktvKJ9g4YEu1Suu9W8xuQ.text: Seriously in love with this location. Everyone here is super friendly. The food is fresh and delicious. The drive thru is convenient.  Their green tea is so refreshing. The Turkey Club is one of my all time favorites but their bowls are also worth tasting. I haven't tried their burgers but I will one day. The breakfast menu options are also worth trying. I opt for the frittatas or az burro. The oatmeal isn't all that bad but the other items are sooooo much better.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Medium iced Toddy. Holy Cow! Caffeine is my friend today. Lots of espresso.
