Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The drive thru line on the weekends. Don&#39;t worry. It&#39;s worth the wait.
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken panini on a sundried tomato wrap. I swapped out the feta for goat cheese. Yum.

xF34fkV8fjqESEAYgH-NyQ.text: Hot off the plane in Arizona... we were on a mission to find me some good Vegan food!  We decided to hit up D'lish in Scottsdale!  This tiny little hot spot, was right off a busy road so naturally we missed our turn the first time, but found that they had a little parking lot located just to the back of it.. This parking lot also served as their drive thru, which a member of the staff actually came out to your car to take your order?  This would become a nightmare later as we were trying to leave the parking lot, since there was a NYC STYLE TRAFFIC JAM behind the restaurant!  We couldn't get out! Oh well that's the only thing keeping this place from being a 5 star!   The food was fantastic! I had the home maid black bean Veggie burger with a side salad!  It would be the first of many veggie burgers I would eat this week, and might have been the best! Really wonderful flavor, topped off with a little hot sauce, (when in Rome)!    We loved the out door seating, and the staff was super nice, as one of them was clearing our table told us of a few spots we could hit up while we were in town!  And gave us directions to Old Town!  I really wanted to try to Peanut Butter Smoothie, it looked and smelled gonza good, but I had to leave some room in my tummy for Beer by the pool!  Next Time!    Great staff, cool little space, only problem was that disastrous parking situation!  Walk here if you can! Or park on a side street!

1dfbHoG72lrxEC-WfySnxg.text: Clean, healthy, vegan, vegetarian with high quality meat and dairy selections. Breakfast croissant was out of this world. All the items I have purchased, so far, have intense and delicious flavor, and are amazingly tasty for being so healthy. WOW. Love this place.

cKjODXrFLlixt4vozgL8VA.text: I love this place! Breakfast buzz is my jam! It is delicious, not sure how healthy it is, but I don't care... I crave it! And the turkey club or California breakfast club...sooo good! Always fast, and if they're too busy (line of cars in drive thru) they come out and take your order and bring it to you..which is 5 stars in my book, have an infant who has a love/hate relationship with car rides and you never know what you're gonna get. Always worth the trip!

xRealSdC0Ldezs5J_YxqfA.text: One of my favorite breakfast places in town. A True "local" choice. The almond buzz shake is my go to but the veggie burrito is my addition if I need a more hearty meal. Be prepared to wait a little bit on weekends and during peak hours. It's a small place and very popular.

HXl9aU3kk2nc4j1oLgB7-Q.text: I've reviewed their old Tempe location and my review for the Scottsdale Rd location is the same! My boyfriend and I needed food on the go and at first, all we could think of was your basic fast food. We realllly didnt want something bad but had no time! Then we remembered D'lite! Thankfully. We scooted on over and waited in line. The line can get a bit long, but if you wanna go inside there is parking in the back. If you can make it passed the cars! If the line gets too long, they do get people out to take your order which is amazing. I love their food. Their beet salad IS AMAZING. Their Turkey wrap IS AMAZING! The breakfast buzz is amazing. It's all delicious and healthy and fast. The perfect solution for food on the go!

Dv_Yl0r-_1aJT2R7D3zO1Q.text: Oh D'Lite (previously D'Lish)! We've been coming here since college and really enjoy this place. They have a wide variety of healthy options, an awesome "breakfast buzz" smoothie, and many other delicious options.   On this trip we stopped by the Scottsdale location where (we knew from prior visits) the parking can be a bit rough. The parking lot is very small and with the drive through it can be a pain to get into the lot and find a spot. Once you do you can walk inside where you will find a moderate amount of seating and a small outdoor patio.   After checking out d'Menu we got the California Club and Traditional Burrito for our breakfast. We also got two vegan breakfast buzz shakes. We already knew from prior visits we were going to enjoy the food as we've had it before and this visit was just as good!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Traditional Burrito
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cali club
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. California Club ft. Vegan Breakfast Buzz

ehOz0lFQzbSR7w8brL_HBw.text: Honestly, I just love the name itself!!!!!  LOL!!! Dee'lite!! Great!!!!  Anything with my name in it is just a Deelite to see!! Pun so intended!!  Anyway, I love the gluten free options and the love the fresh veggie choices!!  Great place!! But so so busy!! Always means its a great choice to eat!!

9wVeF_h4JdTyEZ1a9qYXrQ.text: So, this gem of a place is as good as it gets when it comes to "healthy" food!    Their Breakfast Buzz milkshake brings all the boys to the yard (or at least this one)!  Espresso, protein, banana, peanut butter, chocolate, milk, and ice all blended together to turn that morning frown upside down!  The Green Lemonade smoothie is (what word rhymes with smoothie??) is wonderful!  It tastes healthy, yet delish!  Eating the Breakfast Club sandwich leaves you with the same feeling you get after winning the lottery (but not those BIG multi-million dollar drawings... more like a scratch-off ticket)!  Just take a look at the menu and blindly pick something and you will be happy!  *****FIVE STARS*****

nvNYX9ClXWbece9K58iasQ.text: I love this place!  I have been calling ahead to order an egg and cheese bialy to go for weeks now.  Their bialys are soooo yummy and the eggs are usually cooked perfectly!  I also like their salads, other breakfast sandwiches, lo carb breakfast bowl, and southwest bowl.  We order lunch sometimes for our office from here as well.  They always get or orders right!  The final thing I'll mention is that I love that they offer doggy bags (leftover turkey and rice) for only $1.50 each!  I'll usually get these as a meal replacement for our pups when I want to treat them.    Edit: I still love their food, but their pricing is ridiculous.  I subbed a different cheese in my burrito and they still charged me for it.  The girl even told me when they sub a cheese they have to charge extra for it.  Pretty crappy business practice.

-gcGs_n_LogaqJ8PlQijxA.text: This place is an amazing find! My boyfriend and I love coffee and we live near Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts and a Dutch Bros and we are over those! We are supporters of buying local and one day we decided to try D'Lite and I'm so glad we did! We can't stop going back, the coffee is superb, the food is so fresh and great quality! The prices aren't unbearable either. There are two lanes for the drive thru and the employees there are good about getting to everyone quick! Love D'Lite and for the quality of the coffee and food!

1PXPv21bT0TkuGCuSMFfWA.text: Overpriced for just okay food with small portions. The most inconsiderate clientele. Constantly blocking the street and other companies driveways. Maybe they should move to a location that includes more parking?

fi_qIHcgtZGpoLOmoZCBuA.text: Still love this place!! I've grow to loooove and crave the croissant 'wich. The flavor of this breakfast sandwich is so thoughtfully made. I recommend it to everyone!!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

fAq1Xr7s2qVe82LzY331qg.text: I like d'lite. They have a very delicious menu. I am not sure exactly how "healthy" the menu items are like cream cheese and bagel sandwhiches and chocolate syrup in their coffee drink called breakfast buzz. But it is very tasty and seems like great quality.   The drive thru is usually very long and often overflowing onto Scottsdale rd.  Not somewhere you want to go when crunched for time

IPEYLZf-c6r8hQCvGg2NqA.text: Tasty, affordable, and healthy food! I love that you can drive through here, and their service has been very quick the last two times I've been! There are even girls that stand outside and get your order and payment info before you reach the window. I've gotten the veggie d'lite on a wheat wrap, and the cucumber spread was tasty, but I did have a few mouthfuls of straight lettuce which wasn't the best. I've also tried the humanitarian on a wheat wrap and I love the quinoa in it! The wraps were around $7, I just wish they were a bit bigger!! Friends of mine have gotten their other sandwiches from here and the portions have repeatedly been pretty small so just keep that in mind!

O4hOTUpwuLQ0H85gw50SXg.text: I used to love D'lite years ago but I've had nothing but lame experiences there lately. For example today, I ordered the low carb breakfast and they literally gave me a hash brown. ONE SMALL HASHBROWN. Where's like idk everything else on this order? Lol had to go through the long inconveniently located drive thru so we aren't able to just turn around as we drove away not realizing our order. On top of that, my friend who ordered a cappuccino has his LARGE coffee with literally 1/4th of the cup filled. We tried to say something at the drive thru by asking if there was even coffee in here since we had to drink it and after 3 seconds of dipping the cup back, we finally make contact with a poor taste of liquid. Aka this cup isn't even half filled and he got a large.... I'm confused. Maybe I'm just frustrated that I drove away with A HASHBROWN. Like if I wanted this I would've gone to McDonald's

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

746EoLpj6yDNVPLYFGfL5g.text: My favorite healthy lunch spot! Seriously love the customer service and prices!   I also really enjoy that you have a coffee shop vibe for if people wanna come study and kick back.   I love pretty much anything on the menu, the breakfast burritos and salads are my go to!   100 percent share this place with all my friends and coworkers.

afPNqYWhnRsCwxe4FglD4A.text: Great concept. Very healthy & diverse menu. Other than that ingress/egress/overall parking sux!

Bye60a0WjUwk4gF42Ppgiw.text: The buzz is incredible! Wish they were open later. Tried the mushroom soup, super good. I'll have to try the coffee soon! I like the loyalty program too. The sandwiches are delicious!! This place is a gem. I wish it was open till 7 lol!

r7I2R7vLjBkhgiUQW8ikpA.text: This is probably my food spot in Scottsdale. If you're going on a mission for good-tasting healthy food, this is a place to consider. The service is prompt and courteous. The crew is all over the place but it's cool because it's not like any other small business joint I've been to. Every time I go, I get the Veggie Burrito and the AB&J. I substitute the egg white and Swiss on the Veggie Burrito for Quinoa and Avocado to make it vegan--and it's thee bomb!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

dY-fQKUR0To1yObwNGGALg.text: I've been wanting to try D'lite for awhile but haven't had the opportunity till today. I rolled through and got 2 signature items, The California club and a D'breakfast buzz. That sandwich is a GAME CHANGER! SO GOOD! This will definitely be a must have from now on! The pup came with me and had a doggie bag and a treat while we waited. He gives this place 4 ecstatic paws up and I give 2 enthusiastic thumbs up!!! Great place! Can't wait to go back!

6h0CNySBVUtKgkOeS1lNUA.text: The breakfast burritos and sandwiches are great, but the Breakfast Buzz is the real star of the show here. It is the best breakfast smoothie I've ever had. So good, I wrote it a haiku:  Just how many meals Would I drink a Breakfast Buzz? If I could I would.  Don't let the line deter you. It may look long, but it moves really quickly! I passed this place on my way to work for half a year before I gave it a shot, and now I want my half a year back. The line always looked so long. GET IN LINE.

dLnPlUMPxq34dvKHLwqIUA.text: Great breakfast place. When on Scottsdale road, be vigilant you could drive by without noticing it... Very friendly service. Healthy, tasty food. I ordered the low carb breakfast. It was excellent. At 9am the walk-in customers are in majority people who have just finished their morning sport. Lively music competes with the noise of the blenders. Judging by the length of the line of cars in the drive thru (that never decreased while I was eating), they are very popular. Good dynamic breakfast atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Low carb breakfast
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Light roast coffee &amp; freshly squeezed orange juice

lJQrTOF4JGpb5pDs2YXU7g.text: This place is great! I've never had something I didn't like here.  The crew is always top notch and so dedicated to good service! The drive thru wait is always long but worth it.

DcZQOizzHIJdAgrMJ9gCdQ.text: Great place with healthy choices made with flavorful ingredients. The three of us ordered all different breakfast entrees that we all three enjoyed. The best part of the meal was the breakfast buzz which was a protein dessert drink mixed with some coffee. Amazing!  Nice way to start our morning. Staff is super friendly!  Even the guy in the drive thru line when we went back a 2nd time the next morning.  If you need a quick, healthy breakfast, try this place.

qGiVSaCKpQGce61dyYkgMQ.text: Consistently one of my favorite go to breakfast lunch brunch places. The food is clean and yummy. Buzz shakes will get you going, be careful they are addicting. Cali club, az burro, veggie dlite are all amazing!

gFnK191FCo8XjcSptWek1w.text: I love this place.  Been here just a few times, but everything has been great.  This morning I ordered the kombucha (always good) and the low-carb breakfast.  Looking at the ingredients of the breakfast (eggs, tomato, hash browns, mixed greens) I was a little nervous, but gave it a shot and was not disappointed.  The pesto "dressing" pulled it all together.  Well played D'lish, well played.

WRVZwsFgYp9hj_X398UNwQ.text: I've eaten here for breakfast three times while visiting family. My favorite is the oatmeal - which is actually quinoa. It's not too sweet. has yummy fresh fruits and stemmed milk. Their bialy sandwiches and breakfast burritos are also very good. Fresh ingredients makes the difference. The portion sizes are generous too.

z10Mjl1toCPcXxenHkDfAg.text: What a little gem. I had this place bookmarked and it was highly recommended I try the California Club - I listened and am so glad I did! It was the best breakfast sandwich I've had in a long time! My iced latte complimented it perfectly. I only regret I was too stuffed to go crazy with the Breakfast Buzz...saw so many people coming in to order it.  My only reason for not giving this place the 4 stars it earned with its great food is due to the service. Nice people, just not the most alert. I was sitting at the counter for a good 10 mins and gave him time to attend to me when 3 different people walked in and got taken care of first. Not cool. But I'm sure they're workin' on it and anytime I'm in Scottsdale, I'll definitely be returning.

u2rXX8h6ItkwS9vse6FN4w.text: Found this place thanks to other Yelpers who said that it was a good spot to eat. It's a very small place, but the food quality was AMAZING! I got a chicken panini, my wife got a turkey club (which we shared with one another) and the kids got a chicken quesadilla. Had I known that I'd have been hitting up a non-franchize coffee house I'd have skipped the morning coffee and gotten it there. If their coffee is as good as their food, Wow! Customer service was great and everybody there had a big smile on their face. The only thing that could be a problem is parking if they're busy. Few spaces and the inside was small as well. Well worth it though!

7pT72foX-M-lZZH_2MSuHw.text: I had heard a lot about this location and boy was my experience an anticlimax. The sandwich was one I could have made with little effort. It was pleasant and light, but by no means the best sandwich I've ever had. Would not recommend highly.

x4pUzWIS8L1yMYRBbkODuw.text: This little gem of a drive thru has fantastic food and coffee. They're veggie breakfast burrito is excellent with portobello mushrooms and a red pepper tortilla, i plan on returning for lunch some time soon.

mJquPoPoFI3N_-m47o637Q.text: Wanted to give another place a try for a quick bk so jumped on Yelp. I have to say I am lukewarm about it. I had the egg and cheese bk sandwich but without the cheese +bacon on a bagel as they were out of the bread it normally  comes on and it was ok. Prob need to add some salsa or sauce to it. It was fresh tasting tho. Also decided on a decaf coffee which was on the menu board but then I was told they actually don't have a decaf that they make but could do a pour over ... i.e. an Americano. I was like ok well do I get the same price and was told no that I would be charged for an Americano. I say okkkkkk.. Prob should take the decaf house off the menu board then .. Just sayin. .. So I opted to pay the additional price for the Americano and didn't like it at all, so I dumped it.  My kiddo ordered the bk burrito and the Italian soda with vanilla which she enjoyed. I noticed that the Italian soda had one price on the board but I was charged .50 more so I brought that to the cashiers attention and she said it was tax. I said no taxes are on the bottom of the receipt and it is not .50 tax on a $2.50 item . She spoke to the mgr and he told her to refund me the .50, so that was taken care of quickly and professionally. All in all ok place for me but not one I would frequent tho.

ZxRtBaaKEQVeXfSt5yujjg.text: D'lish has very delicious food.  This place has very healthy and tasty fresh food.  In addition, they have a major plus with a drive-thru window.  It is a good thing they have that because it gets quite packed with such a small location.  I have had their salads and sandwiches, and so far everything has been exceptional.  During my last visit, I tried the Breakfast Buzz.  The Breakfast Buzz has peanut butter, protein powder, bananas, espresso coffee, and skim milk.  It was a delicious blend of yummy.

MYwPlXqKCA4wuix_08XbwQ.text: This place rocks. I wish they opened earlier since I wake up really early. Good coffee and  good food. I think it's a requirement that you are good looking to work here.

vUvhgM7VbhtA65Ijj_nDFg.text: OMG this place is off the chain.  EVERYTHING is so fresh it's insane.  High-quality local ingredients and all super knowledgeable staff definitely make this place a must-visit if you're in this area.

F4ScDtSNdYGB64cf0ohQmw.text: The California Club was excellent! I also tasted the low carb breakfast which was also very good. The staff was very friendly and the service was very fast! I will for sure get the California Club again!

bN35eiTIxnZcPqo5-kALzA.text: Stopped by on my way to work and ordered a protein breakfast smoothie, two ice teas, and their oatmeal. The ice tea is always great, and I enjoyed my smoothie - but the oatmeal... terrible! It appeared to be warm milk with some grains, apples and bananas. I thought they forgot the oatmeal! My co worker (whom I bought it for) and I were very confused. I glanced at the menu before I wrote the review and realized that no, they didn't forget it, there is no actual oatmeal in the oatmeal. They call it "oatmeal our way" and list the ingredients as quinoa, maple drizzle, fruit, granola and steamed milk. OK maybe my fault for not realizing it didn't list oatmeal as an ingredient but seriously.. Don't call it OATMEAL. For $6.00 I was very disappointed. I don't know anyone that would enjoy it. It was a 20oz cup filled with 80% milk and some fruit and the quinoa. I gave 3 stars because usually their food is good, overpriced, but good. But seriously, think about offering a disclaimer or something.

7YFSkYSHLnCkblzMujYO1Q.text: Shit, I am so bummed I didn't have the same experience as the others did here. Maybe I just showed up on an off day. My gf and I tried this place out and I was really shocked at the letdown. I ordered a bfast sandwich and it arrived cold and really didn't have much flavor. I didn't try anything other than that so maybe there are better choices that I missed. Hopefully we will be back in the area and can give it another try. Yelp has never let me down so it deserves a second chance. I will write another review after my next experience.

x2L5v4NlW7gMrgztur4XZQ.text: Food is great, I had the chicken breast Pannani and wife had the Southwestern bowl. The business is in a too small building however and if dining inside the blender noises are too loud for talking and if sitting outside there is no umbrellas from the sun. No bathrooms in premises, you have to walk to a nearby bar.   But if you are OK with that stuff, the prices are good and food fresh and tasty.

Wv3pTvbgfeCvBheqWYQlcA.text: My coworker suggested this place and I had my doubts, but it ended up loving it and going back a couple days later!! Their Southwest rice bowl is mouthwatering and the black bean chips are amazing! I will definitely come back here again and again!

h_Qi3hgvjk5f6h0FvrVdmw.text: I got the man salad which had BACON, chicken, tuna, tortilla chips, avocado, tomatoes and mixed green with a blue cheese dressing. I have been eating a bunch of fried food so I craved a salad and even though this salad isn't the healthiest of salad it definitely was satsifying. It was a pretty big salad for under $10 and I loved the wooden bowl they served it to me in. I like the concept of fast healthy food since they had a drive thru but I opted for the dining in option. I went up to the counter ordered and they gave me a number and deliver the meal to my when it was ready.  It reminded me of a small hole in the wall coffee shop with plenty of great food options. I would love to come back here and try some of the sandwiches and other types of salads.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

gCxIIH5OKXR76DkG7CVM1w.text: Great food. A bit expensive for breakfast joint. Quick kind staff. Happy I found this place when I first moved here. A must try!

fFQ8h8LSlQksWq1S8XLN5Q.text: First time here- so good! I had the "low carb bfast" and my friend had the "bfast club". Both were filling and exceeded expectations. Good job D'lite! We also tried the green lemonade- also really good. Hint of sweetness that overpowered the garlic and ginger for me (probably not the best choice if you don't have much of either.) I couldn't really taste it, even tho girl taking our order said some people don't like it bc they could. Perfect choice for a healthy sit down or on the go brunch- will definitely be back :)

Qto4fBtO6cYmX6nXbymjFQ.text: Very cool little spot. Love the concept of healthy fast food and reducing the impact on the environment. Awesome coffee. Californian club sandwich is a great way to start the day.

b7-IhUN1hs-oTpvgT-eheA.text: The signature tuna sandwich served hot is the best tuna I've ever had. The atmosphere is very relaxed, and the prices are very reasonable for such delicious food.

r1IvKJ6b_4TvK8ATG9c-tA.text: I just found this great little spot on Scottsdale Rd. called D'Lish, and that is just what it is - mmmmm. And the best part is, the food is healthy! I loved it so much I went back the very next day.  I talked to the pretty girl at the counter and I found out that they started as a coffee shop and have been adding more food items to the menu. It's owned by this really cool young couple and you instantly become a part of the family when you come inside. But if you're on the go, there is a drive-thru! Also, free WiFi internet!  I had the california club which has eggs, turkey, pesto, avocados and cream cheese (and maybe some other good stuff) on a low-carb bialy bagel. I also tried the kombucha, an interesting alternative to coffee that will really pop open those eyes for the day.  Whether you're on the go or you want a mellow atmosphere to read, talk, drink coffee, make friends, eat good food, D'Lish is your new hang out.

GbkTVobIf6Q7PQF6QjzIcQ.text: Love, love this place! They have excellent service and food AND offer Lots of gluten, dairy free and organic options!!! They were super kid friendly.  Oh and awesome music too! Yay Scottsdale!

3sW3OmCdjI2VeinaCNIMQg.text: veggie breakfast burrito and croissant sandwich were both excellent.  +1 service, +1 drive thru, +1 prices

AwQXYH4Q5eQNRGtHU_6dXg.text: Ok..sooo I've fallen in love with this really amazing place called D'lite! I had the best breakfast sandwich called California Club.. It's got eggs, bacon, basil pesto, avacado, tomatoes, pepper jack cheese and cream cheese on a bialy bagel.   Great service too! I will definitely be coming back!!

WSMaPn42HiOtcY9yDK_rUw.text: LOVVEEEEEE the food here but I almost hate coming by just for the fact that they literally have the worst customer service I have ever experienced in my entire life. Such a shame, they have so much potential.

G063zfcvIU2enckM2w8HWg.text: Great emloyees and the blended BUZZ is the BOMB love it and the breakfast croissant is delicious  The only thing i would ask to change is to make the hours go longer i don't get out of work till 6:00 so i can only get me a Buzz on the weekends but still  Gve it a try this place is wonderful

niY_QDwvb3JcrWJx0lb5dA.text: Favorite place for a fast, healthy & delicious breakfast! All the employees are super friendly, too. I get the breakfast buzz at least 4x a week!!

WvbM63lNANhgpWDFDEh2wQ.text: Cute Place, Good Music and atmosphere. Friendly Staff. The fact that theres a drive-thru with such a menu is awesome. However there are only a handful of parking spaces & places to sit. They also do not have a bathroom. Ordered a Breakfast Buzz & Iced coffee to drink. The Breakfast Buzz is AMAZING i highly recomend it. It is a blended beverage with expresso, vitamins, protien, & has a peanut butter/banana flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. California Club
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Low Carb Breakfast

XIN4njj8-m-wovYC-6Igkw.text: I wanted something quick and tasty and the yelp reviews were great so I decided to give it a shot.  I was pleased with my salad, I got the Kitchen Sink! I do recommend it!  The only reason I gave it a 3 star review, is because I feel like the portion size wasn't very satisfying (or maybe I was really hungry that day) and the parking situation there is horrible.  They have a drive thru, but I opted to go in and eat lunch inside.  When I came out, the drive thru line was long and I couldn't back out my car because of the way the parking lot and drive thru is set up.  Not ideal, especially when you're trying to get back to work from your lunch break.  So in short food is tasty, but for me personally, the parking sitch alone makes me want to not go back.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

5m6HwcRTptce8TlinLWuLg.text: Always always always great food and GREAT service!  Small space and almost always crowded (but hey, that's D'lish), they do a great job of serving you fast.  Managers make an effort to know you and take extra good care of regulars, service in general is always great... the kind of place whereupon, given a problem or delay with you order, you just really don't mind all that much.  Biggest issue: stupid customers who seem unwilling to get out of their cars and mindlessly join the drive-thru lemmings even though they're blocking traffic on Scottsdale Rd.   No, there isn't a great deal of parking, but there's enough... and going inside is usually faster.  Like everyone else... I'm partial to the Low-Cal Breakfast (holy-shmoly its yummy!), the Nut-and-Berries Salad (also yummy), hummus plate (just right), various sandwiches, and seem unable to avoid a Breakfast Buzz (ever).

sME9_FOjmamQzb_SUkV5rw.text: After a long and hot hike at camelback, you MUST stop by and get a smoothie with protein for an awesome recovery. Great service, super friendly staff and delicious food, don't forget to try the humanitarian wrap and add chicken supreme, that's another amazing concoction ... chicken feta and pesto sauce added to it ....Thanks Nathan and Leonard... you guys got a great team at D'Lite !!!!

_Vyr8qPzoWvcenlqiWNDpA.text: Coming from NYC where things are fast this place is really fast regardless how busy there drive threw is the food is always high quality and consistent  and healthy And the staff are super friendly good vibes good people if you want good fast organic healthy food this is the place to come and stay healthy

2dNJHgFlvG3oOYdVK9clXg.text: This place was delicious! They do not have public restrooms though and the dine-in is very cramped. Food and service was great, though! Definitely going back.

Bi4fZnAxouj3BZJwoWrIhw.text: Service was bad. They charge me for a for an extra meal because the lady did not listen. She wanted to get her own opinion across that I did not order correctly. I asked for two menus and  sat down. I asked her if she would take our order at the table. A simple yes or no would of been nice. But I was told.. like a child in front of my guest that not how they do it and next time I would need to go to the counter. There was no one in there.  Well I asked about one meal than order another she charge me for both and when I mention it she did not take back the meal I asked about and she did not give my money back. Another employee apologize for her treatment.  The oatmeal was water down grain of some sort and the meal that I did not order and paid for  I did not want.  End of the day if the service was better I might of given this place a second chance.

V2AZgYx1JHQ1CSQesnC1mA.text: YES. So good. I'm not sure if they tell the employees to behave the way they do ( 1/2 stoner,  1/2 flirt) but it always entertains me and service is not sacrificed. Consistently amazzziiinngg food and that breakfast buzz is spot-on #worththe600calories  PRO TIP: order the Baby Buzz. it is the same as a breakfast buzz but smaller/cheaper.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

lbwiHDcAJAvLApz_vPz9Gg.text: Concept is amazing.  Drive thru with  healthy food? Is it even possible? Yessireee! Welcome to D'lish.  The parking lot is EXTREMELY tiny but you can go through the drive thru to get fresh salads or delicious food that's not deep fried with oil and fats.  On top of that, the restaurant isn't very big either - small as well.  My friend ordered a salad - it was large, filling and had lots of goodies in there.   I ordered the hummus dish with feta on the side. I don't particularly like feta...ehhh.... Hummus was delicious and garlicky. The vegetables and pita were fresh and had a snap sound to it as I crunched into the broccoli! *Munch* Yum-O!  Great place to come if you're on the go and want something healthy and quick.   .....Free wi-fi for the win! :)

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hummus plate

p4tRXY0Lxqgo4p43t76lcw.text: I had the croissant sandwich it was amazing I can't wait to go back ! I wish I knew the girl name who took my order she was very sweet .

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

2kqlgqLz2-NxWtTH588vDg.text: This is my absolute favorite lunch spot. I have two kids and if my youngest is asleep and we are out and about I'll go through the drive-thru , grab my food & kombucha and be on my way. The staff is always super friendly! To the people complaining about the line : yes , it's long and can be annoying when people "cut in front of you" but truly there isn't anything more the staff can do. Don't get your panties in a twist. Relax!   I highly suggest the Humanitarian + veg supreme (pesto and avocado) ... As a vegetarian I love the flavor of the wrap and never find myself wanting more.

uqFQYcYnrBTYjPYH373a3A.text: Delicious!!!! I had the croissant sandwich and breakfast smoothie.  The service was great and the pricing is very economical.  It was busy but the line went fast.  I will definitely be back again!

PLE9lMPyDuHMZFG4xPIcSg.text: I wish there was a place like this in Sacramento.  So many healthy options and variety, quick, and good portions.  The cup sizes are huge so just be careful with that.  We had the California breakfast sandwich and put Sriracha on top, wow it was so good! The next time I'm in town I'll definitely be going back to try something else on the menu.  The parking lot is a little odd and small because of the drive thru but we ended up parking a could stores down and walked right in.  No line and not too long of a wait so all worked out!

7iwTQzW5Nk4MIOL3WSa9Hw.text: Even tho this place has a drive thru I can see why this place is so popular. They have many items to choose from for breakfast or lunch!  They even have protein shakes and smoothies.  I ended up trying the croissant sandwich along with a soy caramel latte.  Both were perfectly created and made my Taste buds sing.  I know a breakfast sandwich doesn't seem like a complicated item to make but this was by far the best I've ever had.  Their egg was perfectly cooked where the yolk was not overly done and wasn't too runny either.  You can either go thru the drive thru or come inside and order and sit down and have the food come to you!  It's not very spacious inside...

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Croissant sandwich
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

hNkGqy44r5TdYdFjinBoZA.text: Good food, fast service. Downside is that their parking situation sucks a lot. For driveup window orders you are often times stuck waiting in the middle of the road. They are busy AT ALL times soo no matter what time you come, or what day of the week it is, you will be waiting on the street for the drive thru window. Butttt they get things rolling pretty fast so not that bad. TURKEY CLUB AND BREAKFAST CLUB are delicious here!

90ButkSYWqVaORtYDCyVTA.text: Came to Phoenix for vacation, and we got D'lish both of the days we were in the area. Do yourself a favor and order ahead so you don't have to wait in the drive thru, then just pick it up in the store.  I got the California Club both days... absolutely phenomenal! It was so amazing I'm going to try to replicate this recipe at home... it's going to be difficult, but this was best breakfast sandwich I've ever had. My friends got other breakfast items and they raved about it as well, very good joint.

9UPj25S2pcXmdsARtg09VQ.text: It's so difficult to go elsewhere when I'm in the area for lunch.  This place is so good & flavorful, the ONLY negative is the noise. Due to the small size of inside & they do a lot of drive thru business, the blender is going constantly. Their shakes are so good so who can blame them. Everytime I visit the place is so busy, so plan ahead.  Everything so good & tastey.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Side salad with raspberry vinaigrette, so tastey!
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hot tuna sandwich with side salad &amp; pomegranate green tea.
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tuna hot..

tuB-go9HHDu2p8I9130kkg.text: I love D'Lite and usually go to the Shea location. However, today I stopped by this location and had a pretty disappointing experience. I've never parked or gone inside this location - so I was unsure how it worked. I accidentally parked in the no parking zone, which isn't really obvious if you've never been here or only used the drive thru.   While waiting for my food I was called out by (I'm assuming one of the managers) about my car. She was pretty rude while telling me I could get them in trouble and that I was causing problems, and to move my car. Luckily the friendly girls behind the counter thanked me for purchasing food and said they would bring it out to me if I pulled around. I feel like they sensed her aggressiveness.   Just not how you treat people taking time out to come inside your restaurant. She could have been polite, explained the situation or said thank you! I obviously had no intention of parking in the wrong spot. Not a very welcoming experience :(

AGVhH8XQE62W8CsDHWm4mg.text: One of good places to have breakfast. They have drive-thru service and outdoor tables.  I had California club without bacon and turkey. It was good i liked the avocado very much. It will not fill you so if you are good on having half-fill stomach so you can eat your lunch, or just order more stuff and get full!  I had a hot chocolate but it was very light so i asked them to add more chocolate, instead, they gave me a new one and it was better.  I didn't like the fact that the music was very noisy.  Fast service, friendly staff.

Y0O-iDslrEAub1BerbDeww.text: This location is a quick stop for a bite to eat. If you go inside, it's really small with around 8 tables that seat 2 and a couple of counters for singletons with additional seating outside. Don't let the tight quarters fool you- there's plenty of food options.  It makes me think of modern hippie style.  They offer breakfast or lunch varieties. There's even a kid menu. I love the options of food that are all fairly healthy (when you're comparing to chicken and waffles). I ordered the AZ Burro which was SO good that I'm craving it while I write this review. Typically I'd only eat half of it, but it was so good that I ate the entire thing. That's a great way to gain weight! I left feeling fuller than should be allowed.  Definitely a place to return to.  Just be prepared for their parking lot whether you're going through drive thru or dining in. It's awkward and really small.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The AZ Burro. Almost forgot my picture!!

CnxrTNaRwbK27XMsg32How.text: It does not surprise me that the California Club is their signature. It's just the best!  I crave this sandwich. Toasted warm bread and the best ingredients all in one sandwich: eggs, bacon, smoked turkey, pesto, avocado, pepper jack, and cream cheese. But I skip the cream cheese. $8 of goodness. Yum yum yum!  I've also tried the croissant sandwich: egg, bacon, tomato, and pesto! Also crave-worthy! $6  The Humanitarian: hummus, quinoa, broccoli, tomato, cucumber, pepperoncini wrapped in a healthy sun-dried tomato tortilla. $7 of healthy deliciousness   I've enjoyed their D'breakfast buzz and protein shakes on the go!   I meant to try more items on the menu, but unfortunately I've been stuck on the California Club one too many times!   So I guess I'll try my best to try something new next time.   The drawbacks: they only open until 4pm at this location and the drive through gets busy. Parking here is difficult. Can't wait till this place expands!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The famous
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The California Club
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Humanitarian

L16hs0ZwmBc084RIJgoRAA.text: Other than the overall customer service suckin, the food is great! The sandwiches and protein shakes are amazingly amazing. The location blows, how I've never been rear ended by one of the yahoos doin 60 up scottsdale road is beyond me but, if you can avoid being killed waiting in the street for the usually present line to crawl along, the food will be worth the wait. This place would be perfect if the public facing help was as fantastic as the food... oh well, can't have it all I suppose.

QMzqtGRBV2vWYNTNiO9dAQ.text: I ordered the "Breakfast Hero To-Go" from the catering menu for an early morning business meeting. The general manager, Matt Harris, was super helpful via email beforehand (providing me pricing for different options etc).   I arrived about 10 minutes early, so the food portion of my order wasn't ready yet, but the girl at the counter was so helpful and sweet - she even helped carry the beverages to my car! (I didn't catch her name and the receipt only says "Host: Counter 6*45/7".)  Everything I needed was included - cups, lids, stirrers, straws, napkins, sugar, which made setting up super easy for me!   My only negative comment would be that the gallon of pomegranate green tea was served in a lemonade jug, so I had to make a label for it so our meeting attendees knew what was in the container.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast Hero To-Go Catering Order

cMKN9DjObXvkV_hL933-Bw.text: Huge fan! Probably my favorite quick breakfast spot. The AZ Burro is super delicious and what I love about D'Lite is  everything always tastes so fresh. I'm also a huge fan of the House burger. It's the perfect combo of black beans and quinoa with mushrooms.

4y9gB6bl1BuW2Ycb1RQ5Mg.text: As someone who's allergic to everything which makes every other fast food option impossible, I L O V E this place!! They have high-quality, healthy ingredients. Gluten free wraps are available. Everything is well priced. My suggestions: AZ burro, humanitarian wrap add chicken, Buzz protein shake, or the chicken pesto panini. Driving Tip: try to come N on Scottsdale Rd so you can turn right into the store, this place is so busy if you're trying to turn left into it you'll probably have to wait a while.

4zXnaUTtER-Kc1cY78f9YQ.text: This place is one of the few fast options that I still consider "real food". It's so hard to find good food that you feel good about eating that I always take notice and try to keep places like this in mind when asking myself that daunting question "where do I wanna eat...?"  This is the first time I ever tried their quinoa oatmeal and it was awesome. I also had their breakfast buzz shake which was also outstanding. The people that work there are great too. I was short 1.50 and the dude said "don't worry about it. I won't mark down the almond milk."  Great to see a company who's priority is feeding you good food and fast. Shows others that it can be done and there's just no excuses for bad food!  Thanks guys!

64td-S7-JUWQOTcFAAlUTw.text: This is a cool little place with super friendly staff. The inside is quite small and loud because they are constantly running the blender to make smoothies, so if you're looking for a quiet breakfast/lunch spot this definitely isn't it. They had a huge line for their drive-thru, so that seems to be the preferred method. The food was fresh and delicious! Beware, not everything is quite as healthy as they'd have you believe. I was considering the vegan buzz shake until I saw it contains a staggering 47.86 grams of sugar! I would definitely come back again for breakfast or lunch, but would get it to go since the inside is so noisy.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Veggie d&#39;Lite wrap

gt9HQRYEGCYeO3HRsGmuUg.text: Super yummy but healthy options for those on the go who don't want to eat fatty food. This is my go to when I don't have time to stop at home and eat. Personally really like the hummus wrap which I add chicken to at times :) However, all the options are good. Great customer service as well :)

uXR0-p21IxfIu1VD0g0Cjw.text: I love the food, yes it's a long wait but it's worth it. I usually get a breakfast burrito or the low carb breakfast. I really love the food here and come here very often and have been for years so I'm very familiar with the portion sizes and what's accustom. I've noticed the portion sizes are going down but the prices aren't which is annoying. It's hard for me to justify coming here as often as I do when they are giving me less food for more money. I also wish they would post the calories for the food and drinks. When I specifically asked they couldn't give me them.

8yWzePhSseVPPFV6a_nejw.text: My husband and I tried this place for the first time this morning and boy we were not disappointed. We live down the street but haven't been able to try it due to the line being out of the parking line and down the street!  We both got the breakfast burrito (that comes with salsa), and pretty much loved it. I didn't have as many potatoes in mine as my husband did but the main thing that caught my attention was the seasoning - or lack of. We both thought the burrito was close to bland but was great with the salsa. I had asked for sour cream but they said they didn't carry it, which is fine.   I got the mocha latte as well, which is just chocolate syrup added to the latte but was pretty good. Can see why this place is so popular, healthy and affordable. After looking at the menu, there are so many great choices!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

zannxwS7svliRo6RiyoNSQ.text: BEAT DANG SHAKE IN TOWN. (Bfast Buzz) Confession: It's been a min since I've been here due to moving and the accessibility of this location. But the wait is always worth it. I've been cheating on D'Lite with other shakes and I'm so sorry I did. Can I say I was thinkin of D'Lite when I did it?

12eY_BhEexuoELqbyRaeVg.text: Very disappointing. My boyfriend and I were exciting to try this place after driving by it many times. However upon turing into the place, I almost ran into a No Parking sign that was in the middle of the drive-thru. We had to wait a long time for our two burritos which were cold when we opened them. One had a hair baked into the egg. The eggs were very mediocre with no flavor to them. They have "healthy" in their name, but the potatoes were crispy, almost burnt hash browns. We do not recommend this place if you are looking for anything with flavor, and definitely not if you are looking for something healthy. Healthy doesn't have to mean tasteless.

a_OKK2a6cLf7NJ1D8EQ2nA.text: Fast service!  Very helpful staff!  They brought me a paper menu because I did not know what I wanted.  I ordered the California club with turkey sausage instead of bacon.  It was amazing!  Loved it!  I also had a latte that I did not care for.  Overall though this was a good experience.  I would highly recommend the California club.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Latte
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Menu

loSXq6YMYOlCVB_CFWI07g.text: I usually have the best experience going to D'Lite but when I had visited this location I wasn't the happiest.. I had ordered two of my favorite sandwiches, and both weren't packaged burnt black. I wish the person making would've thought to themselves about how gross or unprofessional it is, to just package up a completely burnt breakfast sandwich, and just made a new one. My boyfriend and I continued to eat it because we truly had been looking forward to this meal.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Burnt Sandwich

VOGttVIg6G1ssWGBm52uYg.text: I love this place, and I don't live on this side of town or close to one so when I'm close I like to stop by. I didn't have much time so I went through the drive thru and usually they are fast about getting people by. Not today! I was waiting in a line of cars and got skipped three times! I let the first car go, then the second and third I had to get out of line at this point I had no more time to wait. Be fair to your customers waiting their turn.

gdqe6h5VMgFmBj3gM1oTBw.text: Mmmm very good morning brunch time meal. The line backs up onto the street for this place in the morning and now I know why!   Everything is so fresh tasting and great quality food items.  The restaurant has a small seating area both indoors and outside. We enjoyed the outside patio seating despite idling car exhaust and street noise.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. California breakfast over Kale
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast sandwich in a croissant

zqNML--hJJcOiZMMGxO-OQ.text: Always D'lish just like the name describes. I have only had a select few items on the menu but everyone of them is in my tops list, and I'm a huge fan of the breakfast buzz! Another great aspect of D'lish is their customer service, sure a little unusual and kinda give off that Cali surfer vibe but they're always working super hard. The last time I went the dude at the window saw the line backed up ran all the way outside a couple times making sure the line wasn't taking forever because this place gets packed during breakfast and lunch. The fact that they work that hard to keep the line moving is awesome.

wATuvmKogaWPJHcVVvx2Uw.text: Holy cow. I'm a first timer here and I'm converted for LIFE!!  I got the "oatmeal our way" (organic quinoa, vanilla macaroon granola, seasonal fruit and choice of steamed milk). It was an enormous bowl of delicious and only $4.50!!!!!  The owner was the cashier and was so nice and friendly!!!!  LONG LIVE D'LISH!!!!!

Z6ZunlwNXBCiO9kmt4UJQg.text: Great place that takes quick service and gives it a nice healthy twist. It can be very difficult to find a healthy meal and quick service. This place has a great menu especially if you consider yourself somewhat health conscious. My only complaint is that I wish they had more locations!

xbRT3UOVMKcZOl_DMu7Lkg.text: This is the perfect lunch fix. The strawberry salad is light and filling at the same time. The menu is local and it has a different small town feel than the other packed restaurant chains around.

MW0V-JSi4IBFBz5wBRSkbg.text: have I truly never reviewed D'lish???  5 stars for the Orange Glorious. this was my fave thing to drink when I was pregnant. I would drive here, get an OG to go and then go get my nails done. love it.  Everything here is pretty amazing - the food has always been great. This last time I had one of the paninis and it really hit the spot. But again, I waaaas starving from tending to a crying baby... ;)  The only drawbacks are 1)the parking situation sucks 2) the drive thru CAN take a bit of time depending on when you go, but it's all made fresh so... eh. 3) getting into and out of their lot can also be a hassle. But otherwise, it's all good.

Q2ZmtfimMNSDWuWOH-LWJA.text: It's been 7 months since I made the move from PHX to NYC and I still think about D'lish.  It's a small joint and sometimes takes awhile if the line is long, but the awesome service & delicious food are well worth the wait.  Get addicted like me and order these:  - The California Club - The Man Salad (sub blue cheese dressing w/ balsamic vinaigrette) - The Breakfast Buzz (w/ almond milk) -- this is the only coffee/espresso related drink I've ever been able to enjoy.  I've never been a fan of coffee or anything that tastes like the stuff, but this drink defies all odds.  It's like drinking a Reese's Peanut Butter Cup.  Whenever I make it back to the desert... D'lish, you're my first stop.

F69bxCmVY8aQQWFHeue6Uw.text: You know, it's really a nice thing to have an option for a fast, but relatively healthy breakfast.  The restaurant itself is basically a drive thru type place with a slight coffee house vibe on the inside.  They weren't slammed but were pretty steady, and were able to move customers through quickly.  I had the veggie burrito, which was pretty good and cheesy, and was served with a very tasty, very mild salsa which gave it some flavor it otherwise would have been lacking.  Tanya had the veggie frittata, which was also quite good and was served on toast, which was a little more than lightly buttered, but that's okay.  Broccoli for breakfast ain't really my bag, but she seemed to be okay with it.  The place seems priced about right, and it's nice to finish breakfast out and not feel like a big fat whale.  For that alone, this place would get my recommendation, but they manage to make healthyish food taste pretty good, too.

2LGBOZv49pHKCVmq_C4T6A.text: Nice little place for lunch or breakfast. But no restrooms? Really?  How are you supposed to wash your hands?

mYgCbTIxOJMk2zfplNG2xQ.text: I have been to Dlish quite a few times but always waited in the drive thru which is this place's only downfall, my wife and I actually parked and ate out on the patio today. %100 better, the food was on point! Had the az burro enchilada style. Golf clap for the food, thumbs down for the size of the place. They lose a lot of buisness over people driving up and seeing the line out to scottsdale rd.

u4URpGXtdkuiXEz-EycCsg.text: Dlish always does it right. From the wraps to the salads you can not go wrong with anything on this menu!! Plus the drive through is clutch when you want a quick dinner but are not feeling Mcdonalds. We will be back soon!

_6ysMEf_LXVGePBsExemAg.text: Wanted to try the famous Breakfast Buzz drink. I did not like the fact that it was already prepared ahead of time. That might have caused some stomach issues. I paid and one second later there it was. I don't care if your busy, make my drink fresh or don't make it it all. Plus at about 6 bucks, I think they are taking advantage of consumers cause of the popularity of the beverage.

VMlAjOpw9HF1jd7vYCdvWA.text: I'm a very picky eater but everything here looked amazing. I ordered the California Club and it was great! Once I was done I wanted to immediately go back. Thank god for self control :)

gKgF9Q54eOU0MZyBYo56Zw.text: I really like this place.  The concept is great, its cheap(ish) and healthy.  But I've gotten a hair in my food two times.  I really liked the food here, so when I got a hair in my bagel one time I totally almost vomited, couldn't finish eating, but still I went back because the food was good.  The second time when I got it in my sandwich, I pretty much decided NEVER AGAIN.  Either they did not like me or their kitchen is really unclean or they all need to wear hairnets and beard nets since it is hipster mecca.

wBKbDRJvFXwZh0BOzfT40g.text: Best breakfast in the phoenix area. I wish they had more locations. The low-carb breakfast is like a miracle. You can see for yourself in the pictures that the food is amazing. I wish I lived closer to it

2v9IbbxmuLBn2nUKsATX5Q.text: Had lunch today at D'lish with my boyfriend. We ordered the tuna sandwich and the early bird burger (which is not a burger, but a patty made with quinoa) and went halfsies on them, which is easy to do because they come cut in half already. To drink I got the kombucha, which I believe is GTs Original, and my boyfriend got the lemonade. Overall, our experience was excellent. The tuna sandwich was fresh and well flavored. The early bird was also good, but for me it was a little bit too spicy (and I love spicy), though my boyfriend who loves-loves spicy thought it was excellent. The ingredients tasted fresh and the food was reasonably priced for the quality and portions. The service was excellent and the staff very helpful. Our food came out quickly and so we were able to enjoy a healthy, delicious lunch in less than 30 minutes.

VlQQf0LJ75DqTEFwyszo2A.text: I ate here for the first time the other day. I was a bit nervous that it'd be busy because it was a Sunday morning but there were still spots in their baby parking lot. Their drive thru is poorly placed for other drivers trying to park but their ordering system makes the line go pretty quickly. My friend and I ate on the patio. They was plenty of seating outside but little seating inside. The food and drinks were great! I had a breakfast croissant sandwich and an orange glorious smoothie.   All in all the restaurant is appropriately named. The food and drinks are indeed d'lish.

U3nFVkuI73ovNUATi4WkJA.text: Obsessed with this place. Breakfast buzz is a perfect post workout meal and any of their wraps are guaranteed to cure a hang over.

eX1sL0uiVG_4Ch9iagMNNA.text: I've only been here once, as I just moved to Scottsdale, but the low carb breakfast was delicious. I'll definitely be back to try more. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because I haven't tried most of their food. Definitely casual.

46u5Dc-FFjHTz8F12vilhA.text: Dear D'lish.  I love your food, but your BLENDER makes way too much NOISE!!!!!! I guess I will only do to go from now on.

BCNGdUKLQZRRKHR0fD2mAQ.text: very small quaint nice location.  A little bit of a hippie / granola feel there, that is not a negative thing by the way.  Food is amazingly fast for the quality and rather inexpensive too.  The real question... will I come back to get more food or drink there... yes, I think I will.  I'm may try their drive thru next time...  They even made a special drink for me and charge me the normal .    only pitfall, but it's a pretty big pitfall, is it seems that most of the employees are not paying attention to the customers, rather just going back and forth talking to each other.

cK0zQyB5xNGNZFhYZQriGw.text: The breakfast buzz is a great option to start your day, but it is the only thing I have ever ordered so I don't know how accurate my rating would be for the overall menu. The other stuff looks delicious though but parking is a pain in the butt.

ZUSizOWK-_XtreIYbhCDfg.text: So i've been here now 2x and It is for lack of better words Delish!  One of my colleagues told me about this place after bringing back a couple Man Salads for lunch a few times.  I am always looking to try new places and lunch of course is a constant challenge that we are faced with every day...especially whilst working Full-time.  Being in Downtown Scottsdale, you can't not try a new place a minimum  of once a week.  ANYWAYS, I'm a breakfast guy and after a morning work out I felt like trying out their Breakfast Buzz and AZ Burrito.  BOTH were just delightful.  The drive thru has been packed the 2x i've been there and now I know why.  The Breakfast Buzz is just a great protein shake w/ espresso that really gives you the jolt for the day that you need in the office.  The AZ Burrito also was just on point w/ that smoked turkey and egg white.  Neither were overly filling and I was just set for the day.  Usually I get the office some Starbucks to start the Friday off right, but this week there were requests for breakfast buzzes instead.    Quick, D'lish and healthy.  Can't really beat that.  Definitely one of my go-to's for breakfast/lunch.    Cheers

WSg8JypnVtxGxVAgmBvavw.text: I tried this place to try to eat healthy. Nothing to rave about. I guess my expectations are higher cuz the name pretty much says a lot but wasn't impressed with the sandwich and juice...it's ok.

Pp33cvkIoWGvRgo__4k4Xg.text: It really is delish! You can't go wrong with any option! Highly recommend! I love that breakfast is served all day. The line and the parking lot can be a bit frustrating at times, but that's just an indicator of a busy time and a great place to dine.

BRGXpQeor8YBT4N7Tw-ahg.text: The other location in Tempe has waaaay better service. If you go to this one, try to stay away from the brunette with the nosering, especially.  The food is good and some would say the food is great, but inside is simple and loud due to coffee machines. Driving through is better.  It's easier to take the food to go but don't go here during lunch. The traffic is so backed up, it's not even safe sometimes. I once sat in the median on Scottsdale Rd for 10 min just waiting to turn into their lot. If you come from the South, cars get backed up in the right lane and actually stop in the road. In a larger town, the cops would be here demanding these guys stop blocking traffic and get out of the median.  I highly encourage you to try the food, however. The other location in Tempe is certainly worth the drive to get there.

A8hzWIYD9LhC3WDR2RO3Yw.text: I love this spot for a quick, healthy drive-thru lunch! They offer a great menu full of healthy dishes. My favorite is the Veggie D'Light wrap. the sauce is so tasty and I love all of the veggies. Great staff, too - they're always friendly and fun.  I haven't tried their breakfast, but want to. Great local spot!

GBgcV6vYzZSG6XXF1KvTnQ.text: I REALLY wanted to love this place...but it did not go well.  I never noticed this restaurant although it is right next door to my favorite burrito spot (Super Burrito).  When I arrived they were plenty of people pulling into the drive thru.  Since I couldn't figure out what to order, I went inside.  The staff was cordial.  I decided to keep it simple and ordered a traditional burrito.  I was so excited!  I got home and bit into it and "crunch"!  I tried again..more crunch!  Broken egg shells in my burrito!   Needless to say I lost my appetite.  I called to let them know I was bringing the burrito back and no I didn't want anything else (they offered).  Although they were very apologetic, I'm just not sure I can bring myself back to trying something else.  D'lish was a D'isappointment :(  Maybe I'll give the new Tempe location a try *sigh*.

_kivzopZ9qd9E_njHLi5hg.text: Absolutely amazing California Club and AZ burro (couldn't decide which was better!) We will definitely be back when we are in the area.

WtvdPPyqWkDMOpsLPb0xbQ.text: I used to go here a lot for lunch when I worked in Old Town, if the line wasn't super long. The sandwiches are healthy, all the while keeping it really tasty. Everything I have tried has not disappointed and the coffee is so good. Turkey club was my usual lunch order.

Z42S8GLD8HvKjJJSLuM4lw.text: If someone asked me my deepest desire while I was sleeping, there's a 94% chance that I'd mumble "The House-Style Veggie Burger with grilled onions instead of feta, please".  It's been about a month since I had the pleasure of ravaging this for lunch, but it hasn't left my mind. Even though D'lish was out of buns, the toasted sourdough bread they put it on was good enough for me to consider asking for that instead from now on.  First off, it's only $8.50 for a meal that will keep me full for at least 6 hours after. The burger itself (a mix of quinoa, black beans, and some other nommy things) is massive. It's the kind of burger that squishes out of the side of the bread when you bite into it. Awesome. It's topped with all kinds of fresh veggies, and then the bread is slathered with cucumber sauce on one side and pesto on the other. It's unreasonably good. Sound like a lot? It is. It might be 1,000 calories... but you know what? It's 1,000 calories of really freakin' delicious stuff.

t3QU8d81JG5ADplsk4CEYw.text: Two words, Almond Buzz! I could live off these things. I discovered them a few months back and am there almost every morning feeding the monkey. They look out for their customers with a punch card so every 10 you get a free one. Good looks on that! Parking lot can be nightmare but you gotta pay to play. All in all give it a go, you'll be hooked.

2P7669J6iH8MUh3mGwvRQw.text: It's Saturday morning at 9am... I have been a fan of D*lish since they opened doors and the owner operated it. Well, it's been a while since I have visited because I have a three year old, so drive-thru's are always the better option for me to grab a drink and a bite to eat. We are always baffled that people will sit in the drive thru line which sometimes starts on Scottsdale road.  Today, I had time to wait as I needed to put my makeup on anyways. I look at the time so I could anticipate s possible future trip and what do you know, i had my breakfast sandwich and large green tea in hand in 6 minutes. I love it and am so proud that the local place can beat McDonald's across the street in a timed busy drive-thru race. The Cali breakfast sandwich was better than I remembered. I will never be afraid of their long drive-thru line again.

mP-V4b1SYhWITqT4m4hqTg.text: I was looking for a "sit down" restaurant for breakfast. While they were friendly, the food comes wrapped in plastic as it is obviously geared to the massive beasts idling next to the patio. With it being 115 degrees,  it's too much for a quiet and peaceful breakfast. To drink hot coffee from a paper lined in plastic cup with car exhaust idling next to your face in the "too lazy to get out of my car" drive through window que.

byFHtTGI_GbcMZNHjJuMVw.text: The BREAKFAST BUZZ!!!!!! OMG!!!!!!!!!  I wish that I could have one of these everyday!  It is a patent-pending protein drink with espresso, chocolate, protein powder, banana, peanut butter, milk, vitamins and I think that is it! My friend introduced this to me and I do not even like coffee, but this drink is F'in Fantastic!  I love the vibe here...everything is fresh here!  I also tried their hummus plate with chicken and it was like the best hummus I had ever had!  It has some fresh veggies with it and a flat bread.  The Berries and Nuts salad is awesome too!!  The inside is cute! They have a drive thru if you are in a huge hurry!

24PI_W1Wsx7AJrQsmcXKXA.text: They're breakfast sandwich is amazing. They also have really great tea.  I love this place!

NhSjQm-BzHaNIsYrxov4wQ.text: Not quite sure why they have a drive through when they can't operate it properly. I waited 15 minutes after ordering for a breakfast buzz.  I was the first car followed by a long line of people who also ordered beverages only. They all managed to leave before I did. There was no reasoning as to why I had to wait so long for the same beverage numerous vehicles had ordered after me.

GP8sda-lw-9DFEpYMZr3kg.text: Food is super tasty. Always. So tasty.  Coffee is slightly above par, with lots of options.  Service is molasses slow. For a drive thru, don't bother unless you have at least ten or fifteen minutes to spare.

h3rfFBjQduEOh9jELckoFw.text: I love this place! D'lish is conveniently on my way to work and I love the staff there. I tried this place for the first time about a week ago and there was a pretty solid line through the drive thru. I was extremely impressed with the friendliness and efficiency of the people who work there.   They have an extensive menu and I am sure many people (like myself) order food as well as a beverage when they go through the drive thru. For their location this can cause a bit of a squeeze as the line starts to get longer and longer and as does the wait time. But fear not!! A lovely D'lish employee walks outside, takes your order and payment, and BAM. Next thing you know, you have your delicious coffee and you are on your way! Don't fear the line. Seriously, you'll be taken care of.  As far as food goes, I've only tried the egg and cheese sandwich and it was a delicious breakfast indeed. Next adventure? the oatmeal. Enjoy my friends, and get your D'lish ON.

abDERY6CrosaQs0nGPpUig.text: I just picked up lunch for my coworkers and they cant stop raving about how good the food was!  Everyone is already talking about going back.  I had the "man" salad and it was amazing.  Packed with good protein and gluten free, not to mention so fresh and tasty!  I'll have plenty of energy for a good workout after work and no stomachache from lactose or gluten.  Plus, the employees were friendly and upbeat in spite of the lunch rush.  Yes, the drive thru line was a little long, but completely worth it.  Great job, D'lish!  I'm so happy to find a fast, healthy local restaurant.

s0orjgZCwIpdRaZWZ_n01A.text: I met Brian S at D'Lish for coffee and conversation.  D'oes that constitute a coffee klatch?  I D'on't know if it D'oes but we sat around for probably a couple hours enjoying the fresh outside air.  As fresh as it is on Scottsdale Rd. anyway.  I had a mocha when I arrived and later a brewed coffee.  Both were, well, D'lish.  So I can vouch for the mocha and the brewed coffee but not the D'caf.  I was wearing my "Corporate Crime-Capitalized Profits, Socialized Debt" t-shirt and the guy at the counter called out the other employees to make sure they saw it.    I will D'efinitely keep D'lish in mind and stop in when I'm in south Scottsdale.

9YuWoU4x39Kw4neYbqeA4w.text: This is my boyfriend and i's favorite breakfast spot in Scottsdale! Every time we are even remotely near Arizona we make the trip to this place! It's all about the breakfast buzz and the California club sandwich. We will continue to come to this place as long as we live!

D4PROtEzlImdxPoZ3C1qZA.text: My wife and I came across D'lish on Yelp and with all the great reviews went for breakfast.  WOW!  First of all, small place and not one you would necessarily notice driving by.  It's in a small building, like an old fast food restaurant, complete with a drive thru.  We knew we would be OK when the drive thru line was backed up 5 cars deep into the street.  That kind of traffic means that somethings going way right here.  My wife had the the club sandwich and I had the low carb breakfast.  Both of us were blown away with how good everything was.  The menu has a lot of interesting items.  Ones we are going to try now and replicate at home.  If you are looking for an overpriced and fancy place, this is not the place for you.  If you want honest, excellent food and attention to the quality and makeup of the food, then don't miss D'lish.

xz87H-GetELe1-hmzRS6_A.text: I've been here for breakfast and the oatmeal is yum. Today I'm doing lunch. Man salad, sure to be satisfied as usual.

DDE1aqX91e0esRgUUpJBhw.text: Holy cow this place is good! We came in to eat as it was our first time, but it has a drive-thru.  The servers were great and it seemed like such a fun atmosphere and they were enjoying their time, which made us feel really comfortable.  The food was really healthy and I enjoyed my wrap.

YxkScW6kaDnHUWzmQXDFjQ.text: It doesn't get five stars because the parking and drive thru situation is atrocious. The food however is d'lish (see what I did there). I usually get the breakfast sandwich and a nice tea. For lunch the southwest chicken bowl is SO good. The employees are always  smiling and on point despite how busy it gets!

gxpzzjHPGNE9OT7v-6-wZg.text: Probably time to update this review.. I've been here quite a few times since last rating and they have definately improved.  As always, the food at D'lish is wonderful. Great combination of salads, unique and healthy sandwiches, a bonus of tasty protein shakes. The atmosphere is still good as well-kind of trendy, but good mix of students and locals. The parking and drive thru are still cramped (nothing they can do there), but they've improved the drive thru speed by taking orders carside during busy times. Which leads me to the biggest update... happily, the real change and improvement comes from their service. I remember a time when service here was slow and painful. No more. The new crew is pleasant, helpful and competent. Hallelujah.

jlZaX5llmMK9fxKfnMdj-w.text: D'lish doesn't need another review, but I love it so much that I couldn't resist.    If I can help you out with anything, the key is to drench their sandwiches/wraps/flat breads in their chipotle aioli - game changer.  Makes their super delicious food even better.    While it's 'fast food,' be prepared to wait as everything is made to order.  Totally worth it, and you will be occupied by reading the rest of the menu items, plotting your next order a week later.

os6bFDyprP6dEQ5Yj1kCDQ.text: One word : Deeeeeelicious! I have tried every single place around here for lunch and I curse myself for not having tried the food here before. The place is small and does not ideally make the cut for a date but if you are seriously scourging for lip smacking food, D'lish will leave you content and smiling. I had the veggie d'lite wrap and for 6 bucks, it was gold! The drive-through can become a little busy during lunch time but the staff is prompt and gets the food out on time. I'll probably head there again soon for a bigger bite.

edBVLPyYGK31sBG2c6LiKw.text: First and foremost the food here is great. Love everything about it.   The problem appears to be the workers. About a week ago I stopped in to get a coffee after dropping my wife at work. I was told it would be $1 and some change. I signed my receipt that said $1 and change and went home. Later in the day i'm paying bills and see the charge from D'lish as $6.56 on my bank history. All i got was a coffee. So the cashier at the drive through clearly screwed up. Everyone makes mistakes so I'm not to bothered by this.   However, A week later i go back for some burritos and breakfast buzz. Everything seems hunky dory. Fast forward to the next day and I'm at work when i receive a call from someone who says they were in line behind me the day before at D'lish and they have my debit card. I look in my wallet and lo and behold I was given someone elses debit card when at delish the previous day.  Now i can forgive an overcharge. It's easy to fat finger a cash register but to give away my debit card to someone else is completely unacceptable. Part of the blame could certainly be on me for not checking but if you're operating a business I'm trusting you do things right. The fact that you messed up twice within 2 weeks is almost unforgivable. Still not sure i'll ever go back. If I do I'll definitely be bringing cash

RZQs6e_Kz3foAVbUlHqPOw.text: The only way I would eat at this place again is if my front door was less than 60 feet away from their entrance.... and I was a quadriplegic confined to a wheel chair for the rest of my life. Seeing that there are no residences that close and I can walk, I can confidently say I will never give this place a nickel again.  I walk in to blaring reggae music, which is fine, whatever...but of course I have some douchebag in front of me with his girlfriend slowly dancing to the reggae music for a full 90 seconds while they are deciding what to order, if you want to groove to the music for 5...maybe 10 seconds, fine...but I'm hungover as fuck dude, quit dancing and order your gay salad with raspberry vinagarette and granola all over it. if I had any wish in the world at that very second I would have not wished for a million dollars or world peace, I would have wished for a hammer to instantly appear in my hand so I could hit him in the side of the knee as hard as possible so he would stop dancing and scream so loud that I wouldn't have to listen to the loud reggae music anymore either.  I order an egg and cheese sandwich with bacon and an orange juice.  Orange juice arrives at my table first. It was basically sunny delight orange juice. This establishment has the hippy tree hugger organic feel to it and you idiots can't make fresh squeezed orange juice? The sandwich comes a full 8-10 minutes after I order it. It was small had a small egg not that much bacon at all, whatever on the cheese, and sourdough bread. This all cost me 10 bucks. Place is a fucking rip-off. If you had brought me my simple order in less than 24 seconds (not 10 minutes) and had fresh squeezed orange juice (not 3 bucks for sunny delight). Then ok charge me 10 bucks and I'll be moderately happy, and would maybe return to eat there if I was 2 mins away from dying of starvation and happened to be driving by.  Then some guy walks in who I guess was the assistant coach of the ASU basketball team or something and one of the tree hugging hippy waaay too exuberant employees starts yelling "clap everyone its so and so from wherever...." and then made some joke like "go UofA" or something to mock him sarcastically. Shut up you dumb shit, I'm trying to consume your shitty 10 dollar egg sandwich in peace. Go smoke a bong in the back of the restaurant like you probably usually do anyway, or go stand in front of your restaurant with a sign saying you want it legalized so I can run you over on my way out. Then I leave and I'm walking to my car and reggae dancing douchebag from earlier is feeding his girlfriend from his fork on the outside patio. Ugh. Everything about this place made my head want to explode.  And all you people who give this place 5 stars should be immediately transferred to the island of molokai like they did with all the people who had leprosy decades ago. Except the new colony will be for morons.

erivKAvd5WXdkCMe6-K-Sw.text: I love their breakfast burritos!! I have tried a few different ones and they are all good. Worth the extra wait.

Xknat5Uz-xtZGVC2RYIazg.text: Best place ever! I am very happy to know that there is a drive thru that is healthy and fresh. I just drove up with my dog in the back seat, and everyone wanted to give her a treat. Very kind and friendly people; I am seriously going to come here all the time!  Eye candy tehehhehheheheee

dL4fTaBFjsHLz54NVmA4ng.text: Get the breakfast buzz shake!! Great for any chocolate lover. They also cook a fried egg perfect every time!

jOCQTPeTiOXoaZR6K9ZCpg.text: Great local sourced food, with creative twists.  Plenty of healthy and vegan options, and don't forget to try the Breakfast Buzz

wGlcumgZ4siY20qUJHkvyA.text: Everything I've had from here is so delicious and fresh tasting, and the drive thru is a big plus. The bialys are amazing, especially in the breakfast club. Turkey club is also 10/10. All the staff is super friendly. I had my dog in the car and they were all so excited to see her and give her a treat. Great experience overall and would highly recommend. The parking lot can be a little cramped and annoying, but that's not really their fault.

zfVQxcyOAZXcUBs8Wu_XMA.text: I went to D'lish for the first time just an hour ago, and here I am reviewing it already!  To begin with, I rolled up to the drive thru with my dog in my lap, making a fuss, and the woman at the window could not have been any nicer! She gave Danny (my Pom/Schipperke mix) a treat, which he happily gobbled up.  Next, I ordered the Breakfast Buzz. Took 2 minutes for the drink, and the gentleman who gave me my drink was very friendly!  Finally, my drink- OMG it is SO GOOD! I'm hooked. Chocolate, peanut butter and bananas, what is not to like? I can't wait to try their food!   Friendly service and good food make this place a must!

yIF1UfdQApGNkYn6zftsWg.text: Baby breakfast buzz. That's pretty much my usual order at this point. You will recognize it is a lot of regulars at this point that know the menu and will wait in the line. It is worth it because the food is healthier and catered towards people on the go that don't want fast food..and the menu is also very vegetarian/vegan friendly. I enjoy Dlish and mostly everybody in Scottsdale knows about this place by now and if you don't then you're missing out. Five stars for friendly service and tasty meals.

54zUoMmtNNY0cWPn661Ngg.text: After our last visit being disappointing, the owner contacted me and offered to make things right. Another example of why I feel this place is so great! (Besides their delish food!!)

lDh4KwOFTVUZi-5vr6JXhw.text: Two words: Breakfast. Buzz. That's all you need to know. Super friendly staff. Line may look long at times but it goes quickly.

fm3IeABVBcswkoadG2tWpw.text: I can't stop craving the breakfast buzz- A yummy smoothie like espresso drink with banana and chocolate.

dCnrVtTIdEW5UdzqpnGYeg.text: Amazing food. Great Orange Julius! Don't have a restroom though. When they put one in, they will go to 5 stars.
