DIaYa3h1BPjlelKiA4oDwg.text: This place is very unique and healthy! Their wraps are amazing and the blended "buzz" is very addicting. The only downside is the parking situation. I hate having to pull into this place because I feel like im either holding up traffic or about to get hit. A better idea - park at the Albertsons parking lot and WALK over. It'll be worth the few extra steps :)

yC9SNrPSlBljc2MyG56i-A.text: Solid food. Friendly staff which is a plus. Most frequent visitors know that parking is a major struggle as well as the drive thru line. I live near by and often there is a line flowing out into Scottsdale Rd.

4H8lRPr3F2K0IrWrc-q4zw.text: Holy cow, the food here is amazing!  Just a small quick eat place with super fresh and healthy food. They have very a very creative menu with options for just about everyone's diet, including vegi, vegan, and gluten free.  Very friendly service, from people that seem to love working there.  I recommend the cali club the ingredients sound strange, but trust me, it works. Check out the photo that someone has posted of it.  Highly recommended, its a must do in Scottsdale.

9uUPOHLTQmkZSviBRwd4ug.text: Great concept with the drive thru healthy, alt food. Had the oatmeal - it was very tasty. Good coffee but went a little cream happy. Didn't try the shake but prob should have. Point deducted for no bathroom if you eat there, otherwise very solid little breakfast/lunch stopover.

uEYBYdDf6dfRwd68G-qxCA.text: It was the afternoon so I said why not try a non breakfast sandwich, so i took a chance on the "chicken panini" (added avocado because as you know which you all should avocado is a gift from the gods) AND IT BLEW MY BRAINS!  I ate it so quick I couldn't take a picture or I would upload its deliciousness to it can stimulate your eyes as it did my stomach.  This place never disappoint's, EVER!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. California club, perhaps the most perfect sandwich of all time

kRncyUq8L0bPzgqSYKlISA.text: TASTY. Had a frittata, freakin' BOMB. And cheap! That's my stahl (style).  Had some crazy chocolate/coffee drink that was off the hook!

EwH4eIF-qYEtScAFSzVUjg.text: This place is phenomenal! The food is so fresh and tasty the guys that work there are truly very nice which is harder and harder to find these days.   I would definitely recommend this place to every.

hsSZxsv94dSsG0LcFwx7xA.text: Cute little spot! They offer a drive thru and sit down, inside or outside. If one of these existed where I live, I would be there every morning. Try the California club, it's AMAZING!

n3pm2AQPKO1VE6gXMuhPig.text: Over rated. Way too expensive, location SUCKS, and the employees nickel and dime you for every thing extra dressing, salsa or sweetener everything is gonna cost you. A salad runs about $10 with tax and then add all the extras. Too many other great options in the area to be nickel and dimed over condiments.

KxaBxUINpGEnJowUfCegCw.text: This is one of my favorite Scottsdale stops for breakfast. The drive thru makes it super convenient and the food is always good. My personal favorites are the croissant sandwich and the az burro. Their coffees are also delish!

L995YFy4hOgiLIUZW6xMGQ.text: I guess I wasn't as blown away by D'Lish as everyone else.  Maybe I was expecting greatness from reading so many five star reviews on Yelp, but my experience was somewhat underwhelming.  I had the low carb breakfast, husband had the AZ burrito.  Low carb breakfast had a very good flavor, but way too many oils.  Oily salad dressing, drizzled with an oil-heavy pesto, two eggs cooked in oil, and then an avocado for even more fats.  The flavor was very good, but I just felt like it was a pretty heavy dish for what it should have been.  My husband liked his burrito though!  We also split the breakfast buzz shake.  Our bill was $19.50, slightly over priced in my opinion.   It is small inside, so seating might be an issue if you go during peak hours.  Also, their smoothies and shakes seem to be popular, so the blender is literally always raging... Makes conversation too difficult.  There is absolutely no denying that parking here is a nightmare.  The parking lot is too small to begin with, and then the drive thru line always blocks people in their spot.

5MugneE_Njw_0ni6J84E9g.text: My boss picks up Burritos and Fruit smoothies from this place quite often. The food is always good but not mind blowing. I see this as being a great quick stop breakfast. Worth the stop in if you don't have time to make breakfast. I will be returning on my own accord for burritos for hiking and such in the future.

hhPthE8kxuzlbjwp7mOh4Q.text: I don't know of another drive-thru shop that offers everything you could want (and need) for breakfast. The low-carb breakfast always helps me start off my day right. And the shakes and smoothies are bomb. The staff have always been really cool and friendly too. Must be a fun place to work.

HYIwBhdBssCHuZKAbW6bfQ.text: This is a very unique place in my mind. Def hipster and casual dining. Great stop after a workout. It combines heathy eats with a "fast food" concept. I love that I can make healthy eating choices on the go by using their drive-thru! I will say that their drive through is typically slammed to the point where no one can pull in to wait in line or park to go inside. Parking is also very limited and poorly designated so much so that there have been many times I have parked to run in to get food and when I came back out I've had to wait 5-10minutes just to get out of the parking lot. Obviously, the food here is AMAZING and well priced otherwise I would never waste my time going here but I had to give it only 3 stars because it can be VERY time consuming depending on when you choose to go. They have very limited seating both inside and outside. They are known for their "Breakfast Buzz" which is a protein shake and happens to be what I order every time I visit. They also offer a "Vegan" option when making this shake that is also D'lish! They have a good selections of healthy food options, the service is quick once you have placed your order and the staff is SUPER friendly and deserve an A+!    If you are looking for a healthy menu and you are NOT in a rush then this is the place for you!

S6rkNGTUkUCoJP0eMjWZ4g.text: Friendly staff but sandwiches are kind of small. I ordered the breakfast club. It looked and tasted like I'd expect any bacon, turkey, tomato, etc sandwich to taste.  Nothing special to write home about. Is it sacrilegious or anti-foodie to say I might actually prefer McD's breakfast sandwiches?

dyOMGUu722VuuJgxjX5I8A.text: The breakfast buzz is amazing!! Espresso  peanut butter protein smoothie. Everyone ive shared this item with has become addicted.

qAQpwDMw1i2Vor8pZaKoTQ.text: There's simply nothing else out there like this place. Healthy fast food that tastes amazing and has friendly service to go along with it. If you try to eat clean and live a healthy life, you've found your food mecca here.

xoz_3s5t5jUDfDaMUtXGsA.text: One of my favorite breakfast spots. The staff is always friendly, there's never a long wait, and the food is awesome. I usually get the Cali club and a breakfast buzz. Definitely try these two items your first time in.

3KcysnuAk2tHZe-Vo7mF9w.text: Can't say enough gold things about D'lish. I've been dozens of times and have yet to have an unpleasant interaction with a single employee; the service is as quick as it can be (considering the relatively small place gets packed with customers) and everyone is friendly. The food is also amazing; a breakfast buzz a day keeps the doctor away! Errr something...

zPVoljMk03BYhg02yHRGeA.text: I went to this small restaurant after my camel back hike.  The food is light, tasty, and cheap!  Easy go to spot for a smoothie, healthy wrap or salad.  I highly recommend this place if you want something that taste good and is healthy.  The drive through is a bit ridiculous, while I was sitting down I saw a few fights break out because of the long line that extends out to the street.  But it's not the restaurant's fault.

p6tbKb4xo9nbyPXUJif7Pg.text: Really disappointed in how healthy D'Lite claims to be. I asked for the four berry smoothie without the banana and I came to find out the the rest of the smoothie is just a juice puree with ice. ...how is that a smoothie? Or healthy? The puree content is full of sugar. It makes me question the rest of their drinks and how much of those are just purees as well.

lhJ9wIfdAMRqdCNWJ_yeSg.text: A group of us came here for breakfast and really enjoyed D'lish.  We ordered their drip coffee and some bagels and found everything tasty.  The coffee was strong and HOT! If water boils at 212F, then D'lish serves it at 210F LOL  What was great about it?  It wasn't over roasted and burnt like the Green Mermaid.  Actually the three of us enjoyed our conversation waiting for it to cool.  The bagels were another surprise.  Given the small space of D'lish's building, I would love to find out where the get them.  My suspicion would be NY Bagel on Scottsdale Road, up near Shea Blvd.  But no matter, they were very good and hit the spot.  We'll be back for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. I guess people really do love them on Yelp. They have a certificate and everything.

B-FcQri742HBnMNpyijvIw.text: Love the Scottsdale D'lite!  Service has really  picked up and the building looks fabulous!  Big shout out to Delaney (sorry if i mispelled) of the morning crew!  Remembers me every time I call and always a joy to see in the morning.  She has a great spirit and attitude.  Keep up the good work Delaney and the Scottsdale morning crew!

0G08N-W5RslL65OhjtMBwg.text: Wanted to try something new so gave this place a shot. I ordered a the California Club and for myself it did not seem worth what I paid (over $7). It was very bland in my opinion that I should have just made my own breakfast sandwich at home or went to McDonald's instead. My friend ordered some type of protein drink and he really seemed to enjoy it. The girl who took our order seemed bored, but I was bored eating the sandwich so I get it.   I do like the concept of this place but I would prefer a Salad and Go to open near me. The drive through was also a pain in the but because there is small, limited space for a drive through. We ended up parking and going inside because the drive thru line was so small we would have been pushed out onto the street if we waited in line.

ou0fvGP5WMy_yTi9sjuEVA.text: Had postmates deliver to me this weekend and my egg sandwich was inedible. It was completely burnt and I added chicken sausage to the sandwich, which I had thought they forgot to add because I only got 3 pieces total on the sandwich!  My breakfast buzz was great as usual but I'm pretty disappointed that I couldn't eat my sandwich. Posted a picture just so they could see this inedible sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Not happy at all...

5DPwM5sNTKEwO_BihRZnng.text: I loved my California club for 7.95! Eggs, bacon, turkey, tomato, avocado and pepper jack cheese on toasted artisan bread. The perfect warmth of the bread and flavorful taste of the pesto puts other club sandwiches to shame. Definitely enjoyed every bite of this sandwich  My fiance got the breakfast club ($6.00). Nothing special about this sandwich...it tasted rather bland or maybe the sundried tomato bread overpowered the items inside the sandwich (turkey, tomato, eggs, bacon, etc).   Also got a caramel iced coffee. Very very good. Not too sweet, not too strong   Obvious that this is a very popular spot. The drive-thru line was sticking out into the street. While we dined inside (very small), many patrons came in to pick up their orders. Guess that's the norm there... I'd come back and repeat my order if ever I'm back in Scottsdale (California Club and Caramel Iced Coffee)

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. California Club

iB0jBai1Et35QUuw4oT0zw.text: You can't go wrong with D'lish.    Lines can be outrageously long but it is worth it every time.  The inside is a bit tight but very doable.    Everything on the menu will leave you satisfied.   There is nothing like a breakfast buzz after a solid work out!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast buzz. Only way to go....

dyUKhlT5g-U8MfjueDTj2w.text: I was looking for a healthy to go order. I enjoyed the burrito as it was light and tasty. I did not enjoy the drive-thru aspect and the spot is so small, wasn't sure where the parking lot was. Probably just a drive-thru spot, I'm not sure. The girl working there was nice but I just couldn't justify the price of their items. I'm not a cheap guest but I just didn't find the value in the meals. It was a good meal but nothing memorable and I would not return nor refer.

gtljOmCBOIreSxWU3BsGlA.text: I went to the location on Shea (I was unable to find the location on yelp)  The service was fantastic, the employees (not just one but all) were helpful, informative and kind.  Any questions or menu modifications were gladly answered and accepted.      We had a sample of the "morning buzz" it was amazing and my husband ordered one for him self. I had the California club and beet salad both satisfying and delicious.   On my way out the door an employees noticed I was leaving with my iced tea half full they offered to refill my iced tea which I gladly accepted.    Give this place a try I'm sure you'll be glad you did.

yDlKMG_ugYW_szIPPdfBdw.text: Busy little place.  Stopped in at around 10:30 AM and found a table near the window.  Be prepared for a noisy atmosphere.  They play music while you dine, but it has to compete with kitchen noise and patron conversations.  I would recommend sitting outside.  Decided to order the egg and cheese sandwich, with their chicken sausage and a Glorious Orange smoothie.  Total price was almost $12.00.  The price for their smoothies is pretty standard: $5.00 for a large.  However, $6.00 for a sausage, egg and cheese breakfast sandwich is a little steep.  Not to mention the fact that I paid $1.50 for a few slices of sausage.  I'm not sure how they justify that cost.  The sausage added a nice flavor to an otherwise bland egg and cheese sandwich.  I also recommend spicing it up with some of their hot sauce.    They chose to use "bialy" bread for their breakfast sandwiches, which is an excellent decision.  The bread is soft and spongy, with a texture similar to a bagel.  All in all, the food wasn't too bad.  For me, the price is the main concern.  I don't want to fork out almost $7.00 for a simple breakfast sandwich.  With so many breakfast joints to choose from, I can't say that I will be back anytime soon.  Nice guys, though.  You should definitely visit at least once and say 'hello.'

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Egg, cheese, and sausage breakfast sandwich.
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Glorious Orange Smoothie
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Interior

VjmYQ9ZDB-6rosHDKFKYtg.text: I was super excited to go this morning because it didn't have the big line it normally does, which im ok with. So I pull up to the window to order and was there for a good 5 minutes just waiting for someone to come take my order. I could see them in there just talking and they looked over at me a few times and never came to the window. So annoyed and hungry.

8iw3gZe4fomxnDQnEoJNEQ.text: Lord have mercy, their black bean & quinoa burger (made early bird style) is my JAM. I appreciate the drive-thru for a small restaurant like this (even though it usually takes about 10-15 minutes to get through during lunch). I don't know how many calories might be in this thing because it's got plenty of spicy mayo and cheese but... I JUST DON'T CARE. So good!

ihR75Fp-5CpXioHsDZbwaQ.text: Wow is all I can explain on my lunch experience. My cup of soup felt empty when I took it out of the bag, it wasn't even half full. Additionally, they forgot my pita chips that come with the  soup. The guy looked too baked to be working and  I had to ask for my juice or I would  have  not gotten that either.  I tried to call in 8 times to rectify the situation and explain the overall experience and nobody answered.  I love the food quality and  premise behind the business, but outliers such as this tarnish the name. Each week it seems to get worse.  I usually come a few days a week when I don't  have time to prep my meal. I don't want them to lose my business, but this is too much for an easy order.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Half soup full price!

F_g9Utxj13Pv4WalnH2RZw.text: Seriously thebomb.com. I get the chicken panini with the side of broccoli, and each time it come out super delicious! The staff is friendly and bring out your food in a timely manner. The drive through option is super convenient!! Love this place

m3iGrUN6b0llQevJE2HDUg.text: Their hash browns aren't deep fried after all :D Wooohoooo !

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Low carb breakfast. It was so delicious I ate it in about 2.5 seconds :P p.s. hash brown is NOT deep fried !

FvQf2vhHs07DWJr3aBBqvw.text: The Breakfast Buzz is an excellent example of good milkshake engineering.   First off, there's just one size. That means only one method of preparation. It's nice not to regret ordering a size too big or too small. The cup is transparent so you can gage your consumption and not find out you're running low when the straw starts making that horrible inconsistent slurping sound. You have a good view of what's in there, you're not left in the dark blindly, dredging the bottom trying to pick up any last remnants.  The straw is big and strong enough to handle the shake and doesn't bend flat in your mouth under pressure like it would at Sonic or McD's. The Shake has the right consistency so you don't drink it too fast. On the other hand, it isn't so dense that your face goes turquoise and your eyes vacuum back into your head.   There are no cumbersome doodads like choc chips, ice or cookie that could obstruct the entrance to the straw preventing the flow of shake.   Lastly, the menu says it has vitamins,  proteins and fruits so you feel like you're making a healthy choice. As long as I BELIEVE it's good for me, I'll be ok right guys...?  I can understand why D'lish is voted so high. California Club is a nice sandwich and service is pleasant, but the milkshake, oh yeah, the milkshake is really quite good.

10IuQAFOKaFKv8wFodE31Q.text: My favorites are the angry bird black bean burger, he chicken pesto panini, and a large kombucha! So many yummy healthy options.

jO8h4caHbXcESiV3pjy3Cg.text: I believe that this restaurant is very overrated.  If you try going on the weekends the line of cars is out into Scottsdale Road, but I'm not sure exactly why.    The food is alright, nothing too special.  The prices are decent.  They do offer a lot of vegetarian options, which may be pulling in a lot of customers.  My biggest complaint is the service, which is truly horrible every time I go.  All the employees seem to be high school or college kids who absolutely HATE their jobs.  I am not exaggerating when I say that you will get significantly better customer service at the McDonald's across the street.  They have screwed up my order the last 2 times I went through the drive through.  I had to park two stores down and walk back, when I explained the mistake they tried blaming me for it-  I don't know how I could be more clear than saying "A Traditional Burrito with sausage, please"?!    I don't mean to rant, I apologize.  It's just exceptionally poor customer service and the food is average at best.

vbQd1Mz_FFo6GvU8yLq6SQ.text: This place rocks!!!  First what I'm so impressed with is their menu and healthy options. I love the variety of choices you can get.  I got their Breakfast club because its one of their most popular items.   It was good not as great as the other reviews say. The reason why I say that is because I feel it has the making of a great sandwich but they layer it wrong. You have bread, pesto, cream cheese, tomato, smoked turkey and bacon. Because the only texture you get Is the bacon if they put that on top of the cream cheese it would enhance your chewing experience.   Still tasty just mushy.  Hubby-Breakfast burrito with sausage and bacon and he loved it!!!! He came back two days in a row for it.  Next time I want to try the coffee and salads.  Great place

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Side view
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Line
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Drive thru

fyjT6kuCoEvEIWs2Xp2b5A.text: This is my coffee joint!  When I wake up in the mornings I either have a thrift mentality where I drink my god-awful office coffee, or a "I don't care that I'm completely going broke" mentality where I head to D'lish.  I would say that I fall into the latter category most days of the week.  Everyone on the staff totally rocks.  I usually hate my entire life and everything in it at 7:00 when I roll through there, but I always drive away with excellent coffee in hand and as much of a smile as possible on my face.  The prices are totally reasonable, and although I'd be irritated about the fact that they have UoP propaganda all over their cups, I find myself wanting to support them and have whoever started this wonderful business to make millions and millions of dollars.  Like some fellow reviewers I would definitely recommend the Chicken Pesto Sandwich.  I generally stick with regular coffee in the morning, but every espresso drink I've had has been phenomenal as well.  Thank you D'lish for making M-F tolerable!

LjHjQSU70dtMDnSN8KGdwA.text: Best thing about this little hole in the wall place is the food.  Those of you driving on Scottsdale Road would most likely miss the location of this restaurant if you're not looking carefully.  So keep an eye out!  My favs are the frittatas and salads.  Yummy and definitely tastes healthy for you.  Plus, the staff are very friendly.  The bonus:  free doggie treats for your canine companion.  Only thing....it's loud in the restaurant area because of all the blenders and barista sounds.  It's kind of challenging to carry on a conversation.  I recommend the outdoor patio seating when the weather's cool.    And...the drive through is not really a typical drive through experience.  Expect to wait approximately 10 minutes for your order while you're waiting in your vehicle (because of course, they are making your meal from scratch).  It may be faster to just park and order take out inside the restaurant.

4kQJ5X_huWrBF3BnUCbNRw.text: I am a foodie from the San Francisco Bay Area, and I encourage D'Lish to open a cafe there. The food truly is fresh, flavorful, prepared and presented with care. The only thing that detracts is the extremely loud noise that overwhelms the eight table inside dining area, every time a smoothie is made. I worry for the hearing health of the employees who must tolerate this throughout the day. So 5 stars for delicious and healthy  food, and 5 Bells for uncharacteristically rude noise.

Nkx9-qgwhxNvWFwAqhuIGQ.text: Great little hidden gem I discovered. Many healthy options that wont break your wallet. Also love that you can get your food fast without having to be waited on. Excellent spot to stop by for lunch. Love the Man Salad and any of the breakfast egg creations are awesome. Nice atmosphere, free Wifi so i can get my work done. Go check them out asap!

aExpQ5Gxu6KorZspatiB7g.text: Yes, I will pile on.  Hipster inspired decor and attitude and delicious and unique breakfast.  We shared the "our way oatmeal) which is made with quinoa/fresh fruit and we opted for the almond milk.  My GF got the breakfast club and I tried the AZ burrito (which I pronounced the AS-burrito, or the A-Z burrito).  Both were fresh and had such interesting ingredient combinations that made things so tasty.  I'm not sure why anyone would go to some big chain place when the food is fairly priced and so delicious here.  Wished I had this place locally.

XSWY3kbMejDD4wAH6SCslA.text: Get the AZ Burro and the Breakfast Buzz. Not a cheap breakfast at $12 + tax, but it's so good and it'll leave you full for hours. Love the hash brown patty inside the burrito!

4mDZLsJiUjZUSY3ROM3Qng.text: This food stop has gotten it right!  The food, customer service, atmosphere-everything!  I had the California club with avacado and split a daily buzz protein shake with my date.  Absolutely fantastic!  The guys working there were really friendly as well.  My only complaint:  the parking.  There simply isn't any room.  Had the parking been a little better, a 5 star rating would've been given.

G1MJZRJ0rAebHaSETgba3Q.text: They have cheap small plastic cups for water. I requested a bigger cup for water and the response was that we have to charge you. That is okay for fast food but not okay for my $9 lunch.

T-c2tY8ckc-Yeckx0VwFaQ.text: Their food is great - i've had the veggie frittata and the house style veggie burger, both are pretty amazing. Especially the burger. I'm not vegetarian, but i love a good veggie burger as something healthy & different, and theirs is quite possibly one the best in town. Including the ones i've had from full blown sit-down restaurants. Too many places just slide a veggie puck out of a box and throw it on a bun. Not these guys. Also, their coffee and iced tea are pretty dang tasty.  Only problem I ever have here is the wait. Definitely a place you have to be patient at.  Maybe it's better if you actually go through the drive-thru - I always just walk inside. Also, for $8.50,  was a little surprised that the burgers don't come with any sort of side item. Not a deal breaker, just something to keep in mind. And I'd probably come here more often if they had hours that extended into the evening.

m19nnIwdAk5-MSN6fLhp_A.text: Very yummy food, friendly staff, quick service, good coffee...great spot for breakfast!

c8lvIGREbQcg6gSpTvIhdw.text: great taste. dishes are a little smaller than what I am used to.

dr_3wFMOaVmJmvQQVOg4hA.text: I just had my first -- and certainly not last -- meal from D'lish!  My food was packed with flavor and delicous fresh ingredients.  The service was super friendly and fast, too.  I can't wait to try more from their yummy-looking menu!

NxueqCU5kDgrtY3EIBFVtQ.text: Everytime I pull up to D'Lish I seriously have cartoon hearts popping out of my chest.  I have loved every single thing I've eaten here. Breakfast go to is a Frittata - perfectly done. Split a hummus if you're grabbing lunch with friends. My new favorite dish is the Southwest Bowl - Basmati Rice and Enchilada Sauce together as one? Yes, Please! The staff here is phenomenal..always feel welcome! I prefer to call ahead and you're in and out in a flash.

cD_MYQzsJhVGvuvT_8tGjw.text: I love this place. If I could I would swing by every morning, but when I DO have time and want something SUPER yum-O, I get my tosh over here.   The drive thru is awesome (its so nice to have an alternative to Sbux!) The staff has always been super friendly, the food is YUM! And you have tons of options (which I love!)  I have only been inside once and the place is pretty cute. The blender is a little loud, so its not the ideal place to be if you need to work etc.. but still its adorable.  I usually get the breakfast club, no bacon on a sesame seed bagel and a large coffee, its so good....in fact, Im heading over there right now to get my fix :)   See you there my darlings !

TlnBpv5dn64jJfNdOFtaZw.text: I've never had something from D'lish that I didn't like. The chicken panini and breakfast club are two of my favorites. Dirty chai vanilla latte rocks my socks. The only bad thing I could say about this place is sometimes the wait kind of sucks, but for the delicious food and drinks it's worth it!

h9xZIkHuJ1yGO8xhLXvBTg.text: YUM! This place is a little gem I stumbled upon not too long ago. Their name says it all. I could say more, but there's no need. If you're near by, check it out. If not, it's worth the drive.

5jC0ur9ZGbiJF8ztbtJ70A.text: Bless me Yelp for I have dined. It's been many months since my last review. It's actually been awhile since I've had much opportunity to check out new (to me) places. It has been a rough year.   Things are turning around though, and I'm D'lighted to get my review'n skills back in shape.   I'm surprised I hadn't eaten here before. I guess I didn't even really know it existed to be honest. I live within a few blocks of here and I love breakfast and I drive by here frequently. Perhaps it is because I'm not a member of the vegetarian/vegan community... though I've dated several vegetarians and vegans so I'm pretty up to date on the places to go for that.   I haven't had my food at this place yet - I've only eaten from the drive through. It seems like a cute little place though. One of these days.   The food is tasty. It's about as tasty as it can be for something that can be considered a healthy breakfast. I tend to prefer a good thick greasy unhealthy artery clogging pile of bacon and some sort of fruit covered waffle or french toast drowned in maple syrup - that doesn't seem to be what this place is about. Still... it's True to its name. It is definitely delicious.   Their prices aren't too bad for what you are getting. It's quality food. I mean, I was getting burned out on shitty fast food breakfast places. I can't stomach the Breakfast Club douchetastic crowd most of the time, and I haven't been really up for eating around any sort of crowd on my weekend mornings. I'd rather eat in the comfort of my own home these days.   I'll have to update this when I have more to say about it - so far, I've only really sampled the food. I have yet to really experience the atmosphere and the service. Sooner or later though...  I'd say this is yet another reason why I still stand behind my belief that Scottsdale is an awesome place to live.

LbeJEyZnFiZ44H1omJTJ7g.text: Favorite place!! everything is awesome! There green tea and breakfast buzz are the best.

roNKGJU8fn-vegQ_g3wOIw.text: Does it get any friendlier than this?  (Must be the sunshine and glorious temps in the winter- everyone in Scottsdale seems happy- and this placed topped out the smile & hospitality meter.)  Love the Buzz.  How can you go wrong with peanut butter, espresso, chocolate, and banana whipped up into a breakfast smoothie?  Fair-trade locally-roasted beans?  Kudos.   Ate in one morning with friends- cozy little indoor & outdoor spaces.  Had the low-carb breakfast- a pesto-ed fried egg salad and it was excellent.  So good I had to go back the next morning before flying home.  Tried the drive thru and grabbed a breakfast burrito (add some sausage & avocado for a cali-flair).  Perfect.  This healthy fast food movement needs to make its way West..  Come to San Francisco, D'Lish!

wsYq-XQx7wajWDuyxvcKJg.text: Food was healthy and tasty but a bit overpriced and akward to wait if you order to-go.  They have absolutely no waiting area or chairs so I was standing in the middle of two rows of tightly packed tables trying not to be in the way.  And they told me 10 min wait over the phone but I'm pretty sure I waited at least 30 mins.  :(

4zTvh3wQRXJDUHPRw2690Q.text: D'Lite is hands down my favorite brekky joint!! Everyone that works there is so down to earth and   friendly. The price point is pretty average but the food is sooo fresh and delicious. I love all their sandwiches and their "breakfast buzz" shake is to die for. I will remain a loyal customer of this place :)

26zP3-R-W3j8CerjBPV7GQ.text: Absolutely love this place! I've lost count of how many dozens of times I've eaten here in the last few years.   My go-tos are the nuts & berries salad, the humanitarian wrap, and the mushroom bisque. Love their egg sandwich on a bialy, too. And I really love that I can get breakfast anytime.   Healthy and d'lish.

QZnql4pq-dc7xC_MxuxqDA.text: Healthiest drive through option ever. They actually cook! I am at the Scottsdale location at least once a week. As a creature of habit, I generally only order the same thing....the seasonal turkey sandwich called "the gobbler" with this amazing cranberry goat cheese spread. Not sure what I will do when they change the menu.   They have assorted iced teas as well: green, black, and cactus pear or cactus blossom. These are excellent when mixed with black tea. The last time I went thru, I noticed they had a "doggie bag" option, which is chicken and wild rice. That's an awesome option for anyone who takes their pet anywhere.  Additionally, this place is small.... But if the drive through is backed up, the guy that works the first window will come out with spare menus and take your order on the spot. I don't think I have ever waited more than 5 min for food.

buvHdnbFQ6DE90dIp8fDGA.text: Love this place.  Been going there a couple years.  The food is great,  the green tea is some of the best!   Staff is attentive and gets to know the regulars!   The only Complaint is the parking, or lack there of.   Great having a place like this in the neighborhood! !

5pLIwz2BkAb5vBRDWhUzkA.text: Went here with family from out of town. They both had dietary needs that this place satisfied very well. I love that it has the drive thru option too. Only wish I lived closer so that I might eat there more frequently. Very cute and cozy atmosphere as well, but be warned the smoothie machine indoors can get loud.

svwsMgRjQ2Hdlkp1a_lCeA.text: This is one of my usual breakfast places but they lose the 5th star because twice they've forgotten about my pickup order and left it sitting on the counter while I wait for them to call it out. The food is great and the service is otherwise pretty good. My girlfriend loves the Breakfast Buzz smoothie and I like any of their sandwiches that involve turkey.  A tip for diners, do not go through the drive-thru. You will get your food indoors so much faster. I can never understand why people wait in a line seven cars long instead of parking and walking inside directly to the counter. I definitely recommend this place!

cSvu45V-6fHt0v1Xmyz8LA.text: The food here is amazing, the California club and AZ burro are popular and for good reason. I came on a weekday morning so it's not as busy as on the weekends. The building is very small and primarily a drive thru ordering system with about a dozen seats inside and another dozen outside. Not sure that I would wait in a line for 20 minutes for a burrito or sandwich but overall the food is excellent, healthy, and there's a good variety of hot and cold beverages.

cQFP7oEJffYw4tRzTORJyw.text: This place is awesome!  I eat here probably 3 times a week. It's pretty healthy.  They also cater to many people's dietary constraints ie vegan, veg etc.  It's delicious and the staff is very warm and welcoming.   I literally bring all my friends here.   Oh, and they're dog friendly!!

9NXs2Zt7sX5yRUDCw5izIA.text: This place is awesome - one of my favorite spots to stop for lunch if I'm in the area. It's a really cute, casual lunch spot. The California Club is my favorite (I'm an avocado nut), they also have a fantastic breakfast burrito. Everything I've had here is healthy, clean, and well prepared. It's nice that they have almond milk for lattes and they can definitely cater to people with food allergies or restrictions.   The only downside is parking can be a total nightmare - there is a very small parking lot and if you go during peak lunch hours - really anytime between 11:30 and 1:30 - it can be impossible to get a spot, or even pull into the lot. They also have a drive through, but it can take quite a while.   As long as you're not in a rush, it's worth the wait!

jYiNzn9klVNbF7P7Fg22Qg.text: This place has great customer service and awesome sandwiches and coffee is mm! I've gone a few times before work. Haven't been for lunch but many of the breakfast items I've tried are very good.  I always go inside because the drive thru line is insane always going onto the street. Usually 7 cars at a time. Only complaint is wish it had a larger parking lot. the place is so small and cozy inside. Only other issue is if you eat there. Be sure to have headphones. The smoothie / drink maker they're using 24/7 for the drive thru peeps is VeRY loud. Can't hear what the person across the table is saying.   Otherwise a great quick bite!

HQszBeeGZt9KWu1OocCFAQ.text: This is a very small location. Parking is a challenge. The drive thru is packed! The nuts n berries salad was perfect. It was very fresh and tasty. The goat cheese, walnuts, and berries were a perfect compliment to each other. The veggie delite wrap was very flavorful and filling. The inside is small and very noisy but they have a patio as well. Very healthy and quick spot for lunch

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Nuts n berries salad

AcRZM5YB_RHN55v839919A.text: Speedy efficient and friendly service, average food. Had the California club and thought it was nothing special. Lemonade was great and tasted freshly squeezed...Overall average

jJKY4I-EJjnNC15Tz9ApiQ.text: I have a hard time finding anything wrong with this place.   Dog Friendly? Yes.  Customer Friendly? Absolutely.  Delicious food? You bet your ass.   A little on the pricey side for a drive through(nothing too terrible, but probably around $8 without a drink is a good marker), and the hours could be better.  Chicken Pesto Panini is delicious. Comes on white( or wheat if you ask) with mushrooms and tomatoes. This is my go to dish at d'lish. It's like sex. Sometimes they screw something up, but no worries, it's all good. You are still eating a delicious sandwich.(having sex.)  Also try the humanitarian wrap. Its good. Not a fan of the "burgers", but the cali club is a delicious breakfast treat, and so is the recently stumbled upon frittata( chicken sausage n stuff frittata on a hashbrown, on  a piece of wheat toast with chipotle sauce drizzled on top.)

wSCRIvwmZh4gsEEhvm5G8Q.text: Shoutout to my boy Chris B. for telling me about this spot. He was right - this place is terrific.   I've only been once so far, but am already conniving a plan to return! I went with a friend and shared food so I got to try 2 things. Traditional Burrito + bacon, and Breakfast Club on wheat. I truly enjoyed both. Hit the spot without over-doing it and making me feel groggy.   To wash it down I had a dirty iced chai - one of the best I've ever had. I recommend it. Next time I'll listen to Chris and get the "Buzz" which is "patent pending" and per C.B. "one of the best inventions of the 21st century"... I know what you're thinking, and I was afraid too. Hence why I went with the chai. Next time - I'm buzzin'!!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Nuts n&#39; Berries salads + 2 Breakfast Buzz drinks = D&#39;Lish

u0Kstoa84ipwBV8j5zgO1A.text: Food was very good and seemed relatively healthy. Inside was very small and loud but the staff was friendly. I got the southwest rice bowl and loved it. The price wasn't bad for what you get. They do a very good drive-thru so the parking lot is kind of busy.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Southwest rice bowl

Dr9UCcE_L8BE0oXLykC9iA.text: I really like their sandwiches (my favorite is the california club).  Can be quite busy in the morning and the drive-thru gets really crowded (we can't even access to the parking behind sometimes), but i guess that's a good sign, right?  Other than that, I would definitely recommend for those who like a healthy sandwich in the morning.

A-54SZA9NmNNIxtj3bZECA.text: Spoiler:  Go! But not the through the drive through.   What a great find after last night's culinary fiasco. Food is fresh, fast and delicious. Even their salsa was great tasting! Coffee was smooth and delicious as well. The crew was super busy, but all very friendly and helpful.   We sat outside and ate and were surprised that we didn't witness any car accidents. The drive through traffic is insanely busy and until you can get in the lot your car will be hanging out straddling the bike and right lane. The staff seems to do a super job of taking orders and delivering orders car side however.

1KocugpFfEDowEuNmvXO6Q.text: Would really like to try this place but waiting in the drive thru for 15 minutes is a joke.

0mzAzfziLodLWlIBGGZYzw.text: I've waited along time to check this place out. The green lemonade smoothie was the best I've had! The issue with this location is the poor customer service.  I may or may not go back again purely due to the service. Every employee I encountered was rude, didn't even thank the customer.  They all need a lesson in customer service. Hope the management monitoring YELP notes this review.

T7AShEUB21bwzhZfzjdA9g.text: So yeah, no time for a decent breakfast but want something good than the average McDonald's? Something perhaps healthier? Well, you have found your place here at D'Lish.    Granted it was my 1st time, so will have to go back for more.  Had the California Club, it was really good.  Did drive through and they had a guy walking out there taking and expediting orders, which was really great, and he was cracking jokes which made waiting just a bit a little more pleasurable.

-V1QrJ0qMZgEkdaku6RGpw.text: Food was ok, but nuked to crazy hot temps. Props for the non-disposable plates if you eat there. Minus for the parking lot that's impossible to get out of if there's a line in the drive-thru.

NTlWITrBLUH4niP9NK9muw.text: Let me tell you a secret- AZ Burro. This is the epitome of the PERFECT hungover breakfast spot in restaurant history. When I lived in Scottsdale this was literally my favorite spot ever to go for breakfast. My only complaint about here is that they don't serve alcohol, but let's be real nobody is perfect. "AZ Burro" needs to be in the vocabulary of every person that likes to party in Scottsdale. Why? 1. It's pretty much the healthiest breakfast you can get without actually making it yourself 2. It's perfectly filling after a long night out at smashboxx/hefe/etc that ended with a late night at pattie's 3. It doesn't make you full to the point where you can't hit up RnR after to go day party and get started with some bottomless bloodys mimosas 4. (and most importantly) D'lish is drive thru! Making it ridiculously catered to the hungover person. Don't want to see everyone you blacked out in front of last night or run into last night's hookup? No problem. Just make sure that you are sober enough to drive (aka no alc for you Arizona peeps) and drive on through that drive thru people! I know, I know- it just sounds too good to be True but I promise I'm not making it up, this place really does exist. Also the Breakfast Buzz is really filling but I would honestly recommend it as a meal in itself or like a snack or something because I don't know if you would be able to handle it with a meal unless you're really trying to get down then in that case go big or go home. And at the end of the drive thru if you find that all this is just wayyy too healthy or you're over it, then Super Burrito is conveniently located next door. Don't worry, they have a drive thru too so you can still avoid seeing anyone :)

aOt_jx8UyOn8zSmRe44WrA.text: Love this place, I got the breakfast club, and my wife got the turkey club and butternut squash soup. Everything was so fresh and tasty. We will come here again when in the area! Also the coffee was fantastic, no need for cream or sugar.

OZvyK0DTkuvtVre6ApwB7g.text: D'lish is great, we all know this. However, I think it's about time they got a bigger/more accessible location. They are always so packed which is obviously good but sometimes the drive thru line is just ridiculous, especially when people are sitting with half of their car still in the road. Also....good luck parking anywhere in that parking lot when there is a line in the drive thru. You are trapped. But that's enough negativity... Turkey Club, Breakfast Buzz, D 'Veggie Bowl, Tuna Sandwich, Veggie Burgers, Low Carb Breakfast, Green Tea, the list goes on. They also make a mean Dirty Chai. I wish they were open after 4pm....I can't tell you how many times I've craved it and looked at the clock...right at like 3:55pm. I also like how they come out to the drive thru and get orders rather than waiting for you to pull up to the window that does speed things up a bit.....and the fact that I typically know 90% of the people waiting in line at the drive thru. Nom Nom Nom

-P3jRaOPsCyXPsnjx9zTcQ.text: This was my first trip to D'lish, my business partner talks about this place to no end so I've been excited to try it. It didn't disappoint. I went with the breakfast burrito with chicken sausage and it was really great. They also have almond milk, which I love, so I had a latte with almond milk as well. The food was amazing, very clean, and healthy. They have everything from Vegan, to Gluten Free, and are able to add chicken to anything for you meat eaters. I highly recommend this place. My only criticism is their parking situation is a little less than desirable. It's a very small and tight parking lot, we even saw that someone's car got hit while parked.

Uq0EtvfaZXafsA0OZ5wDVA.text: Cute little shop on the east side of Scottsdale road.  Minimal seating and parking, but of course they do much of their business through the drive thru.  Employees were very friendly and conversational, and the espresso was surprisingly good.  Prices were reasonable.  Will definitely return any time I'm in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

LPFbgRT8__RV81XVDD3bCQ.text: Very cool, delicious, organic/local options, original and fun... Plus service from a bunch of cute, down to earth guys= Awesome in my book. I'll definitely be back!

wFnk8GvISEWizx33Wy1xhQ.text: All I have to say is get the California Club. I live in the East Coast and I still crave for the sandwich. I wish I had the chance to try other things on the menu. The drive-thru concept is pretty neat, but there was a bit of a wait. Guess you can't rush perfection.

4D622C1V6_vU_bwESeQAIQ.text: Awesome concept, love the idea of a health-conscious fast food joint, but as far as "fast" goes I think they could speed up their game for their drive-thru just a bit.  Last few times I ordered food through the drive-thru it took about 10-15 mins for a drink and breakfast sandwich.  Plus, when I got the sandwich it was just a little bit sogalicious. However, today I thought I'd give them another try and sit inside.  Was a little more impressed with their service and food this go-around.  The guys working were cracking me up, very witty and sarcastic--kinda like the personable attitude of a West Coast coffee house; super laid back like hanging in a friend's kitchen.  I ordered their traditional breakfast burrito and it was very D'lish, not soggy but very hearty and filling, eggs were perfectly seasoned and loved the flavor of the salsa.  Definitely willing to try this place again, but from now on I'll probably sit inside or put in a pre-order.  Really wish their hours went a lot later through the evening instead of closing at 4pm. I think they could probably triple their business if opened at night given the location.  Update 08/25:  Just gave this place an additional star...I've been more and more impressed w/ DLish because they've definitely sped up their drive-thru game!  I look forward to continuing my dining business with them again and again!  Would rather support local cafes over any mega-tron monopolies (*cough* Starbucks).  Also, just recently tried their blackbean and quinoa burger...ummm yeah, very DEEElicious, super ++ !

I0xbYMDPfdshkXy75yzXFQ.text: Ive only been there once, but I can't wait to go again. Im actually writing a review because I just looked to see if they were open on the holiday haha anywho, I went through the drive thru and I kept thinking the guy walking around the cars was creepy with his big smile on his face but then once we got up to the window to order, low and behold it was him! He is what every restaurant should have as a front house man and I can't wait to experience D'lish again!

gJ-YKzf6ISMQaI55OPrwrQ.text: People are awesome so nice and the food is great! I love the breakfast buzz and the California club!!

kvgf9dvSEwU8aNEmLhfFiQ.text: This place is really popular. There was constant traffic the entire time. It's worth checking out for sure.

K5Vp6REx7EVUKwpN6jkw-w.text: D'lish is so d'lovely, especially knowing that I can call ahead and order in the drive through on my way! Talk about efficiency. As if the drive-through wasn't fast enough, now by ordering ahead there's practically no wait time! On my way there now!

hG4iK9aKuNdrJD0-FLx6Ug.text: California club : bomb. Turkey club : good. Regular side salad : okay. Protein burger early bird style : eh...too spicy but probably to hide the fact that the quinoa black bean party is extremely bland and dry. Green tea and breakfast buzz were delicious too. Quaint spot, very small, has a drive through but you should dine in or you'll be in line forever. People are saying it's one dollar sign but I think it's on the expensive side...maybe for the type of food it might be one dollar...or considering it's Scottsdale it's pretty cheap lol.

nFQ83biGy-Nmkv1gpuK_Ow.text: Had the frittata this morning - AWESOME!!!!  Not the same 'ol breakfast for sure!

_WQnT_vR3B20KCxLm0bmVg.text: cali club and a buzz = pure bliss any time of day. just wish they were open 24hrs!

D3ocwGMqtqpcfEJm_ZbsQA.text: The California Club and Breakfast Buzz are both amazing

g81F9T_w0YwEygdFui9pqg.text: I read some reviews that complained about how long they waited for their food. I always call in my order. They're friendly servers have it ready when I get there. The Tuna sandwich is very good.

nhKytEz77zajD6prh2VAnw.text: This is one of my favorite lunch spots! The food always comes up quick and everything I tried is amazing, especially the tuna salad sandwich. The smoothies can't be beat and everyone is super nice that has helped me. Will keep going back and back..

CMDF1PGD7KJ0cO4pUOaptA.text: I am a True fan! great for the vegetarian on the go :) DO NOT judge the D'Veggie bowl by its looks because it is fan-flippin-tastic! I wish they would come up with some other creative bowls though, they only have 2 to choose from and only one is for a veg. This place is True to the name, d'effing'lish :)

-PxYtt99FN7U15xKBLiIzA.text: My wife and I were looking for a place to get breakfast on the way to Phoenix Airport. We consulted our trusty Yelp app and found D'lish. It got great reviews so we thought we'd give it a try. When we pulled up, there was a long line at the drive through. I figured this was a good sign. The parking lot is very small and cramped and took some maneuvering to get into a spot, especially with all the cars at the drive through. We wanted to sit and eat so we went inside. The inside is very small and maybe would fit a dozen people comfortably. Luckily, there were only a few others besides us. We were a little confused when we walked in as we received no greeting. Do we just sit? Is there table service? Or do we just walk up and order? After realizing there is no table service we looked at the menu, which was located above the counter. The menu was written very small and was difficult to read. The inside is very loud mostly because of the blenders and the loud music that was playing. It was very difficult to have a conversation there and I could barely hear the woman taking my order. The noise level was so high I can't imagine it's good for the people that work there. I placed my order at the counter and I received a number to place on our table. I ordered the traditional burrito and my wife ordered the frittata. While we were waiting we noticed some not-so-customer-friendly signs. There was a sign that stated no public restrooms. We looked for the restrooms and discovered that there aren't restrooms to use even if your a paying customer. Then there was the old, "We reserve the right to refuse service to anyone." Really? Come on. As a paying customer that really doesn't make me feel welcome. Anyway, back to the food. The food came out promptly and hot. My burrito was in a wheat wrap with eggs, potatoes, bacon and cheese with a side if salsa. The burrito was good, but not seasoned. The salsa was from a jar. I know this because I can tell and it was confirmed when I saw the container of salsa in the kitchen. I would of liked some D'lish home made fresh salsa. My wife's frattata was a baked egg omelette with cheese, and vegetables, hashbrowns on a thick piece of white toast. Drizzled on top was a spicy sauce. They also offer smoothies and vita shakes. The food was good, but the atmosphere and service were poor. I think I know why a lot of people were in the drive through line getting food to go.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast burrito and frittata

oJf50Xx07WUdncRGL5r2SA.text: This is my default to-go for lunch. I have tried the AZ burrito , veggie burrito, frittata and a few other dishes. Never been disappointed with the taste and quantity. Definitely one of the healthier options out there. The service is excellent. I have dined in but generally use their drive thru to get my lunch. When there is a queue 1-2 staff come out and take your orders. Highly recommended for a quick, healthy and delicious breakfast/ lunch.   They have protein shakes also - excellent!!

C4YI1cSMk6mgOVP6YYHn6w.text: I got the turkey sandwich for lunch and I already thought the ordering was ridiculous.  The line is atrociously long so someone comes to your window, takes your order and takes your card so they can go inside and run it.  Then I get my food and they just handed me my sandwich--no bag! Just the sandwich and napkins.  That's just weird to me.  The sandwich was good but not worth all the hype I've heard about this place.

bixXjC_TMPoduJDehBKkag.text: My 2 stars is for the concept. Having a healthy option is awesome. I give 0 stars for customer service. Everyone there seems stressed and they come off rude. I came here for kombucha tea  thinking that they made it there at the restaurant, but they literally pulled a bottle from the fridge and poured it into a cup. When I asked why they don't just give you the entire bottle instead of just a portion of it the guy said they only give you as much as you need. If I'm going to spend $4 on a drink I might as well go to Sprouts and get the entire drink. Such a joke

NXn_8U8QkwLZCPySHmk-dg.text: Hard to find healthy food that tastes so good! I always stop by this place when i go to arizona. Definitely a favorite

B9iPr3kxLDLO-dK7TDZ6IQ.text: When in Scottsdale, I honestly could eat here for every meal.   The breakfast burritos deserve 5 stars by themselves! Each variety of the breakfast burrito is incredible. And, I would highly recommend accepting their recommendations on additional fillings. They have yet to steer me wrong!   The coffee is pretty good too. Being from New England (where we have perfected iced coffee), I am always a little skeptical trying the iced coffee. D'Lish has my favorite iced coffee in AZ. (Yes, I'm including the local Dunkin' Donuts franchise here).    Until the next time I'm in Scottsdale, I will pitifully attempt to re-create D'Lish's amazing breakfast burrito here in RI....

3zTLc9A497P0H19-r6x4Hg.text: There is a place in Arizona where the convenience of fast food meets the benefits of a fresh, quasi vegetarian menu in a salubrious confluence of amazing food and drinks. This place is D'Lish. Didn't see that coming, did you?  While this place is great any day of the week, I usually like to include it in my weekend routine. What is that routine you ask, well I'll tell you. I wake up before sunrise and hike a mountain shaped like a camel. At the top, I fight a dragon who has swallowed a magical key that will unlock a room at the top of a tower that contains a riddling troll who will eat you if you cannot answer his three mind puzzles. After wrenching the key from the bowels of the flying beast, I realize I'm hungry, so I stop at D'Lish for an early morning meal, which delivers every time to satiate my heroic appetite.  The AZ Burro, the Protein Burgers (House style and early bird) are my personal favorites, but I have yet to eat something there I didn't thoroughly enjoy. I even like the frittatas, which I previously thought to be punishment disguised as food.  And then there're the drinks, which seem to have already been covered thoroughly by my fellow yelpers, so I'll just say this: I can see The "Dwayne Johnson" Rock drinking/eating a breakfast buzz. Or at least that's how I like to picture myself when I consume one.  Having devoured my breakfast burrito and protein peanut butter coffee drink, I continue my weekend quest to the tower with the troll, fueled by the life-giving offerings of D'Lish Kitchen and Coffee House.

tYvTgL9CM2WSM-IwD-LioQ.text: Local joint that excels at providing healthy but appetizing food quickly. Food was fresh and the long line at the drive through went super quick.

QSs9LY4uHfuH7PgdSmT5vg.text: I love this place! The breakfast are delicious and the lunches are amazing. I love their black bean burgers for lunch and their breakfast sandwiches for the morning. I love that they have a drive thru. It's convenient and they don't sacrifice taste with it.

lO_5hK132Q06VHlVa6Bxew.text: I love the berry salad in a wrap. But I need my coffee first.  This place has a great vibe and it's healthy and Eco-conscious. What's not to love?

JXbyQ9K9cfxO9eB5pqvR_g.text: So I wanted to write a super good serious review and become like yelp famous and respected but I'm really stoned. The food was really good. Got the southwest rice bowl (I thought it was more of less sauce kinda thing, but there's a lot of sauce, kinda drowned the bowl, still really good tho) and the hummus plate, grade A man,also the breakfast buzz which honestly was awesome :)

omoNjqhNTQAC9AMePFEa2Q.text: This place was busy on a Monday morning. The dine-in experience was clean and prompt. Only complaint is the noise of the coffee grinders made conversation hard.  The food and drink was very good. Fresh and hip. Good options for alternative diets. I have both a vegan and a paleo eater in the family who would be happy with the options.  Drive thru looked very slow, but inside was great!

sSeHsrS7IDcX6bGeEWehKQ.text: What to do before heading out to the ballgame?  D'lish is the answer.    Great place, great local crowd.  Ended up going every single morning of our Spring Training trip.    The first day, we parked and went inside - ordered breakfast sammy's: a California club and a breakfast burrito - with a cup of coffee.  Very good both - but as we watched what the Regulars were ordering and we continued to read and re-read the menu as we enjoyed our breakfast we realized we missed the BOAT (Best Of All Time) - that's right all you Regulars know what I'm talking about - The Breakfast Buzz shake!!! Vitamins, protein, espresso, nonfat milk, peanut butter, banana, chocolate all blended with some ice! Oh yeah, great start and keeps you going all morning!   Oh and you don't even need to get out of the car. - 'cause you don't need to sit down at a table to enjoy it.  Utilize the drive-thru - and you are all fueled up - drink and enjoy as you drive to the ballpark.

J48CGYZvfBTUILHn6it92A.text: I ordered a California Club and croissant. I recommend the California Club. It was so good, especially the green sauce in it. I bet it's their homemade sauce(maybe with basil, I am not sure but it tastes so good). I really wanna go back and have that everyday! Unfortunately, I am not living there lol Beside, they provide drive through but it's kinda slow. I wanted to drive through at first, but I changed my mind then parked the car and sat in the restaurant. It's much faster. Overall, I like the California Club so so much!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Croissant!!
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. CALIFORNIA CLUB! Egg, tomato, avocado, bacon!!!

oV5drlyASBB3Sbcykz_6gA.text: Yum Yum Yum!  OMG, so awesome!  Great concept.  Would love to see more GF/Vegan options but no complaints as what we ordered was delicious.  Breakfast wrap was altered to accomodate my food choices.    OJ was worth the $3!

3U_4AXnh2Sk9u-tHEUjENw.text: Very good kombucha, good coffee, delicious food and fair prices. Local produce, organic food. Yeah, I like this place.

bL95rq_AVEaHygZxMBHy7Q.text: SO good and SO fast! I came with a group of 6 girls and everything we ordered was so delicious. The coffee was yummy too.

eGHvfw9G2fxjMALYTnR9BQ.text: This place is so good!! The staff there are always friendly and are so helpful at helping picking out anything your craving :) menu is not only healthy but delicious!

Se5slUBRis_ZzSpwHBwdVA.text: Food is great but the staff not so much. A lot of attitude from multiple servers. Tempe location is much more friendly and a better environment.

Lbj3NPOI1ZM28zRcHBcAFw.text: I came here for late breakfast and got the AZ burro with chicken. It was delicious and good quality but kind of small. My dining companion got a veggie frittata which was delicious. The pricing wasn't too bad. Although, we didn't get much for the $25 we spent here compared to other sit down breakfast spots up the road in Old Town.   It's not a restaurant in which someone waits on you. There isn't much seating. It's a small shack of sorts.   Their drive thru had a line the entire time I was there which is a good sign. I'll definitely be back.

3MyEYlUHAYnnIHKV78Oi1g.text: Love the fact that i can get myself something while getting a little doggy bag for my fur baby! Also the people there are so sweet!! I just moved here and this is my new favorite spot!

9MEaO1jeelqCjvlqsS5abA.text: the only reason why i'm 4 starring is  LOCATION!! please move to a bigger space!! the line is always so ridiculous and the drive thru is just designed so horribly!!! but other than that i'm still here everyday; food is amazing!!!!!!!

CZIUC1JD-urnb8fUbU369A.text: Definitely a hidden gem for veg. And healthy people. I would come back here again great place to go to for early rising sun people. Beautiful people.

1Y3FpEz50UtQCEiq7qAvEw.text: VERY good, VERY healthy, VERY small! The breakfast fare is delicious, the Breakfast Buzz is addicting and the quality of the ingredients is top notch. Check it out.

6PTV7mXBrV3GnZxcu05fHQ.text: Tried this for the first time yesterday. The California club is delicious. The humanitarian with veggies is also good. The four berry smoothie was good but nothing special. Not a favorite but would try again.

hygzUYZcR1GnKHGlPfxwxQ.text: Amazing food and even better customer service. Line is always long and it's obvious why. You get quality food that's unique and service that is personable. Can't get enough

MbX45vpJMsqGnNNF8T4HpQ.text: Tasty! Tasty! Tasty!  Did I mention that the food here is tasty?!  LOL  I love the fact that they are open at 6am, so hit up the drive-thru and grab breakfast before work.  I've had the Cali Club and the Veggie Burrito.  The cali club is by far my favorite!  The veggie burrito was good, but a little on the bland side (even with the salsa).  Added salt and pepper after the first few bites, and it was then prefect.    This place can get super packed for during the brunch/lunch hour, and the parking lot is really small. so ordering ahead is always advised.    Think I'll go get a Cali Club tomorrow for breakfast!  :D

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Veggie Burrito.
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. California Club

4GXo1C4uWPBVAyclcbSEeA.text: I have to say this place has delicious food!! Found this place off of yelp trying to find a breakfast place to meet all the needs of everyone in our group and this place did its job. I will say parking is a hassle especially when the drive thru is packed. Yes it is a small place but I must say this place is worth it!! I recommend the southwest rice bowl hands down! Can't wait until the next time I visit here just to eat here again.

OMZqrYRavyLy09OQ4e7sdw.text: I've only got the vegan buzz here, but I love it! It's a small parking area, but the drive thru line goes pretty fast. I love having this healthy option as a quick drive through.

QP1RxsS2xJxxyY0saHi8aA.text: A. Delicious + Affordable B. Fast + Amazeballs . All of the above  I've been looking for a place exactly like this. It's healthy, quick, affordable, tastes fantastic; perfect place to stop for lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The greatest thing I never knew I always wanted

fobG4LyRNT5lenOZqpk56g.text: I recommend putting the menu that is at the pick up window for some reason on the other side of the building where traffic backs up. That way when the lady comes to take your order as you're at the sidewalk and doesn't have a menu for you to look at, you could at least see something beyond looking it up on your phone. Sometimes people don't always know what they want as soon as they pull up.

zxvw04xdBttxa0w5qfKw2Q.text: I absolutely love how consistent all the D'Lites are, the South Scottsdale location being my favorite.  Both Nathan and Leonard (managers) are always there with a smile and greeting customers.  Friendly Staff and THE BEST food!

S-4pZAO29wngCxnBckl06w.text: Love taking my girlfriend's daughter here! Vegan buzz is the way to go. Also had the Arizona Burro which is out of this world with their salsa on top.

ICV0JZsidYOgqAgJ4zSXnQ.text: So I come here for the first time in a while and order a ham egg and cheese sandwich on a plain bagel. The person at the counter could not hear me do to the loudness of the blender for smoothies running and puts in the order for a egg cheese bagel sandwich. My order comes out and I tell the person that I ordered a ham egg and cheese sandwich. They bring it in the back without question to change it. They return with a turkey egg and cheese sandwich! So I ask once again with politeness and they scramble to figure out what the issue is and they finally tell me they don't have Ham! WTF! Why didn't they just tell me that in the beginning and I wouldn't have ordered anything at all. There was no apology just that's how it is. What happened to Buisness like this valuing there costumers!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

sVEYB2I0grdZD9jt35eBzg.text: I love this place. Healthy options, you can't ready go wrong. Customer service is always sooo good, (the wait time is expected as you are getting freshly made food) everyone here is so polite and i can't imagine not coming back. My fav place to get breakfast burritos

GMvGwJ-ZusGyqjfMETaPsA.text: The Southwest rice bowl is so good! I hope it's good for you, because I felt like I was cheating on my diet. The one thing I didn't like is the parking lot at this location. It's a tiny parking lot with no way out if the drive-thru is full. Also if you're in the drive-thru and get your order before the car in front of you you're kinda stuck until they move forward. I drove by today and the traffic going into this business was a mess! So make sure you have time when you go.

vBVyf1P2o2wR9Nn-qw6gJg.text: The breakfast here is so good! I've only had the breakfast sandwiches and the breakfast buzz so i can't talk for their lunch menus but I would definitely come here for anything. The food is always fresh and made to order and the breakfast buzz signature drink is so good! There's a drive they which is convenient unless it's too long it's impossible to get in line. the parking lot is also extremely tight and hard to park in. inside is a little small but it's a perfect little place to grab something fast and fresh to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast buzz!
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. California club no tomatoes and on a croissant

8aRz-6bhGpQAVazNIjye8w.text: Woohoo! Fast AND healthy food? That's almost unheard of. I wish they were open later than four pm so I could come in for dinner too. They also have vegetarian and vegan options. The person who helped us was extremely helpful and patient.  Had the humanitarian wrap without feta and it was the perfect summer time meal. Paired great with the pomegranate green. ..and I also drank half my husband's four berry smoothie because it was so delicious. I'll be back to try the black bean and quinoa burger for sure. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Humanitarian veg supreme wrap

EDZB_3odx7uhtV82RhOSmw.text: I love this place so I brought some girlfriends here the other day and they loved it too! We ordered the hummus plate (with no feta) to start which was a great idea of course! For myself I ordered the humanitarian with the broccoli side (no feta) and it was delicious! My friend and the cashier recommended it to me and I was not let down! The cashier was also super nice and awesome! I didn't get her name but props to her for dealing with us without complaints! 10/10

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Humanitarian w/ broccoli side (no feta)!

7eOTCmiTosfuNOQLCVfK6w.text: Great place to go for a healthy breakfast.  So far everything I have tried has been good, especially the breakfast buzz.  I am hooked and would recommend everyone to try this place out.

_7l7YfJL2DpXelHcbzd4dA.text: Sweet place.  Fresh food great coffee.   Fast & great service.  Great Concept for a restaurant.

IXabZ3exsZ0PPvh5xnOLeA.text: First of all, the Breakfast Buzz is a MUST TRY! It's so good & will wake your ass up!  The Top Notch (black bean quinoa) Burger is also really yummy. It's definitely my go to for when I'm really hungry.  I'm not particularly a huge fan of the egg they put on some of their items, it just tastes a little weird to me.  P.S. If your headed to check them out for the first time, keep an eye out for that that turn into the drive thru, it kinda comes up out of nowhere.  I always almost turn right into that "well bar" that sits next to it.

LwZ3o5B69P4mWgOC8lPabw.text: I want to thank the owners for a nice message and apology. I recently gave D'Lite another try (anonymously) and it was very much improved from my last visit. Everyone was friendly and they do what they can to keep the line of cars moving by taking your order before you get to the window.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Oatmeal?

bqNHERzNNigU61pbn5zXVQ.text: Really good breakfast sandwiches and burritos very delicious and filling. The coffee is so good good with so many options to customize it to your taste. I loveeeeee that its a drive thru . its time that there was a better breakfast option that's fast and tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. My ladies huge veggie burro. Very good alot of flavor
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. My club sandwich very good

JVj3tgTPfMksUqXrtCCyRg.text: Some call my love for D'Lite food an ADDICTION. I call it a LIFESTYLE! Heathy food every damn day!

DFozM0nzLfBb3msm4Jtt0g.text: Out of town visitors and this place came up on Yelp. Breakfast buzz and Breakfast were delish! Hit the spot for a quick breakfast without the sluggish feeling. Would definitely come back when I'm back in town.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

WYmELysyYrDqqL1O_FW7Fg.text: Delicious, healthy, and affordable for a great portion size. Conveniently located right next to LA Fitness, it's a great place to stop for a meal or smoothie after a workout. So many healthy options! Can't wait to try more things on the menu!

7iVcFBh78PxqIMKC4IJing.text: Awesome place. Great staff.  Az burro was excellent.  Good prices great coffee. Go to breakfast spot in Scottsdale.  Can't wait to come back

m-HcIxnO0JMcly_JSiTy6w.text: I haven't been for a couple of years because I moved out of state. The Vegan Breakfast Buzz and Green Kale lemonade smoothie were my go to's when I lived down the street. I was looking forward to indulging in these during my recent visit and they did not disappoint! If you are looking for a quick and healthy place. This is it!

hOkpG1u3_j-jJEaRNUKTxA.text: D'lite is one of those businesses that you always go to and shake your head saying "you're too big for your britches." LA Milk Depot is the same way - cars line up down the road waiting in line to get to the window. It is a good problem to have, I suppose.  I've had their smoothies, teas, and breakfast sandwhiches. All delicious. There isn't much to wonder why people clog up Scottsdale Road waiting to get in line for this place.  I also like that the people taking the orders walk down the line and take orders. I'd hate to see the line and how long it took if they didn't.

u5kUx_ozkwqkiZWe_ckj4w.text: This place is great, the food is amazing, the service is great. I wish they had a bigger location but is not a big deal I really recommend this place!

2zeSDG4qZRyZH3eqx7pnmg.text: Favorite bfast joint in Scottsdale hands down! Quick and healthy food. My favorite is the California Club. Their coffee is pretty good as well. Only negative is the location! There's always a line in the drive through out onto Scottsdale road and because of this you can never park in their lot.  But despite always being busy I've never had to wait more than 10 minutes for my food. I'm sad I waited so long to try this place when I used to live just around the corner!

iA6Z2Fz7PkTobD8O5UXRsg.text: Biggest shout out to this location! I was going for my weekly Breakfast Buzz and I got pulled over for having suspended plates in the drive thru, thanks to Nathan (employee at this location) he talked the officer into just giving me a warning! I'll forever be a loyal customer to them now and I cannot THANK THEM ENOUGH. Wish I could give more than 5 stars!!!

yeXlcsTwULYRRP25wTTMLg.text: My favorite healthy fast food place around.  It's not just the typical salad and wrap place.  It's kind of funny because I feel like a lot of places around try to copy D'Lite but they just aren't the same.

qOxnXeuyUVUl7ft2DCrRWw.text: We stumbled across this place one Saturday morning and now I'm obsessed! Amazing healthy menu with great smoothies and coffee too. Don't let the long lines derail you, they move fast and it is totally worth the wait!

fXB4pGTC93SLDJZT8HW3wA.text: Taken in the context of the drive thru/fast casual there wasn't much to say about the decor of the South Scottsdale location.  However, the drive thru line was out to the street if that tells you anything.  I chose the Humanitarian Chix Supreme and the attendant put it in immediately.  Wasn't waiting too long before I got my wrap and headed to the house.  Although I'm not foreign to broccoli in a wrap/burrito I was a bit surprised.  The coupling of cold flavors was pretty tasty.  As far as healthy on the go, D'lite could be the spot.  The location looked small so I don't see myself doing walk-up service at this location.

MIC3vw4UYaEzAd3unpkRww.text: Amazing healthy food and incredible staff!!  new favorite and hope to see more locations in the valley in the future!!

tllnNDTRg5NonZ7xigWXMQ.text: I think this place is really overrated, while I found very cool to have a healthy choice on the go without leave the car, the space for the drive thru is shared with the parking lot, so it's crowded, I felt anxiety just to see the cars behind me and at my side parking or coming out from their spot, besides that the service is very slow not like as a fast food drive thru... I easily spent like 15 minutes on the cars line and waiting...an eternity for me considering this is a drive thru... Now the other costumers were also anxious they started to honk their claxon and well that's not nice neither... The prices are high for the quality and amount of food that you get. And the food is not really healthy at all! I will not come back and I will not recommend to anyone I care, so much trouble just for the wait to open my bag at home and find it's not at i was expecting from a healthy salad spot, no thanks!  By the way there's another salad drive thru a couple of blocks going to south I haven't tried but I will give them a visit to try them.

yKy7cgDQe5Ifvcw9nrq9Cg.text: LOVE their iced mochas, their espresso is amazing, not too sweet like most places. Their California breakfast sandwich is also amazing. Their location sucks and when it's busy the line wraps into the street which makes it pretty dangerous. But totally worth the risk.

E9i7PgCStVvyCGyM7dH4sQ.text: I love their food. However, this location if horrendous for parking. I always call in my order for pick up and the line of cars is literally backed up onto Scottsdale Rd because of the drive-thru. But back to the food! Their Broccoli Side is amazing. Their Veggie d'Lite is amazing. I recommend getting it on wheat bread instead of the flat bread. The flat bread can get soggy. The food is well priced, fresh and always top notch. I know they can't do much about the parking issue, and I will continue to suffer through it because they are my go to lunch spot. As much as I want to shout my love for them from the rooftop, I'm hesitant to because I don't want any more cars blocking my lunch time getaway. If they had a larger parking lot, it would get 5 stars all the way!!

RkWFb_re0oqnEm3lhQMC4A.text: 2nd best Best breakfast place in the valley (only to butters) if you ask me...can't beat the price of this place though. The oatmeal is the grandest oatmeal you'll ever have, so simple yet so delicious. The "oatmeal" part is actually quinoa which provides a great amount of protein and will keep you full until lunch time, if not later. Extremely healthy oatmeal that can't be compared to other places. Overall, such a quaint environment...their name speaks for itself when it comes to the food. The "house style" frittata is also pretty d'lish; it's served atop hash browns and toast, and topped with a spicy sauce. Coffee drinks are above-par.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Oatmeal and house style frittata! GET IN MY BELLY!
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Don&#39;t act a fool up in here...and use the potty before you come
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Small iced mocha to the left and medium iced latte to the right

fk0472sTDzAxIBbzBhhRGg.text: Healthy food (and I mean True, healthy food) on the go, this is your place.  I have been to D'lish numerous times and have tried many things and I haven't been let down.  The club sandwich is PACKED and so so good. My usual go to is the chicken breast panini.
