Also packed with ingredients, my only gripe with this is it usually has a little bit too much pesto but it is still very good. The latest thing I tried was the Humanitarian with chicken. This was so good, it is now my go to meal. The hummus was full of flavor and the sun dried tomato tortilla was excellent.  I've also had their toddy and iced dirty chai and both were good, also.   The wait for food can sometimes take a little while but hey, this place is packed and you can't blame them if it's busy!

O-QO8GNWLDOwnAwiLJYNXw.text: I had heard great things about this place, but when I pulled up I wasn't so sure about it.  It's really small and at 2 o'clock in the afternoon it was empty.  Pulled in and ordered the chicken panini and it's amazing!  The bread is so good and pesto is wonderful!  Will definitely come back to try more!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken panini

jo1iYumJCW1NkIRimysqzg.text: Don't believe the hype. If your looking for a d'lish breakfast or brunch, this place is a pass. The breakfast sandwiches are fine, but nothing special. The chai is lackluster. When I go out for breakfast I like to order something I cannot easily duplicate at home- nothing on the menu is special.   The line boggles my mind. I'd say if you're looking for a drive-through meal your fine here.

HfQ2gaMb_5YYgSbh6vy7Yw.text: Such a great and healthy alternative to fast food! This place is literally down the street from my house and I never had the chance to to try it out since there is always a line. I was not disappointed. The California club sandwich was delicious!!!

uc3zZuuqmmgRUSX6LicWdQ.text: The food is amazing. The cali club and the breakfast buzz are delicious. I've been here countless times and they've never once messed up an order so the staff deserves credit. However, the prices are high, and the lot is tiny. They're supposed to be "healthy to-go" but the to-go process is super inconvenient. Most of the time, the line is backed up into the street so cars are honking at you. Parking is almost never an option unless you want to wait in the drive through line. I'm sure buying another lot next door isn't an option but if it is, it could seriously improve this place. Even with the inconvenience, I continue to come back for the food/service.

AaG8GrAQSAlXDeGgWvDCrw.text: Really wanted to patronize this place, but they don't have the common courtesy to provide a restroom for their paying customers.  Update. Thank you to the business owner for caring enough to respond to my review. Updated two stars for follow up contact.

4YKJbfkebte7hRbNCoiRtQ.text: I've been going to D'lish for years! It's a great local spot that serves on the go healthy food. It's best known for their Breakfast Buzz morning smoothie with espresso, peanut butter and chocolate. I usually get their traditional burrito or Oatmeal their way made with quinoa! All their items are listed gluten free or vegan for customers who have diet limitations!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Their to-go hand stamped brown bags!

ogBDJt3Kp9OyEnGlQOmNig.text: Great breakfast sandwiches. Healthy to-go options. We came here every day on our visit.

K6vEt0ifLXm2XQoinwPwOQ.text: 1. No bathroom or better still, it is inside the dive bar 2 doors down ....  2. Ordered the Oatmeal m, which reads great on the menu, using quinoa instead of oats :) but is served as some sort of soupy substance slopped together w/ out much care Also, they nickel and dime you and then upsell you because they are out of the Rice milk for 50cents extra and have to give you coconut milk instead for .75cents. Just the principle if you are out of a product it's not the customers fault so dont pass on the charged to them, makes me question just how cheap your kitchen quality is....  Put out a sign that you have no bathrooms and uour out of a certain item etc place just wreaks of lazy, sloppy, cheap. Welcome to Scottsdale, AZ. NOTE! Owner reached out, apologized and explained the bathroom situation and felt that their heart is in the right place and all. That said, strongly feel their bathroom situation should be clear on some sign before ordering and update the menus to better reflect what's being served and for how much. Have no probs paying just don't like feeling I'm being duped by some conflicting policy/ menu...

DtjmtAcLblXN22I3JqscGQ.text: Excellent idea! Delicious, healthy food on the go. Their salads are to die for- none of that "tons of lettuce, a little bit of toppings" nonsense... the salads are PACKED with ingredients and have a wonderful balance of flavor.  Just be sure to remember when you're going through the drive-through: everything is made-to-order and perfection takes time.

3XMmVx7_iGHvWLbI3IOuUg.text: They don't call this place D'lish for nothing. They have some really tasty and healthy sandwiches. The place may be very small but the place does have its unique character. They also do serve some pretty good coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

mR2cmjCP1ucZV_qiu85Yug.text: I've avoided D'lish like the plague because the menu was so basic... but fast forward 4 years of residing in Scottsdale and I can't stop chugging breakfast buzzes.  WTF is wrong with me?  I'm seriously addicted to them.  And the humanitarian wraps.  How the hell did these guys make broccoli taste good in a wrap?  Because it's so good!  I come here probably once a week - and it's not even out of convenience.  I'll find an excuse to go, because I've convinced myself that a sugary drink is a "healthy lunch".  Augh.  Anyway, I'm officially converted and I'm not mad about it.  Here's to getting that dukedom #yelpelitegoals.

haoG0X0czUlEAC3FE5Q_UQ.text: Love their healthy menu options and hefty portions. I would recommend the California Club for breakfast or the Tuna Sandwich for lunch! They do a nice twist on all the entrees like adding pesto or honey sauce. Be sure you have plenty of time because they are always packed. If attempting the drive thru make sure you come at it from the South so you can get in line from the street. Customer service is great and will come out to your car to order to make the line move faster.

Y2HtOHwpgy9LBm24V0bjWg.text: Food is delicious, smoothies and shakes are delicious, everything about this place is delicious!

-uYMLk4bMsQGbU0CgUUC_g.text: Found this place on Yelp and everything here is amazing. I try to eat here as often as I can. The buzz is great to. I wish they would open a east valley location. Service is 5 stars, food 5 stars and drinks.   Parking sucks! so carpool here with friends to make things easier. I usually park two buildings down and walk over. IF I am willing to walk 5 minutes in 115 degree weather, You know its worth it!

jmXTNXeNdVDC35rdvSpZVw.text: So the Breakfast Buzz shake... Best shake ever made! As for the food items, I've never been dissatisfied!! All breakfast items are out of this world, and the Southwest Chicken Rice Bowl is simply to die for! Such a better/healthier alternative to ANY fast food restaurant! Hope this organization expands everywhere!!

DmTVOBCH962DTtQrwNnCXA.text: Met a couple buds from the AOB and S (Female). I picked D'lish so really this was all on me. There are just so many negatives to talk about first, BEFORE I even get to the food. First: Parking is a joke. There is such limited parking in the back of the restaurant that you might as well park down/up the street and walk. Second: There is NO BATHROOM. Now, regardless of whether or not this has been grandfathered into the creation of this place, why would the owners choose to have a "sit down" restaurant and then not provide a bathroom. NO BUENO. Leave this place as a drive-thru only and you're fine. As soon as they added the 7 2-tops to the inside and the 3 2-tops to the front porch, they should have added a bathroom. Three: The noise. OMFG. If you're sitting inside, which why wouldn't you, and someone orders a smoothie, fagetaboutit. You cannot hear. It is deafeningly loud. Have you ever been to a Jamba Juice and stood close to the machines when they run them? Well, imagine they picked up the machine and STUCK IT next to your ear. Seriously annoying. And, I will add that I'm obviously not the only one who thinks so because while we were sitting there a few customers sat inside only to move outside after being subjected to the noise and deciding there's no way to have a conversation. Now there was going to be 4 of us and there's no way to seat 4 outside so we tuffed it out inside. Four: Employee. You're NOT right. When a customer complains, brings up something that is making them unhappy or is otherwise not pleased with their experience. Your SOLE job is to fix it. NOT ask questions. NOT make them feel as if they're stupid or wrong. You (employee) simply smile and fix it. I realize it sucks sometimes and you probably want to kill half of the people you deal with on a daily basis. BUT, that's the job you've taken. I'll explain more on this momentarily.  So, T, S (M) and I were waiting for S (F) to show up so we ordered 3 Black Tea's. (32oz $3 ea). We took the 2 2-tops right in front of the counter because the rest of the tables were full. This was when we first realized how loud it was. It was funny but then NOT funny. The smoothie machine was just ridiculous. While we were waiting for S (F) to show up the two tables closer to the window opened up so we moved. Even being 3 feet further away from the noise had to help, even if it was just the tiniest bit.  So now we come to our problem with our server / employee. 2 of our Black Tea's tasted like crap. Actually, they tasted like there was Fish sauce with the tea. T said he thought it was because they were using Scottsdale Tap water. Seriously? Does Scottsdale Tap water really taste that bad? I live in Chandler and if my tap water tasted this bad, I would have moved long ago. The thing is, only 2 of the 3 had the taste and they were all the same drinks. Hmmmm. Regardless, we got the 3rd degree about it when we wanted to change them to green tea to see if there was a difference. There was. Then we were informed that they had gotten a new brewer the day before and maybe this batch, which they brew and then put in gallon water jugs to store, might be the culprit. EXCUSE ME. I assume they've run a few batches through the machine so we all agreed we thought this wasn't it. What I did think was the culprit was the gallon jug of Black Tea that had 1/23 date written on it. I doubt the tea was brewed a week ago, but, the plastic jug could have old dried tea rotting away on the inside. GROSS. Use a jug and then recycle it. Not a place to cut corners.  Onto the food. Only S (M) and I ordered food. I ordered the Southwest Rice Bowl ($8.25).  Steamed basmati rice, chicken breast, broccoli, shaved corn, black beans, enchilada & creamy cucumber sauces, topped with fresh cilantro & a side of toasted bagel chips. This was yummy. I think the portion size was a little wimpy, but the taste was great. Winner winner Rice Bowl dinner.  S (M) ordered The Man Salad ($8.50). House made tuna salad & sliced avocado served on bed of spring mix greens, chicken, bacon, feta, & tomato with a side of black bean azuki chips & creamy cucumber blue cheese dressing. S (M) said this was a great salad. All the flavors mixed very well together. Another winner.  So the problem is, there were just so many negatives BUT the food was great. So, use the drive-thru and get a 5 star experience. Stop and eat there, not so much. Since we ate there, this review is based on our experience dining in.  No Bathroom. Crappy Parking. Loud Machine. Not the best customer service. Great Food. 2 Stars.

7MWyUQuOxKDq0nrT-p8aJQ.text: Had a co-worker do a breakfast run this morning for a bunch of us and I had the Cali Club for the 3rd time & it was D'lish as usual! Can't go wrong here..

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cali Club = D&#39;lish

qAIuXdpUs3yygrhdIvxITA.text: The Breakfast Buzz.....THE Breakfast buzz. Oh my goodness I think this place could get 5 stars just for this amazing morning "smoothie" drink. It tastes like heaven on earth, I'm not exaggerating. Also had one of their California breakfast clubs and it was d'lish as well! I plan on moving to the area soon and I already know this will be one of my go-to breakfast destinations! They also highlight their use of local and organic ingredients whenever possible AND they have a drive-through. We need more places like D'lish across the nation..or at least 10 more locations in the Phoenix metro area to start!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Simply amazing breakfast buzz drink paired with a delicious delicious California breakfast club - hold the bacon. Yum!!!

h---BD9eXcz2kd-DixCAhw.text: Three words on D'lish: Simple, tasty and healthy menu.  My fiance and I ventured over to D'lish after hearing they recently started serving dinner. It's a small, but comfortable coffee house that has indoor and outdoor seating along with a convenient drive-thru for those on-the-go.   We ordered the new "Man" salad, margherita pizza and tomato basil soup. The man salad is quite a combination of flavors. It has a huge lump of tuna salad, avocado, bacon, blue cheese crumbles, tomatoes with creamy cucumber blue cheese dressing. The margherita pizza was small, but tasty. It's perfect for smaller appetites. Not a massive fan of the tomato basil soup. It was a little too salty, but not bad.   All in all, we had a great experience there and will definitely be back to try a few other menu items and the coffee.

jVUx_KbGEugHycrnJtmzXA.text: Friendly staff, awesome breakfast.  If you like to eat healthy organic food, you would like this place.  I tried their "oatmeal our way" which was made with quinoa and fresh fruit and I loved it.  Also their breakfast buritto was really good.  We were in Scottsdale for a few days and we ate there every day.

w0nYBN9DBllNtU9TwEVnwA.text: Excellent food. California club can be eaten for breakfast or lunch!  Drive thru line can be long, but there is about 8 small tables inside.

2TRConO5sju7ADvlytDp_A.text: Coffee is great, soy breakfast buzz is my favorite, tuna is awesome, veggie delite with turkey is awesome, hummus plate is awesome. all of the breakfast sandwiches and burrito are the best. basically everything I've had from D'Lish is really good. People are nice. I can't say enough about D'Lish

JAGhHh-z6_X8nNdnWPoqOA.text: As an out of towner LA vegan, I was skeptical after reading all the rave reviews.  This place is vegan friendly with their Quinoa Oatmeal and delicious coffee!  The guys on duty the Sunday morning we frequented D'lish were super patient and cool.  We'll be back next year during Spring Training!!

xCy4K7QZjlMqSDoDZxCY7w.text: I love Dlish, it is one of my favorite healthy spots to eat. So grateful to have healthy and delicious restaurants like this, with also super amazing and friendly staff. Thanks Dlish, and keep up the amazing work!!!

3LUZDM_SWaXES2P0Jj_yIQ.text: I love this place, we eat here at least twice a week and it's always great!  The service is always friendly and attentive, the food is always delicious and they have the best Iced green tea in town.

2ExR-5dw6AsC8oibWK0cCQ.text: This place is awesome! It's so cute and leaps and bounds better than what it once was.. I love their soy dirty chai! So good. When they first opened they told me they'd have more vegan options soon.. boo, still lookin' to see when that will happen.  Love the drive-thru on a busy day.

x4MrnlhnjrWNebSz4m3izQ.text: Love this place.  No seriously, LOVE!  California club breakfast sandwich = the best thing I've put in my mouth first thing in the morning in a long time.  The house style frittata is unbelievably amazing as well.  Package it all in a cute, small, quaint, local establishment with a drive thru as well and it's a score.

P-rJ-FcgJT_xtm0RYQclvw.text: This place made me believe in Arizona food again. It's easy to think of AZ as a bland cookie cutter city but places like D'lish are helping us gain a culinary identity. Go D'lish!

uN3EBupIZE91ZnEizSy1FA.text: I was on my way to the airport to go back home, so I stopped by this lovely place for breakfast. Before D'Lish, I had never thought to try make quinoa in the morning as I would oatmeal. It was so unique and delicious, as was the amazing egg sandwich and coffee. The guys were incredibly nice and friendly. I wish this was in Austin!

SrJI-3AW6C6QrczbLvU4Lg.text: I cannot say enough good things about D'lish! My fiance and I have never had a bad meal here and we've tried nearly everything on the menu! The services is friendly and fun. The atmosphere is laid back and relaxing. And, the food out of this world!!! My favorite is the Man Salad and California Club - hits the spot every time. For a guaranteed good meal, check out D'lish!

u6FuDcupcX8BgmB4wtQaLA.text: Sooo GOOD! Looking for a healthy find?? This is your place! Super cute, healthy, and delicious!!

kia_6BiQOo_EypJr1Ntjyg.text: I gave D'lish a second chance and the service was much better this time! The guys who work here are funny, friendly, and make you feel welcome. I like that they use all natural ingredients in everything they make here and I think that's why the food tastes so great.

vGEej12cmZIih5UQu4WmeQ.text: The lemonade is amazing as is the tuna sandwich (make sure to get it hot). One of my fav places to get a quick delicious lunch!

deaQKgbYjbeOu40MT-X8QQ.text: I don't like to trash a place based on one bad employee, but I don't think I'll go back here.  I went here with a friend. We place our order and sit down. A few minutes later, our waiter takes our drinks to a table across the room. This table realizes they have the wrong drinks and returns them to the counter. This is no big deal, I won't freak out over this. The waiter then brings the drinks (with the same straws used by the previous table) to my friend and me. I ask for new straws. The waiter then tells me "I just made these and I took the paper off of the straws." Why did he lie about this? I try not to make a scene, but he continues lying to me and refusing to just get two straws for a full five minutes before I reveal that I have watched where the drinks have been, I know that he did not "just make" them, and he was not the one handling the straws. He makes a scene and lays into me with a very sarcastic tone. I didn't eat too much of my meal. When your waiter lies about sanitary issues and mocks you in front of a crowd, your appetite goes away.  This was probably my fifth or sixth visit to D'lish. In the past, the service has been okay and food is pretty good. But I have no problem with never eating here again.

awkjzxgMxoNeM-sixQTAdQ.text: Great food and EXCELLENT customer service. They often have long lines since they make your food to order, but they said they doubled their staff since spring training and have really improved on efficiency. You can also call in your order to pick up if you are really pressed for time. Parking is pretty terrible because they have such a small place that you have to wait for a clearance in the drive-thru line just to leave. However, they really try hard to get the drive-thru line orders in quickly and even send someone out to take your order before you get to the order window.

BnZHbRPiuPHhxFaprwFUbg.text: Can't go wrong with anything on the menu! The Oatmeal our way is magical, toddy's (super charged coffee & espresso) are better than any Starbucks concoction, and the breakfast buzz will hands down change your life!! They say dynamite comes in small packages and this little place is no exception!

V0IhNkwzxU-ZVwl7xJwgZw.text: The Turkey sandwhich was one of the best i've ever had! D'lish is a hidden gem in Scottsdale! Very small, but cozy inside. I tried the turkey sandwhich, and had some ice tea to accompany it! By far one of the best lunches i've had! The service was excellent, I know I will be going back when I visit Arizona again.

Iw68-CRfaH42EJ4g6gI5Cg.text: This place is cute, the food's yummy and the cute bearded men behind the counter made our first encounter even more fun. The hummus plate was delicious and robust...and only $5!  And they have a drive thru.  Can't wait to try it again.

aTMOWuEveTqBoeIrdv3Pfw.text: What a wonderful place to get a fast and healthy drive through breakfast or lunch!   The eggwhites veg burrito is outstanding.   The service is smart , quick and friendly.   This is my new go to place near work!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Eggwhites veggie burrito no potato on whole wheat tortilla

uQWdN4lVOV8Oxnk1db7R2g.text: This place is GREAT! I have to resist coming here every time I am in the area, it is that good!  The California Club Breakfast sandwich is my GO-TO.  The artisan bread on it is so so good!  I quickly saw a trend of EVERYONE ordering the morning buzz, so I had to check it out.  Definitely glad that i did! Great drink to get you going in the morning!   The wait can be long, but worth it.

XmEeTPc2un6ZKQJ0AufD0g.text: Sat at the drive thru window for 10 minutes today without being acknowledge (after reading other reviews this seems to happen often). There were three employees at the counter inside, all of which looked at me but no one came to help. Eventually, after the cars behind me left, I left as well. Only to show up to work late and hungry. I know how delicious their food is but my experience today has changed my views about the place. So disappointed..

l1eUygHThDPLGVZ9BFDruQ.text: The California Club was good but this is a drive through joint with a need for some customer service training. I couldn't even get in to park without being part of the drive through line. So instead of going on, I went though the drive through.  They took orders from the line "portillos" style which is fine, but when I got to the window a woman handed me the bag and walked away. She didn't give me utensils so I sat there waiting for her to return for several minutes. After about 3-5 minutes, I beeped my horn to request utensils..and still waited a few more minutes.

XmVaU-Dy8zoASC11PzDXbQ.text: EVERYTHING is delicious.  I have tried half the things on the menu and I would order everything again..  My favorites are the AZ breakfast burro, the Veggie burrito and the Humanitarian wrap.  You can make anything vegetarian.  Their iced coffee is my favorite in town!    As a heads up, they have peak times that are super busy and there is little to no parking to speak of.  Their drive-through is fairly efficient.    Definitely my favorite quick, healthy restaurant in Scottsdale.

K-xKU62rckdg3YbPZqsyMg.text: I had always heard this place was amazing, but never checked it out until a little over a month ago.  We stopped in for lunch and brought our dog to eat out on the patio.  We enjoyed the baja chicken soup, a southwest chicken bowl, a raspberry italian soda, a lemonade and a dog bowl...everyone was happy and thoroughly enjoyed their lunch!

KsFfu_AmvQVhpR-aJkaR3w.text: First time I came here, I was visiting. After I moved here to AZ, I am still going here! Their quinoa burgers are fantastic. I always get the "naked burger" (served on a bed of greens) so I can skip out on those extra carbs.   It is nice they have a drive thru...went through it once and the gentleman at the window was very friendly. Also addressed me by name (gave him my credit card to pay), which always makes someone feel special! Great service and food!

photos.caption: Photo of D'Lite Healthy On The Go - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. &#34;Naked&#34; quinoa burger served on a bed of greens instead if a bun.

JNRP337AocfNjWyRNQ5OAA.text: walked over today after the parada del sol for a bite to eat. we had the dog and they have a few patio chairs so we could enjoy our meal outside with the pooch.   i ordered the humanitarian wrap...filled with quinoa, veggies, and hummus in a sun-dried tomato tortilla. it was ok, but kind of like something i could just make at home. i had to drip siracha on it for every bite to get any real flavor. i only tasted hummus at the very last bite, down near the bottom of the wrap.   their other options look good, with plenty of choices for vegans, veggies, gluten free'ers, and meat eaters. what knocked the place down a star was that...we saw one of the cooks come outside with her food prep gloves on, buy a box of cookies from a troop of girl scouts standing on the sidewalk, and then walk back inside. i HOPE she took those gloves off and put new ones on. i really, really, really don't want to see the person preparing my food handling items other than my food with those gloves...

9nKQqusYYvZ48zUk8WDz3A.text: Such a great deli! I love this place and can't wait til I visit again to have their shake for breakfast! All my favorite things...chocolate, banana and peanut butter...YUM! And their breakfast sandwiches are DELISH! Such a fitting name. They even have a drive thru! Man, I wish they had one in CO

gE_GBKSj1kEUx7rH8pDQxA.text: You can't go wrong, really. AZ burro and an iced green tea is my ultimate comfort meal. Everyone who works here is so friendly, perfect way to start my day!

eWOJZZWU6-GKtpRyrA6koA.text: Super yummy breakfast sandwiches though I have mine made into wraps. Wicked awesome dirty chai!

jtdkfCmcPNCBd2DraiAqSg.text: Even though the drive through line is always long (sometimes all the way out to Scottsdale road) is worth waiting for that delicious Cali club sandwich.

UVlerIYw8LpzaPwfqSA1Qw.text: Having only eaten here once, I'll give it 4 stars.   The good: had a tuna fish sandwich on toasted sourdough. Yum. Food tasted clean. Also scooped up a Breakfast Buzz (vegan) smoothie. Peanut butter & banana. Daumnnn so so good. I make amazing smoothies everyday in my Vitamix and this murdered my recipe. It has me jonesing for more less than 24hrs later.   The bad: this isn't their fault, but entering southbound from Scottsdale Rd at 1130am on a weekday is a nightmare. Parking is minimal. Restaurant is small.   Big complaints: blender running constantly, and due to the small size of the establishment, it makes conversation super difficult and annoying. I hope they read this review and consider moving it to the back.. (hint hint). Sandwich portion size was somewhat small, and my friend got a wrap that looked small as well. We both ended up buying the Breakfast Buzz smoothie after eating our lunch because we were both hungry.   Overall, the food is bomb. Super clean, healthy, unique recipes. Don't plan on coming here for a quiet date or a meeting. The drive-thru is the way to go, it seems, and ordering ahead would be my advice as well. I'm definitely going back. Sooon.

BQucI-veiA3BHpa93otVpA.text: I got the croissant sandwich and the buzz (a chocolate/coffee/protein smoothie). Didn't take super long after ordering and tasted great...pesto is a nice touch. Parking was atrocious, you have to get creative. Many people seemed to be ordering the burritos (and they also look great), definitely trying them next time.

LVT4XzKufToV1iiQ3rqpWw.text: i also order the california club like others here with coffee. but i made it veggie as i prefer not to eat meet. it was great, they put a veggie Patti which was great.   Its a good place for vegeterians

2vZUCx9l9-fI0kU0ZUsPkQ.text: Not bad, but not the best I have ever eaten! Will I go back? Yes! However after being there 3 times the only food items I think really make the cut are the sandwiches and burritos!

uCeYCgEyOsAMRTeZs0fWqw.text: Eaten here before. Was good. But today I ordered the frittata with egg white and they said they couldn't do it they are pre done. what? Just left no more to say.

x9einkvy4QYO9uFt3jLFQw.text: D'lish is my favorite morning breakfast spot! The California and breakfast club are awesome. They also have a really good protein shake to make the morning count!

w1XUwNgUDT69KRfVtOyFqg.text: I am here every week, sometimes multiple times, and a Breakfast Buzz is where it's at! That is my go-to order, and the chocolate-espresso-banana-peanut butter-protein shake is a little taste of heaven. They have punch cards for drinks, and the staff is AMAZING. They know me by name and always take a minute to ask how I am. I love this place so much I'm going to make them Christmas cookies.

WJm83KTYA8IGVnxFerDHuQ.text: Brilliant business model. Fast, delicious seriously healthy food. Great for Gluten-free, or vegetarians, or vegans, or anything that ends in -Ans.   Small place, order right up at front counter. A ton of crazy delicious items - bowls - smoothies -   Parking can be slightly tricky, especially with the lady in the drive through burrito place next door yelling at me for going the wrong way through her empty drive-thru. Oops.

hD2MEVddYwcIoR4cYCjWxQ.text: Don't bother reading my review, just go to D'lish and enjoy yourself some awesomeness in and around your face.

U8H-dn6Zk5PmldUBXr7ezw.text: This was my first time at D'lish, and while I normally don't eat at organic, healthy diners, this was a pleasant experience! I didn't have to wait to place my order, and the cashier answered all of my friend's questions quickly and courteously. He was also very patient in waiting for us to decide what drinks we wanted since we hadn't planned on getting any until he asked.  The dining area inside is very small, but we were able to get a table even with the area pretty busy. There were plenty of spots to sit at outside, as well. While waiting I noticed that the music was a little too loud. It made talking with my friend difficult at some points. The atmosphere of the place is very chill, though, and it lends to casual dining.  Our smoothies arrived in a few minutes and our food was there shortly after. I ordered the berry smoothie, and it was very tasty. My friend ordered the strawberry-banana smoothie, and it was just as good. For food, I ordered the California Club. It has egg, bacon, turkey, pepper jack, cream cheese, avocado, tomato, and pesto on Artisan bread, if I remember correctly. It was fabulous! Like I said, I don't tend to eat healthy food (I'm a meat and potatoes kind of girl), but this definitely hit the spot. Everything tasted fresh, and I really enjoyed the cream cheese addition. I didn't notice much avocado on the sandwich, though, but I also wasn't inspecting it very closely. My friend ordered the Chicken Breast Panini, and he says it was "delish."  The employees noticed we were sitting around talking, so they came by and picked up our plates and trash to free up some space on our table for us. They were very polite and asked us how the food was. When my friend mentioned I was a Yelper, the employee seemed delighted to hear that. I mentioned that there were good reviews for the place, and he said that he reads them often. It's always nice to hear that businesses pay attention to what is being said by customers!  Overall, I had a great experience at D'lish, and I'll be sure to go back!

pTF48nSdKzRHW4ftj5w5jg.text: Absolutely Love this place, it gives you the local business vibe, along with healthy eating options. The drive thru is the biggest seller for me.  I love the breakfast buzz nothing starts my day of better than espresso in my protein shake.

dyUez3-HJGFS-nuQpc3NSQ.text: Wasn't too happy with this one. Followed the 4.5 star review on yelp and figured we would give it a shot. Coffee was okay, nothing spectacular. The food was not worth going back for. We had breakfast, the frittata and the breakfast croissant sandwich. The eggs were over cooked to the point they were rubbery tasting. The staff was nice but other then that, not a place I would visit again.

lZddSyDGEX60TUlLQGapTg.text: Great little drive thru breakfast.  AZ burrito was excellent.

Qo5GVw9LDPjItrN7uVaMXg.text: Everything I have had here is great. Breakfast buzz and protein burgers are a weekly staple in my diet. Staff is friendly. It can get crowded and limited parking. Must try and you will keep coming back for more!

k_2ia-rkOKq6RvmGdiYiZA.text: Thanks for being on happy cow app! Love finding new places for healthy eating :)

N59jttKQZPiJD24UDTOR1g.text: Went there on a Sunday morning.  Its a drive thru spot but I parked and walked in.  There was no line as almost everyone does the drive thru.  Got the California Club which was super good.  The prices are reasonable and the staff was nice and quick.

kO1O9ItsqZ1j6rGWKHi4uw.text: This place is pretty incredible.  The california club and the breakfast buzz are probably the best items on the menu IMO... but seriously, you can't go wrong.  The only thing I've had that I didn't really care for is the Breakfast Burrito, but that was because it was just a little boring compared to the other choices on their menu.  It's a long wait in the drive thru 99% of the time, but it is absolutley MORE than worth it.

h7k3LdzQMEaEAZaV9cT1kw.text: At first I was confused by D'lish, how can drive-thru be healthy? I walked in to meet a friend and fell in love with the small menu (Side note: I dislike big menus - they overwhelm my indecisive self)! How often can you go somewhere and get a dish made with quinoa, being that I am recovering vegetarian, I was super excited! Then he brought out this "pasta" dish and as the name states it was D'lish! The great thing about D'lish is that each dish is freshly made with locally grown produce. I've been there several times and everything I've had has been refreshingly healthy, balanced, and tastes great.   The owner keeps telling me that I need to come in and try breakfast but since I live in Gilbert I have yet been able to make it over. Maybe one of these Sundays, I'll stumble in my dancing heels from the night before to try their breakfast sandwich and the infamous "Breakfast Buzz" shake, which according to the owner is THE cure for a hangover.   P.S. The hype surrounding the Dirty Chai is well deserved because it is as fabulous as my new dancing heels!

QXDjXoUmXrGDXXp4ieecEw.text: Came here for the first time today and the food was excellent! The workers were friendly and food was ready fast! Such a cute coffee shop and cafe to hang out at for a healthy breakfast or lunch! Would definitely come back!

nod0cQz_4bHpTXrIVKgc5w.text: After 2 years of living in old town I just went to D'lish last week and I am so sad I didn't find this place sooner! I have now been 3 times in the past 9 days!! The food is amazing. I have only done the drive thru and considering the quality of the food, it was really fast! The iced coffee is amazing on staff recommendations I have had the California Club and the Humanitarian Wrap, & I was very happy with both! Today I had the Tuna Sandwich and can honestly say I've never had a better one!! I am quickly becoming a regular, can't wait to try the rest of the menu!!!

AFwvP7IgGlNUX8BkNgzQcw.text: California. Club. All day long. Strangely wasn't really that big of a fan of the breakfast buzz but it was still good.  Maybe too much peanut butter for my taste.

oE5PR5NabBtfm_IB3Yubcg.text: The white guy behind the counter was kind of unfriendly when we came in, we hadn't done anything but walk in the door, hadn't even opened our mouths to order yet and the guy seemed like we were really putting him out by being there, but the Hispanic guy cooking and serving was really nice to us, which is what kept my husband from walking out on the bad first impression.  I'm glad we didn't leave cause the food was great.  I got the low carb breakfast and also sampled my husband's quinoa "oatmeal" (delicious with just the right amount of sweet and fresh fruit) and egg sandwich (cheese to die for and some very good chicken sausage).  My husband's complaint (beside the sort of assclowny guy behind the counter) was that the menu did not make clear that the egg sandwich was a fried egg rather than scrambled and that the oatmeal would be quinoa rather than regular oatmeal.  As we were sitting eating the CSA arrived with the days vegetable delivery.  Buying local from the farm?  No wonder it tasted so good.

SSR2KOEmcDsCnq66SUUheA.text: 7:45am on a Thursday morning is NOT the time to drive thru this place. I have eaten here before and the food was definately better than average. So I decided to stop in for the breakfast burrito, or maybe even some of their awesome oatmeal. Unfortunately, after waiting 10 minutes in the drive thru, and noticeing that for at least a minute the driver in front of us had fallen asleep waiting herself, my wife and I just couldn'rt wait any longer and drove off. Unfortunately, I had to get my coffee and a sub par muffin from Cirkle K AND be late to work.  What makes this somewhat frustrating is that they HAVE 2 drive thru windows that when utilized properly could probably speed up the drive thru process. The first DT window is covered up and NOT used at all.  Just a shame, the food is good...I just won't be driving thru on a weekday morning again. .

CMPGFSbfiNqa1f9mzv6gzg.text: Totally chill is da werd. Extremely friendly and helpful behind the counter. Sociable friendly peeps.

WjGQ1-vJGGNUbNQk4XsnSA.text: I have a love-hate relationship with coffee. I love the smell, coffee ice cream is delicious but I don't necessarily enjoy drinking it. Many times, I just do it for the caffeine. And I refuse to get a hyper flavored concoction that have 3,758 calories. I like to eat my calories, not drink them thankyouverymuch.  Since it's hotter than the 6th circle of hell, I decided for iced coffee. I always pass d'lish on my way to work and decided to finally try it. The interior is tiny, it feels like a cool doll house to me. I had an iced coffee and wow!!!!!! It was amazingly good. I tried another day ( and another and another) to make sure it wasn't a fluke and I'm glad to say it wasn't. My iced coffee has been equally great every single time. I also had a bialy with cream cheese and it was very tasty. I'm looking forward to try their hot coffee once is not  115* out.

Ya1x_Dfj38sdtd2Kz6-8Pg.text: Today was my second time there. Tried the California Club and the Turkey Club. Both were excellent! Iced green tea is so refreshing.

qT8EEs7B78NgN0Y_vlxgPQ.text: One of my favorite places to grab lunch, and do a little work that requires wifi.  I found this place one day just driving around and stopped for a cup of coffee, they had wifi, but I couldn't connect to my vpn.. but that has been fixed and they probably have one of the robust wifi locations around!  But first, let me talk about the food and the service.  It seems like EVERYONE that comes here is a regular, including me.. but no worries, you will be treated like a regular the minute you walk in.  The folks that run the place all seem like they LOVE what they do, love talking to customers and take pride in what they do, which is provide great food with some nice atmosphere.

KSGFcrcoB-89XyTnEgbg2Q.text: Great breakfast and lunch food in Scottsdale.  Very cool that you can do drive-thru and come in for a quick, delicious meal.
